Are reviewers motivated to post a review by negative experiences or positive ones?

I always assumed the majority of reviews come from frustrated customers seeking justice. Perhaps this is more of a reflection of my personal biases than the actual truth. So I looked through the Yelp reviews of restaurants local to Blacksburg to determine whether passionate reviews were more often positive or negative.

Positivity was defined using the Positive-Negative word count differences out of a positive and negative text dictionary. The difference was used instead of the ratio so that truly neutral reviews would start at 0, not 1.

Initial positive and negative word dictionaries provided in text files.

In [1]:
import pandas
import numpy
import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as pp
%matplotlib inline

positives = set(open('positive.txt').read().split())
negatives = set(open('negative.txt').read().split())

data = pandas.read_csv('Homework10.csv')
data

The text is significantly easier to organize once it has all been joined together.

In [2]:
text = ' '.join(data.Text)
text = text.replace(',', '').replace('.', '')
text
Out[2]:
'The tortilla chips were good the salsa was really good I ordered the Guacamole Salmon Salad and it was so good I almost ate the plate that came with it The salmon was cooked flawlessly not overcooked and dry like most places and the veggies were very fresh! The dressing was amazing!Shout out to Lindsay for the awesome service! Thank you This place makes me wish I was a local in this town Definitely a gem! I\'m coming here again!! Nice variety of appetizers and entree\'sWell staffed swift service and cozy atmosphere are main impressions Food was good and put in a medium price rangeThis restaurant is a good one to visit when enjoying Blacksburg It serves as a good alternative to and a regular franchise restaurants or fast food restaurantsEnjoy! Living in Blacksburg for the past 3 years I\'ve heard a lot of goods things about Cabo fish taco When people visit tech whether for football games or family weekend a lot of them people go here Cabo has this neat deal on Tuesday where you can get $3 tacos for certain tacos I generally work in the evening on Tuesday\'s but I had a Tuesday off so I made sure I went to try this place I ordered 4 tacos (2 white fish taco 1 chicken taco 1 salmon taco) and a huge margarita (el toro)! At Cabo they also give you free chips and salsa which is nice to munch on as you wait for your foodThe el toro was huge and also very good The tacos were spectacular! You wouldn\'t think to go to a fish place in the middle of the mountains however the fish tacos at Cabo were really good! My favorite was the white fish tacosOverall this place is really good especially if you go on Tuesday for their deal! Next time when my friends and I don\'t have work on Tuesday we will be sure to stop by This is easily my favorite restaurant in Blacksburg and was a staple of my 4 years at Virginia Tech Great atmosphere especially outdoors in the warm months Close to the bars downtown as well On this visit I started with the Cabo Roll and got the chicken quesadilla with peppers and pineapple for my entree The wrap was delicious- crab is one of my favorite foods and this did not disappoint; It was light and flavorful The quesadilla here is one of my all time favorite foods There are so many different menu items I want to get but always end up going with the same thing every time because it is THAT good The pineapple just makes it special I\'ve tried to recreate it at home but it just doesn\'t compare I will always come here when I visit Blacksburg and I will always recommend it to anyone in the area Potentially my favorite restaurant of all time! TACOS! there is A good reason "taco" is in the name of the restaurant! The tortillas for the tacos are exceptional and that does make a difference The queso was so delicious we ordered two bowls Trio of salsas gets a big thumbs up especially the salsa verde 9 pm arrival after the Hokies loss to BC 5 of us Asked bartender Amy to make us a Casa Noble margarita "spicy" and she delivered! Even checked back with us to make sure we liked it! Alexis was our server & she did an outstanding job navigating us through the menu since it was our first time Lots of great beers on tap and especially glad to see Modelo Negra on tap too Bartender & manager Bubba never stopped moving! Even had time to let me taste the Ballast Point Sour Wench Super spot Look forward to returning especially when we can enjoy the outdoor patio space The place seems a little overhyped Ordered chicken and fish taco Food served was cold and smelled uncooked Lucky I didn\'t fall ill Taste wasn\'t great either The complimentary chips and salsa are good though I\'ve lived in Blacksburg for close to 3 years now and I hate to say but there\'s only a handful of really good restaurants Cabo fish taco is one of them Personally I love fish tacos especially the ones they serve on campus (Grilfield truck) I like going to Cabo when it\'s semi busy because you can really enjoy the ambiance and conversation with whoever your with (especially if you\'re outside) My sister and I started with drinks fried calamari queso to go with the chips The fried calamari is excellent!!! It was light and it melted in your mouth I\'ve been to places where they\'ve overcooked the calamari and it\'s super rubbery and gross But here it was perfect However the queso was like a goopy mess I didn\'t like the kind of cheese the used and it was entirely too thick Funny thing is as I continued to eat it the more I enjoyed The complementary chips and corn salsa was so good Since I loved the calamari so much I got the bangin Baja tacos with calamari with rice and beans What surprised me was how consistently good the calamari was The only problem was the guacamole it has a weird artificial taste Other than that if you love calamari as much as me you should definitely try this out The drinks were pretty good They have a pretty decent size drink selection which is awesome because alcohol and tacos go hand in hand A completely different taco dimension I thought I\'ve had tacos in every possible way one can think of I was wrongI tried three different tacos and my daughter tried one Blacked Salmon - a lot of delicious flavors going on and salmon was cooked perfectly & melted in my mouth! Tofu Chili - I was torn between this and blackened salmon being my fav Loved the deep fried tofu! My fave and have been trying to replicate at home since I tried it here at Cabo Fish Taco! Baja Shrimp - a lot more flavor than the beer bartered It\'s basically the beer battered w/ Baja sauce Both versions were plump juicy prawns!! Beer Battered - batter was crisp & shrimp was thick & juicy! So delicious!!!! Entire experience was perfect Staff was awesome and bathrooms clean If I lived in the area this spot would definitely be my go-to! It\'s amazing how much has changed in Blacksburg since I was a student there and how some things have not changed much at all Cabo is still there on Main Street with only slight menu updates and the same decent food as always The chips with lime are great but not a huge fan of the corn salsa The chicken tacos were ok as usual- never as spicy as I would like but better than a lot of other places Service was friendly and fast It\'s pretty much an old stand by for the town Loved the complementary chips and corn salsa! I ordered the steak taco and the special taco of the day which was what I believe was carnitas (you can mix and match) and the special was definitely the winner Food looked good around the table- no one in my party eats seafood but they all enjoyed what they ordered We also tried the artichoke dip and the unique chips that came with it really made it shine Will be sure to return if I\'m ever in the Blacksburg area again! The chips and shrimp were good but the blackened mahi-mahi was past its date and the guacamole was not home made The guac pasta was also not good and a strange combination I don\'t think this place is as good as chipotle or any other chain Mexican place I come here every time I\'m in Blacksburg! Too good to miss out on They have both upstairs seating as well as outside seatingYou get free house made chips and salsa but I always get the crab and shrimp dip it comes with toasted pita bread! Honestly I probably come back for this appetizer more than the tacos! It\'s to die for!Ever since I got the Soy ginger shrimp tacos I haven\'t been able to try anything else because it\'s so satisfying! I either get the guacamole pasta or jalapeo mashers as a side! Both are good the tacos even better A normal meal usually gets you two tacos but you ask for two different tacos!Fun atmosphere with a fully stocked bar! Mmmmm so good!! Came in on a Wednesday night around 7- it wasn\'t too busy but that made sense considering students were still on break I got the soy ginger shrimp tacos w jalapeo cheddar mashers as the side but seriously yummy!! The shrimp was cooked perfectly and felt plump crisp and juicy to the bite! We also got the salsa trio as an appetizer-- but honestly you don\'t need it the chips and salsa they start you with is plenty enough If anything I think I would get a dip or something to try something different! The cheddar mash was so good but I couldn\'t finish it cause I was so full after the chips and tacos!! Overall really nice place Would definitely go again when I come back to Blacksburg Cabo was a great place for lunchtime tacos We went during VT\'s Spring Break so it wasn\'t too busy; the wait staff was pleasant attentive and laughed at my stupid jokes (bless them)We started with guac and a variety of salsas (when you order guac they give you the whole flight of toppings including a tomato salsa onions etc) Those were very goodI had the grilled lemon shrimp tacos - they were fantastic with just a touch of heat to spice things up The shrimps were generous and the tacos were a good amount of food My husband had a BBQ taco which he also lovedAll in all well worth it for a nice lunch (and I\'m sure a good dinner too) I\'ve gone here more times than I can remember since 2009 (my freshman year at tech) and nine years later I will continue to say this is the best restaurant in Blacksburg I passionately believe a Virginia Tech visit is never complete without a bite at Cabo so when I took my cousins to Open House for prospective students this weekend I knew where to take them for dinner (Spoiler alert: they loved it too)Okay so the first thing I have to say because it made me incredibly sad--the BBQ Mahi Mahi tacos are GONE And I think they\'re gone indefinitely according to my server :\'( The only other issue I had was that the kitchen was really backed upat 4pmon a Saturday This was probably because of all the families in town for Open House I think we waited about 30 min+ for our food to come out The anticipation of going back here after 15 years of being deprived made the unusually longer wait for food even more unbearable The free chips and salsa are amazing but that alone wasn\'t going to suffice I was getting to the point of hangry status But once the food came out it was still amazing I know this isn\'t the norm so I\'ll let it go!Anyways my go-to items are as followsApp: Crab and Shrimp dip This is a MUST There\'s a good amount of crab and shrimp mixed in + the pita wedges are so perfectly soft and crispy Being cream based it can be a bit heavy so if you want to leave room for the amazing tacos you\'ll want to share it with your tablemates (I mean that\'s a given for apps right?)Entree: Get a taco The lightly fried flour tortilla sauces and fillings complement pretty much all of the tacos really well My favorites are the following:- soy ginger shrimp tacos (light and crispy breading with a BOMB sweet and savory sauce)- beer battered white fish (pretty standard and a good one to get if it\'s your first time at Cabo)At my recent visit one of my cousins tried the soy ginger salmon (basically the same as the shrimp one but \'healthier\') and said it was delicious Sides: - Jalapeo potato mashers (spicy but delicious)- Avocado pasta salad (creamy but not overwhelmingly creamy This is a new offering as of maybe 3 years ago?)- Baja rice (pretty refreshing)Don\'t listen to those people (aka 5% of my hokie friends) who say this place is "meh" or "just okay" They don\'t know what good food taste like ;) #CaboCultForever Wow! My son has lived in Blacksburg for the past 8 years and has raves that this is his favorite place to eat On a visit we stopped in on a Tuesday night and I can see why! Nothing but the freshest of ingredients!First who doesn\'t love homemade salsa! This one has corn in it (nice touch) and the chips were warm with just a hint to salt We also started with the guacamole which was the only underwhelming dish we had The mix-ins (onions salsa jalapeos etc) were a nice touch to create your own Nice hint of lime juice as well I got the steak fajitas and they are not what you get from those run of the mill restaurants where it comes on a steaming platter of chewy over cooked meat This was so much better! Seasoned to perfection and tender it came with lots of fresh ingredients to make the perfect fajita! The kid had a chicken quesadilla no onions or peppers He loved it and it\'s great that they will customize dishes adding or subtracting as you want it It proves they make everything fresh! My son of course loved his carne asada burrito He\'s had most everything on the menu and his is one of his favorites The jalapeo mashed potatoes on the side were different and yummy! His fianc enjoyed the carne asada tacos with a side of refried beans (obviously fresh and not the out of a can slop in most Mexican places!) It was a gorgeous dish!Fast friendly service and affordable prices for those kinds of fresh dishes assure we will be back when in town again! The Main Street was closed for an art fair and there were literally thousands of people in the streets 7 o\'clock on a Saturday and the place was lined up out the door 30 minutes wait but first come first served at the bar Boom wide open Must have just been good luck The menu is extensive and a lot of great stuff but we opted for tacos The server was awesome and the service was top notch They were rocking it We started with chips and 3 salsas also guacamole As you can see in the picture the 3 salsas are verde mango and habanero Surpringly the habanero was not the typical heat with no flavor The verde had the most satisfying taste and the mango added a delicious sweet punch up The guacamole came with fresh chopped onion and jalapeo to mix into the guacamole and also some pico de gallo Really delicious We both ordered tacos ala carte I had 3 of the best shrimp tacos I\'ve ever tried Ginger + Soy Banging Baja and Garlic Buffalo They were all delicious The Buffalo was quite spicy and I liked it The place has a huge outdoor seating area too for nights like this when the weather was gorgeous I can see why the place is so popular Oh so delicious! Had the beer battered whitefish and honey salmon tacos with the refried beans Was hard to decide which tacos to choose as several good choices My first time here so I need to thank Nate for being patient and helping me to decide on which two Each taco was unique and had a generous portion of fish and veggies I will definitely be back next time in Blacksburg! Seriously this place deserves 6 stars The food was fantastic the service was even better The only thing I would say is maybe add more tables if possible But other than that I have no complaints one of the best restaurants ive been in a while You guys made it on my food page @jmufoodadventures FOLLOW! Had lunch here for the first time on a Friday with our son and his girlfriend Super cool vibe Seated right away Our server was Marcella who was attentive had a bright personality and gave great menu recommendations Food came out amazingly fastThe tavarua tuna tacos were some of the best fish tacos I\'ve ever had My wife enjoyed the soy ginger shrimp tacosThe tortilla chips they served were better than you get at most Mexican restaurants and had just the right amount of salt for my taste The fresh guacamole was good but had a little too much lime juice for meWill definitely go back next time we\'re in Blacksburg Best food in Blacksburg--hands down My go to\'s are always the BBQ grouper tacos and the lemon shrimp tacos but you can\'t go wrong with any of them The spinach artichoke dip is also to die for A must-try restaurant for anyone new to Blacksburg I LOVE CABO I went here dozens of times as an undergraduate and it\'s one of my first stops every time I\'m in town With the recent (I was told it was done 15 years ago so maybe just recent to visitors like me) remodel it looks fantastic They\'ve done a great job keeping the spirit of the place while upgrading it wellWhen I went recently we waited for 30 minutes for a table while being able to drink in the old parking lot with the temporary bar set up So nice especially since they don\'t have a waiting area to speak ofThe food is always solid at Cabo I got the BBQ maui maui tacos with jalapeno mashers and I was stuffed! Had a nice kick to it too The queso to start probably didn\'t help but it was worth it Take a margarita to wash it down and you\'re set to have a great night Probably I expected too much from the raved reviews Arrived extremely starving Wished chips and salsa were served as soon as I sat down or at least while I was thinking of menu like other Mexican restaurants Server served my first order a special soup but still didn\'t bring me any chips So I reminded of him to bring me chips Maybe the server forgot about it? I was so hungry so his late delivery of chips made me somewhat impatient that time The soup of the day carrot and coconut milk soup tasted interesting Not bad but I was not too excited about it I dipped my chips into the soup Corn salsa which seemed to be raved by other reviews was more like a side-salad rather than dipping for the chips to my taste I would need to order other dipping sauces like artichoke dip next time Calamari was my favorite Crisp batter and very nice texture of calamari Sauces were not much different from other places but calamari tasted outstanding If there were no calamari I would\'ve given even lower ratings at today\'s mealI also had a white fish taco: two tacos brought to me Not bad but probably I was already getting full and didn\'t give a fair tasting opportunity for this main dish! But then I tried corn salsa again Well I found a tiny stone while I was chewing themIt was very tiny but couldn\'t been cracking my teeth! I was lucky enough not to bite the food too hard and was able to spit the stone from my mouth though I showed the stone to the server then manager came to apologize about it Well OK I accepted it and understood it was a mistakebut I stopped eating packed everything into to-go package and left The manager gave me a new salsa for to-go I\'m so sad that one of the popular restaurants in town brought me a stone at my very first visit If anyone ever visit there be conscious about what you chew at this place Loved it! My daughter and I were in town overnight and we were looking for a local non-chain option in Blacksburg We made the right choice! The hostess seated us quickly during s busy lunch hour and we ordered and had our food within 15-20 minutes We both had different types of fish tacos and they were both excellent! There are several healthy options rather than fried which I appreciated It\'s worth a stop! Excellent service and great food! I\'ve only been to Cabo a few times and it\'s always been amazing! Probably one of my favorite restaurants in Blacksburg The servers are always friendly and the food is always amazing So far I\'ve tried the Diablo shrimp salad garlic buffalo shrimp taco honey soy glazed salmon taco and soy ginger shrimp taco (always with a side of the jalepeno cheddar mashers) I wouldn\'t really recommend the salads; the Diablo shrimp salad was good but it wasn\'t great The tacos are really just phenomenal The tortillas are amazing and the ingredients are fresh and flavorful I also absolutely love the jalepeno cheddar mashers as a side This is one of the most accredited restaurants in the Blacksburg area I love the blackened fish taco and the calamari tacos The only reason I am hesitant to give this company 5 stars is the Taco Tuesday deal They advertise that all the tacos are half off however many of the fish and steak tacos are not included Aside from that everything about the business is wonderful and a must stop when in the Blacksburg area The tacos here are absolutely out of this world! I\'m from out of state and I would travel just for the crab dip and Calamari tacos! They have a great alcohol menu and wonderful staff! Their Honey Glazed Salmon Taco is my favorite Cabo is a really good/fun place for friends to hang out over a chat or two They have good service and it\'s not that expensive However at night or in the evening it gets really crowded I love this place and I don\'t love seafood! Yes the name is deceiving Haha they have other meats other than seafood with I appreciate! I really love the Serrano grilled chicken tacos and the jalapeo cheddar smashers! Also get the queso it\'s different which makes it super yum! My boyfriend gets the shrimp tacos and adores them!Definitely a must try for Blacksburg it\'s certainly become one of my favorites in recent months (Also they allow dogs on their outdoor seating! Went to Cabo Taco around 8:00pm the other night for a couple of tacos and a margarita On the margarita note-- the BEST part of our meal Delicious perfectly strong and $2 off on Mondays Love itEverything else was mediocre Our server was one of the grumpiest unpleasant humans who let his frustration out on all of the patrons They were out of pickled onions (which were an instrumental ingredient in the lemon pepper shrimp tacos) and the salsa was pretty much cold corn My side of slaw tasted old and was not crunchy I did ask if I could have other onions in my tacos (perhaps grilled?) but I received an audible *sigh* from the bartender and some raw onions on my tacos Not impressed Oh my gosh! Yesssssss! The only place to eat in the entire state of Virginia! You have def done the fish taco proud The food is absolutely delicious and the server was so amazing! The corn salsa is fresh and corny lol! The beans are out of this world and so flavorful Thank you for the best food I\'ve had my entire visit to Virginia The buffalo style shrimp tacos are the best thing I\'ve ever eaten! One of the best restaurants in Blacksburg Quality food great atmosphere and overall a great experience If you\'re in town for a weekend definitely hit this place Prices are fair for what you are getting I\'ve yet to have a negative experience here every time I the food is beyond exceptional and the staff is very friendly Best place in Blacksburg hands down We arrived for an early dinner at Cabo Fish Taco As soon as we walked through the door I knew this would be a good experience The staff greeted us and led us to our seats They offered drinks and chips and salsa right away The chips tasted like there were home-made at the restaurant and the salsa was fresh and tasty We also ordered the salsa trio which was awesome! Our tacos came; my wife ordered two blackened grouper tacos and I ordered two steak tacos and we each shared one The tacos were amazing but could have been a bit more flavorful but we added some hot sauce and that gave it the kick it needed Overall great service and wonderful food We\'ll be back! Wow this place is amazing C\'mon 757 you\'re located near the water- we need to be able to execute some fish tacos like these folks! My friend is a Tech alum and brought me here as our last meal before the long drive back home Apparently they have a new brunch menu that\'s pretty amazing I love brunch but being my first time I knew I had to try what they\'re famous for - "fish tacos" I went with the Tavarua Tuna Tacos: blackened lemon pepper rubbed tuna in a kiwi-pineapple fajita with fresh greens tomato avocado mixed cheese & topped with honey-wasabi sauce I enjoyed them but sometimes when I inhaled incorrectly I got some burning sensation in my lungs I honestly loved the tacos so much I could care less about the odd spice side-effect I probably will try something else if I get another opportunity because the honey-wasabi sauce was a little too sweet for my liking The jalapeno cheesy mashers was the side I opted with and fell in love I made myself too full by devouring the carbs before my main entree and honestly no regrets That\'s arguably the best side they offer and now I\'m craving those potatoes all the time The salsa that comes with the meal is a little weird I love the pico-esque tomatoes! It was seasoned so well The corn mixed in was on the sweeter side and I think the different flavor profiles clashed It was either eat the corn or tomatoes never combine No biggie I still ate it all~ My friend\'s friend ordered the queso and it\'s delicious It is a rather small serving though The service was quick and if you go on the weekends (especially game day weekends) definitely go when it opens since there\'s a brunch crowd as well My company went with the brunch options but stated how the sauce for the chicken & waffles taco was also too sweet Perhaps opt to order something that doesn\'t sweeten the sauce that comes on your taco(s) The experience the food and the company made my first time here a blast! I wish they could franchise a restaurant near me! Love the college town feel of this place The food is very good-a variety of options that you will not find at other places the service is good even though they were very busy when we were there Make sure you come hungry We will definitely stop in again next time we are in town! I\'m here on business and we came here after working a long day I ordered the blackened grouper taco which was very good and flavorful Only downfall is that the waiter was not knowledgeable on the drinks when asking for recommendations between the two it wasn\'t helpful Overall I would go back and try something else on the menu! Love Cabo fish taco one of the best in downtown Blacksburg First choice to take visitors when they come to town I try to switch up tacos every time I go to try something new--I love them all my favorite is probably the grilled lemon shrimp but if I\'m cheap I go on Tuesdays for $3 a la carte and get a fish and a chicken The Margs are great as well ALSO BIG PLUS IS THE CHIPS AND CORN SALSA THEY BRING OUT EVERY TIME SO GOOD AND FREE very good service and food! the rasta pasta is definitely not for everyone especially because it was much sweeter than i thought it would be my drink was topped off whenever it got half way Fish Tacos away from a body of water can be scary but they nailed it here Fresh perfectly seasoned and beautifully built We tried them all and not one left anything to be satisfied Pick your meat or heat level and you won\'t be disappointed! Cabo is not worth the hype If you are looking for authentic Mexican food this comes no where close to it We\'ve tried this restaurant twice and have been disappointed each time The tacos were greasy and the fish in them did not have much flavor The sides were also disappointing as the rice was dry and hard The atmosphere of the restaurant is clean and nice and the workers are always pleasant but the food is lackluster at best This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Blacksburg The atmosphere prices food and drinks are outstanding I try to make it to Cabo every time I visit Blacksburg They sell every Tequila they are legally allowed to in the state of VA I would recommend a mix of two tacos the jalapeno mashers as a side and a margarita Love this place while visiting in Blacksburg! Great selection of tacos and other menu items Chips and corn salsa are great for the table I had the grilled serrano chicken tacos and they were a little spicier than I expected thanks to the white cilantro sauce so ask if you\'re not sure how spicy you want them! A great go-to for happy hour margs and a quick bite to eat Their homemade salsa is amazing and they keep the complimentary chips coming up until you leave (note: the guacamole is also worth spending a little extra on and they bring you all the ingredients on a nice little platter so you can mix it how you like it)! They also have a nice selection of draft beers and rotate the taps every so often to bring in some more seasonal brewsFor dinner I got a chicken taco and a steak taco (they let you mix and match) - both of which were delicious My go-to side is the black beans and rice which is nothing special but complimented the meal wellAlso it seems that whatever software they use on their tablets to estimate your wait time is wildly inaccurate I have been multiple times during peak hours and have been told that I would have to wait 30 minutes only for them to give me a table five minutes later - not really a bad thing just sort of bizarre Fantastic fresh food! Very yummy & flavorful!! Creative menu without being complicated Whether you eat vegan fish chicken or beef you\'re covered The options are great If you want a certain taco preparation but want to change the protein they\'ll gladly accommodate your request If you can\'t decide between taco flavors they\'ll give you one of each on a platter or you can order one taco a la carte Score for the girl who wants to try everything!! Be sure to get the Jalapeno Cheddar Mashers for your side item It\'s basically mashed potatoes with jalapenos and cheddar cheese melted on top Service/Experience: 4 starsDefinitely can get really busy/backed-up if you go during busy hours (dinner time +/- weekends) Goes to show how popular and well-like Cabo Fish Taco is Never really had any problems/complaints about the service Plenty of seating areas inside/outside but again can get really packed during peak hours My only issue with this location is parking Limited parking in the area so you have to find parallel neighborhood parking 1 block down the road Also the traffic in the area can get quite congested making it hard to turn in/out of the area The best restaraunt in Blacksburg! Cabo Fish Taco to the rescue for unique Mexican flavor and flare! Plenty of different margaritas; I\'ll have to go back just to try another But the real star here are the tacos! We had the BBQ Grouper and also the Banging Baja using calamari that just melted in your mouth! The grouper stayed in nice chunks and how they get the breaded squid to be crisp and tender simultaneously is a trick! Both were served in toasted flour tortillas with slaw and salsa (different types for each) - no soggy tacos here! My one "ok" item was the homemade guac appetizer (we always try the guac to see what\'s up) It needed more seasonings in general but having the onion and jalepenos on the side was applauded by some in our group Call me a taco snob but for the life of me I can not get over the fact that all their tacos are served on flour tortillas What an atrocity for my taste buds! the food is delicious and the service is incredible The drink menu is soooo long and dank! Everything I tasted from the chips to the crap dip to the fish tacos to the seafood linguine were very tasty The food might not necessarily blow you out of the water but it is very satisfying/filling No real complaints there Cabl Fish Taco offers a neat lively environment and lots of variety on the menu I found myself having difficulty choosing between the multiple items that sounded good My main complaint is that getting a table was a pain Cabo does not take reservations so we arrived to the restaurant gave a name and number and had to wait in a small/cramped area in the front of the restaurant for around 45 minutes This was a normal weekday around dinner time in the spring/summer I can only imagine how busy it gets on weekends or during homecoming or parents weekend That being said I probably would eat here again however I would do so going in with some sort of strategy in order to minimize wait time I would recommend Cabo to others but with a caveat The food will leave everyone feeling very content Blacksburg is definitely a college town and the food options tend to cater to students Although choices in the area may be somewhat limited it is always appreciated to have a solid taco spot and some dangerously easy drinking beverages at very generous prices Cabo Fish Taco fills the void making the perfect place to celebrate after exams or to go just because you\'re craving a margarita Cabo Fish Taco despite its name has a pretty wide range of Mexican food (and taco fillings) Chips and salsa are delivered to every table but there are "Small Stuff" such as their house made guacamole or "Baja Shrimp & Crab Dip" that can kick the standard chip dip up a notch Also although the menu advertises flour tortillas I\'d like to note you can ask to upgrade to corn tortillas should you so desire for $1 extra As an adamant advocate for corn over flour I\'d say it is well worth the investment- I just wish the option was more visible on the menu so it wasn\'t necessary to ask Also thanks to the tip from a local we were dining withyou can mix and match the taco types so you don\'t have to commit to one particular variety for the two that come with a typical order As to be expected from the Baja-style they advertise they beer batter everything from calamari to shrimp to tofu I think their specialty tacos are where they really shine though Although the sauce was a bit sweeter than expected I really like the soy ginger shrimp tacos (Beer battered shrimp tossed in a Soy Ginger Glaze served with cabbage tomato avocado and mixed cheese and finished with sesame seeds and scallions)Don\'t forget to grab a drink to wash down those tacos either Happy hour seems to be quite kind going from 3pm to 9pm and offering discounts on already fair drink prices They\'ve got a decent list of margarita options too all of which can be served on the rocks or blended My favorite was the "The Original Caborita" (Made with Jose Cuervo especial Tequila Triple-Sec OJ and fresh house mix) since the others were a bit too sweet for my palateSo if you\'re visiting Virginia Tech or just because you\'re passing through Blacksburg consider grabbing a cheap and tasty meal We went on taco Tuesday not worth any pictures :) Drinks - I ordered the perfect wave (margarita) The server asked if I wanted the single or double I prefer it to be strong/flavorful but I don\'t want a jumbo He said they could do a double in the regular size I said that sounds good! The drink was very weak like juice and he charged me $24!!!!!! For an appetizer we ordered the "house made" guac and chips It was definitely NOT house made It tasted like the packaged guac you buy in a grocery store only to never buy again because it\'s terrible and tastes like pured baby food with too many preservatives They did add peppers and onions to the top to make it less obvious but it was still a far cry from homemade guac! Tacos - just okay we got the taco specials honey Saracha fish tacos and chimichurri steak tacos Overall ~ Underwhelming Always a delicious go-to for lunch or dinner The seafood is fresh and so are the creative sides (think watermelon mozzarella salad) The upstairs is a bit loud with the low ceilings but it is a college town after all Yum! Great tacos salmon blackened and honey Margarita was flavorful along with great service Great atmosphere will always be found here Never been disappointed with any meal big fan of the shrimp and the salmon tacos Outside is set up similar to a beach restaurant sand is included The kids it It is located conveniently off of Virginia Tech It has limited parking so it might be easier to park at the pay parking ($1/hr less than 5 min walk) or neighborhood parking The portions are pretty big but the food was not worth the price Furthermore the guacamole pasta salad had more onions than it has avocado Love this place! Food is great  and wait staff always friendly and helpful I always make it a point to stop and eat when traveling for work Cabo is one of the best spots in Blacksburg! The menu is outstanding and the margaritas are to die for We were in town on business for a month and ate every Tuesday here! The calamari may be some of the best I\'ve ever had if you go it\'s a must get! Service is prompt and they have a fantastic atmosphere! Recommend this place to everyone Most unique spot in BlacksburgBuffalo garlic shrimp is my go to All the sides are fantastic Tons of different margaritas I recommend the Perfect Wave Corn salsa was very fresh I ordered steak fajitas but got salmon fajitas I\'m definitely glad they messed it up The salmon was cooked perfectly and had tons of flavor Definitely will go back when in the area Wow! Some of the best tacos I\'ve ever had! This place is always disappointing The drinks are mediocre the food is a weird combination of Mexican Tex-Mex and southwest Virginia and the atmosphere can\'t decide whether it\'s catering to undergrads or families Whenever I decide to give it another chance I regret it Always has great service and great food The waiters are always very conscious of my allergies to make sure I was safe The food was amazing and they have great deals for college kids on taco nights Cabo is key to the Blacksburg experience Stopped in on a sunny Saturday the patio seating was nice Chips were crispy & salted the salsa had fresh tomatoes on top but horrible Green Giant corn niblets on the bottom We ordered the BBQ grilled Grouper which was delicious just the right seasoning & a little heat The tortillas were soft but did not break and held the filling together The beer battered white fish taco needed some type of sauce or salsa to liven it up My black beans and rice contained more of the corn niblets Overall I would go back & upgrade this to 4 starts if they would just get rid of the corn niblets! The food just isn\'t good I went here once just after moving to Blacksburg and again a few months ago Their corn salsa is bizarre Watery bland and not something you would find in Mexico There is nothing even close to authentic on their menu The tacos are sad flour tortillas wrapped around too sweet meat It\'s not cheap and it\'s not deliciousservice is 4/5did not use bathroom Definitely our favorite dining spot over the past four years when visiting daughter at VA Tech Consistently good food drink and friendly staff A great place to ease the pain if you are paying out of state tuition premium! Wait was long as we anticipated seeing it was a Saturday night but I would consider driving down 4 hours again for their stupid amazing crab dip and warm pita bread triangles and their stupid amazing tacos I dream about Cabo fr fr y\'all Great food very fast service The dining space is cramped and crowded--expect to be shouting throughout your meal but anticipate an energetic and lively dining experience My dad and I sat in upstairs for dinner somewhat secluded from the main dining area and it was still loud Parking is also very limited Still 3/5 star-worthy because of the great food and the quick and friendly service Dined here the Friday night prior to VT playing ODU so the wait was pretty long little over an hour We did some shopping while we waited and the wait was well worth it! We started off with the Baja Shrimp and Crab dip to start off our meal delicious and a huge bowl we could not finish We each ordered fish tacos; I ordered the Tavarua (Tav-A-Roo) Tuna Tacos my husband had the Garlic Buffalo Shrimp Tacos and my beautiful niece (a student at VCOM and real catch guys!) had the Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos They were all fantastic best I\'ve ever had Our server was great too! Will definitely return here when back in Blacksburg Best tacos I\'ve ever had! Can\'t wait to come back here next time we visit Blacksburg! Great place with very friendly staff Extremely good food especially tacos of course I often take friends and family here when they are visiting Will get busy during the semester I have had the privilege of eating at the DDD flagship Cabo in Charlotte plus 3 visits to this Blacksburg location The Cabo patio is the place here as Charlotte\'s patio is the porch area in front All the dining areas inside and out are comfortable and inviting Service is always good southern hospitality is key The staff are all attentive fast and enthusiastic The food is always good you can\'t go wrong with any choice The tacos are puffy which is a nice touch and not very common you will dig it Variety is apparent and there is no problem mixing and matching items the servers will help They get it right I tend to complicate my orders and each time here the delivery to the table was accurate My blackened Tuna Taco and Tequila Rock fish taco really blew me away 2 is enough for me but I was so tempted to get 2 more Trying to practice a little more will power Cabo Fish Taco is the MUST Try restaurant in Blacksburg VA! Cabo is the best place to eat at in Blacksburg and it isn\'t even close Everything on the menu is delicious I have been over a dozen times and can\'t complain about a thing! Easiest 5 star rating I\'ve ever given I was delighted to find such a decent place to have Mexican food in downtown Blacksburg Service is attentive and food is worth the money I ordered the Fajitas with steak and my friend ordered the Epic Tuna Burrito we both satisfied with the taste and portion Outdoor eating is available Beers are served Oh my gosh I\'m usually not a huge fan of tacos and normally I never crave one but I could eat the taco\'s here for daysThe tacos at Cabo Fish Taco are amazing Not only do the ingredients taste fresh but they\'re full of flavor as well My favorite component of it was probably the taco shell I absolutely LOVED the texture -- it was chewy yet crispy with the perfect amount of flakiness I\'m not sure how to accurately describe the shell but it was hot and deliciousI got the lemon grilled tuna with baja rice and my friend got the blackened mahi-mahi The baja rice was okay to me but the combination of the fish and the sauce that came on top of the taco was extremely flavorful and tasty; however I would recommend not getting both the blackened mahi-mahi and lemon grilled tuna because I found that both fishes tasted very similarOverall really good service and food! It leaves you feeling pretty full because of all the complimentary chips and salsa and the perfect tacos to top it off! ---------------------------------Overall:- My first visit to Cabo was in 2009 and it was an actually an accident we were looking for another restaurant but couldn\'t find it Nevertheless years later it is still my FAVORITE restaurant in Blacksburg Campus food will always beat out the surrounding restaurant but if I have friends visiting this is my go to place THE STAPLE DISH: Do not leave Cabo without getting the shrimp and crab dip I don\'t care what else you order but you MUST order the shrimp and crab dip You will thank me later and regret that you did not try it sooner ---------------------------------Attire: - Very casual ---------------------------------Cost Estimate: -Shrimp and Crab dip ~$10 (YOU HAVE TO ORDER THIS) - Margarita ~$7-8 - 2 Tacos ~$10-11---------------------------------Occasions to visit: - Happy Hour with friends- Guest are in town visiting - Date night - Celebration dinner - Quick and filling lunch ---------------------------------Dcor: - A very rustic interior with wooden tables and wooden booths Some tables will have metal high top chairs as well- The interior is larger than expected There are two floors a sun room like area and outdoor seating I would say Cabo can usually accommodate parties up to about 10- Very dim lighting Sometimes it\'s a little hard to read the menu or you know take a good food pic - Outdoor seating is especially nice for the spring summer and fall Metal table chairs and an umbrella to block some of the sun---------------------------------Service: - Depends on the night and the crowd I\'ve had great service and I\'ve experience very slow service This however should not be a reason to deter you from trying Cabo ---------------------------------What to order: - THE SHRIMP AND CRAB DIP Again I will say it over and over you HAVE to try the shrimp and crab dip The pita has a crisp exterior but when you load up that bite with the dip you get a euphoric experience of flavor and texture The pita is soft and fluffy on the inside and paired with the hot creamy dipyou will die in tex-mex heaven I have dreams about this shrimp and crab dip I would drive 4 hours for this shrimp and crab dip If I could swim in this dip I would dive right in Order it Order it now! - Soy Ginger shrimp taco This is probably the most flavorful taco It\'s sweet it\'s sticky it\'s delicious - Beer Battered Fish taco It\'s so simple but so good! For those who want a more mild flavor profile this is the taco for you - Jalapeno mashers Is it spicy? If you want it to be Cabo now places the jalapenos on top so you can customize your spice level It\'s the best side dish I wouldn\'t even mess with the other stuff - SHRIMP AND CRAB DIP Ok I\'ll stop but really you have to order it This has always been a personal favorite restaurant of mine! The food is amazing the staff is very nice and it\'s in the heart of downtown Nopalito salad is bean salad with a teensy bit of nopalitos in it IF you have a bite with a sliver of cactus you MIGHT taste it Don\'t count on itThe tacos are excellent though They are 2 per plate We got different orders and traded one The barbecue mahi-Mahdi was very tasty The tuna with wasabi sauce was fantasticThere are many variations of margarita on the drinks menu And mine wit jalapeos was very tasty There was just enough to pepper to tasteReggae playing in the background was a plus I\'ve been to Cabo tons of times since I came to Tech and I\'ve received amazing food each visit Every time my friends or family visit this is where we bring them The waiters and waitresses are very friendly and the service is great The food is 100% worth the price and wait Will continue to come back! This is hands down the best restaurant in Blacksburg!! I live in Miami now and I constantly crave Cabo Whenever I\'m back in town this is the first place I visit It\'s that good To start every table gets complimentary chips and chunky salsa The chunky salsa is some mix of tomatoes jalapenos corn and cilantro- fantastic way to start the meal For your main meal you HAVE to try their tacos Any of them They\'re all good My favorites are the lemon grilled shrimp or the calamari You get to choose 1 side with your tacos and I always opt for the guacamole pasta salad- it\'s amazing Their margaritas are also quite good! For those on a budget they have the "El Cheapo" or "Workmans" margaritas that are under $5 Finally the ambiance is fantastic The building was constructed in 1848 and was originally a church The decor is interesting and the staff is always super friendlyMake sure to try this place if you\'re ever in the area- you won\'t regret it!! This is probably one of the best places to grab a bite near Virginia Tech campus We were there for lunch during one of the move-in days The restaurant was busy as expected We were seated rather quickly But there were people waiting for tables during the whole time we were there The service was friendly But since they were so busy we did have to try to get their attention to get more water to get our bill and even to pay for the meal We were sharing a burrito They split the burritos and mashed potatoes in two separate plates That was really niceThe complimentary chips and salsa were interesting I thought the chips were a little too thick And I did not care for the corn salsa that came with the chips We had steak burritos and steak tacos The Steak tacos were good and very flavorful The steak burritos had too much beans and a little too salty in my opinion but it was still very good  The mashed potato that came with the burritos was delicious Wonderful selection Unique place with a friendly atmosphere We love sitting outside and the propane heaters make it available even on chilly evenings I am partial to spicy shrimp tacos Get the soy ginger tacos you\'ll thank me laterEl Cheapo margarita is also really good for a good price Usually busy and loud but the food is always good and the servers nice I love this place! I\'ve heard a lot of good things about this place from friends and family so I was excited to finally try this place You can definitely tell it\'s a popular place for the locals and students They give you free chips and salsa but I wasn\'t a huge fan of it The salsa was made with fresh tomatoes and corn but since I don\'t like tomatoes I only ate the corn The chips were alright; I\'ve had better My sister ordered the Banging Baha shrimp tacos (this is one of her favorites) with jalapeno cheddar mashers and I got the daily special - jerk shrimp taco - with the guacomole potato salad I got a taste of both and they tasted pretty similar to me which isn\'t a bad thing since I thought they were still good However I expected my jerk shrimp to have more of that spice flavor Regardless I enjoyed my tacos and the sides and understand the hype about this place If I get a chance to visit Blacksburg again I would revisit to try the other options The fish here is amazing My tuna burrito was like heaven in a tortilla The Baja rice was seasoned and sweet Even though it was crowded our waiter a med school student managed to find time to help us find the right meal as one of our party members had food restriction I would recommend this restaurant for anyone in the area My sister my daughters and myself had dinner here after watching a movie It wasn\'t very busy I suppose because it was the day before Thanksgiving and most of the college students have gone home My sister and I ordered the specials and split them with the kids She had (if I remember correctly) the blackened mahi mahi with lemon cream sauce and I had the Korean BBQ steak tacos We shared an appetizer of shrimp and crab dip Everything was flavorful and amazing The crab dip is addictive and definitely a must-try Amazing food and fun atmosphere in a really cool part of town As a visitor to Blacksburg I was impressed I didn\'t think fish tacos as good as these existed in so far away from an ocean The shrimp tacos were on point! I don\'t understand why this place has 4 stars I guess these reviwers drank gasoline or something beforehand The corn and salsa dip can easily be made at home and is at best mediocre The chips were great The fish tacos I had (tuna /tuna) were like puke being stuffed into my mouth Yes I scarfed them down but not because they were good I was afraid if I took a second to really taste what I was eating I would puke it back up The service on the other hand was great That was the main reason why I didn\'t complain She was so nice and cute so I decided to just suffer through it It was honestly a big waste of money 4 stars for the service 1 star for the food Cabo is still my favorite go-to place in Blacksburg for something light healthy and affordable I had the Soy Ginger Shrimp taco this timeI absolutely loved the crispy shrimp glazed with a sweet sauce The cabbage inside the tacos gave it a nice crunch and also gave them some color The tortilla was also warm and crisp It doesn\'t matter how many of chips and salsa I had prior to the meal (every table gets a complementary appetizer) I don\'t feel bloated after eating the tacos You really can\'t go wrong with any of the tacos here I\'ve never left Cabo Fish Taco unsatisfied! Pretty good place Service was good and decent draft beer offerings Free chips and salsa was nice Really enjoyed my tuna taco with a side of guacamole salad Typical college town type spot Nothing too special as far as atmosphere Will go back to try some of the other tacos Just thinking about Cabo makes my mouth waterEvery time I visit Blacksburg I go to Cabo And pretty much every time I go to Cabo I order the same thing: Buffalo Shrimp tacos and an El Cheapo margarita The shrimp tacos are spicy and satisfying and the El Cheapo (made with a combination of orange and lime juices) is only $4 With the tacos you also get the choice of one side I generally get the jalapeno mashers but like to try the rotating special sides tooSome of my happiest memories in college involve sitting on the patio at Cabo eating the chips and corn salsa that come with the meal and sipping margaritas You cannot beat the experience that Cabo provides ***I should note that the first time I ate at Cabo it was after a decent amount of protest I insisted that I didn\'t like fish tacos so I wouldn\'t like Cabo I was wrong on both counts - it turns out that I do in fact like fish tacos (after giving them a try at Cabo) But even if I hadn\'t there are plenty of delicious meals on the menu that don\'t involve fish! Being from out of town we were directed to try this place I was very happy The ambience was nice the service was phenomenal and the food was greatThe food is rather simple but it was delicious fresh and very flavorful I would certainly return if I were in the area again! I split the tavarau tuna tacos and the Mahi Mahi tacos with my coworker and enjoyed them both I would highly recommend the tuna tacos They bordered being a little too sweet for my taste with the honey wasabi sauce but the tuna was cooked perfectly and the homemade flour tortillas are on point Favorite restaurant in Blacksburg Can\'t get fish tacos like these anywhere else (Man I miss college and Cabo) Loveeee their chips and salsa too And love the Beachy vibes of the restaurant I don\'t know a single person who doesn\'t love Cabo From the salsa they bring out when you first sit down to the tacos to the margs and everything else in between Their margaritas are great because they don\'t taste as sugary and syrupy as other margarita mixes and they have a large selection They also have every brand of tequila known to man You can\'t go wrong with their tacos I personally love the grilled serrano chicken but I\'ve tried others and they\'re delicious too There\'s just something about the white sauce they put on top All of the sides are great but the jalapeo mashers are definitely the crowd pleaser I\'ve eaten here more times than I can remember and it\'s just as amazing every time I go back I really wish I could find one closer to me since I no longer live in Blacksburg and can only eat there when I visit (shoutout to Nova - can we get a Cabo up here?) But I go back every time no matter what the wait time is I\'m always pleased when we go to Cabo It\'s easy good food and great Margaritas! The Gold Coast (I think that\'s what it\'s called) is my favorite We love sitting outside on a beautiful summer night Cabo fish taco has always been one of my favorite restaurants in Blacksburg I love the ahi tuna tacos and bbq Mahi Mahi tacos but some of the other options on the menu could be spiced up (I love spicy food so it\'s a personal thing) Best Margs in town!! Stopped here because I used to frequent their Charlotte location and was excited to see the original I was alone so I went to the bar The bartender literally rolled his eyes when I sat down as he dropped a menu in front of me A couple sat at the bar a few minutes later (there was no one else at the bar other than me) The bartender started talking to them and stayed there until I left about 5-7 minutes later I love the food at Cabo in Charlotte but the service here is horrible If you want some really good food go to The Black Hen & Bar Blue The lamb chops are AMAZING! I really enjoyed my meal here this weekend! The restaurant was packed but worth the wait time The service was good so good in fact the waitress informed us our orders were messed up in the kitchen but had free queso in hand to make up for it I had the lemon grilled shrimp tacos and a jumbo el cheapo margarita The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the toppings and tortillas were delicious The margarita was a little sweet for my taste but still very good very big and the price was right! ($8!) My only complaint was the rice I had gotten on the side It was topped with something sweet which made it gross But it\'s still one of my favorite restaurants in Blacksburg! My coworkers and I absolutely love Cabo! Everything is great - I personally love the soy ginger shrimp tacos Yum! The staff is always friendly :) Cabo Fish Taco is one of my absolute favorite places to eat down in Blacksburg I went there often with my friends during my undergrad years and I always try to eat there at least once when I go down to visit Appetizers: The complimentary chips and salsa they give you are very good The salsa has chunks of corn tomatoes and cilantro It\'s very fresh and flavorful and we usually finish the whole thing before our food comes out! Their Baja Shrimp and Crab Dip is THE bomb At first you can\'t really see the shrimp and crab but once you bite into it you can definitely tastes the chunks The pita slices that come with it is so warm chewy and just a perfect compliment to the dip The Spinach and Artichoke Dip is also very delicious This was my favorite appetizer at Cabo until I tried the Shrimp and Crab Dip Their Crispy Calamari is also quite good and doesn\'t have that I guess "fishy" taste calamari from other places have but I think I would choose one of the dips over this Salads: The Diablo Shrimp Salad is very fresh and the portion size is HUGE The shrimp are jumbo sized and super plump My mom and sister took one bite of mine and then kept coming back for more During my most recent visit I ordered the Sweet Blackened Tuna Salad but they had run out of sashimi style tuna so my tuna was cooked well done Although I was a bit disappointed I couldn\'t get the sashimi tuna the salad was still very delicious Their mango-pineapple chutney is also very fresh and flavorful My mom loves it over her rice Tacos: I usually get the BBQ Mahi Tacos which are so delicious This was what I got when I went to Cabo for the first time and it was the reason why I fell in love with the place Cabo definitely does not skimp on the huge chunks of fish they put in the taco and all the ingredients are so fresh and flavorful My mom is usually very picky about food and she didn\'t really want to go to Cabo when I first brought it up After one bite of this taco she also fell in love with the place and we\'ve been back about 3 times together since I also usually get the baja rice as my side which is rice with their mango-pineapple chutney over it The mango-pineapple is very fresh and adds a very refreshing splash to the rice The Bar:They have a nice selection of beer but I usually get their Original Caborita Margarita You can definitely taste the tequila and it isn\'t too too sweet which I love Overall the service is great the food is awesome and the drinks are super yummy They also have outdoor patio seating I definitely recommend giving this place a try! I love this place! I decided to branch out of my comfort zone as I am not a fan of seafood and my friend was visiting and wanted to come here It was SO good I got the blackened mahi tacos and she got the chicken tacos and the calamari tacos Calamari and mahi was delicious and chicken was pretty good as well Their avocado pasta salad is great as a side Keep in mind I am not a fan of seafood so for me to say both types were delicious is a pretty big deal! I love cabo and will keep coming here as long as I\'m in school Had the Mahi BBQ with mashed potatoesAbsolutely delectable! Total package in terms of tortilla and fish with the BBQ sauce to top it off My mouth waters just thinking about itCame back the next day for lunch getting the Tavarua Tuna with the baja rice Again the tacos were exceptional The rice was pedestrian especially compared to the flavor punch of the Wasabi from the Tuna tacosService also great Friendly and helpful staff Really cool spot to check out in Va Tech territory! I love this place It is hands down one of the best restaurants in Blacksburg I have probably gone here the most throughout my whole undergrad career and when I come back to visit my friends and boyfriend I always have stop by! Everything is always fresh so don\'t get mad if their menu changes or they run out of something - that\'s when you know they\'re the real deal! If you want to get drinks I\'d suggest their mojitos (again my favorite) or their silver surfer margarita (classic margarita taste but they never get it wrong)! They also have a full bar with a large selection of beers but I don\'t drink beer usually so I can\'t really give any advice on that! To start their complementary fresh chips and corn/tomato salsa are delicious Every time I go my waiter/waitress has had to refill at LEAST once :P If you\'re looking for another appetizer the spinach-artichoke dip is incredible! They serve it with fried pita wedges which are amazing Now to get to the main stars the tacos! Definitely do not miss out on trying the soy ginger shrimp tacos Like I\'ve said in other reviews shrimp\'s not my favorite but these are lightly fried in a delicious batter and then glazed with the soy ginger sauce This combination with the fresh cabbage is just happiness in your mouth The BBQ Mahi tacos are also something you should not miss out on trying! Since I\'ve eaten here so much I\'ve tried all the tacos and these two are the best My most recent favorite were the soft shell crab tacos but it was a special just for that day and the next time I came back they weren\'t serving them! Sad day If you\'re looking for advice on their sides the jalapeno cheddar mashers black beans and rice and the baja rice are the best ones However they have most recently changed the recipe for the jalapeno cheddar mashers and I do not love them as much as I did before They now dice up pickled jalapeno and add them to what are now just called "herb mashers" if you want jalapeno Definitely changes the flavor and isn\'t as good as it used to be Other than this recent change I am still in love with Cabo Fish Taco! It was my first visit to Blacksburg and my younger sister (recent grad and reason for my visit) said we will be coming here for lunch Even with it being graduation weekend we managed to get here early enough and my 9-person family was seated immediately The service was excellent-- informative and attentiveThe corn salsa and the shrimp & crab dip were awesome and immediately brought me back to my visit to the Charlotte location last year Both items were superb For my entree I ordered the BBQ Mahi Tacos with the Jalapeno Cheddar Mashers Like my Charlotte visit I loved the tacos I ordered Also like my Charlotte visit I was underwhelmed with my side The mashers had a great spice but were dense lukewarm and lacking seasoning One of my sisters ordered the Tavarua Tuna Tacos also with the Jalapeno Cheddar Mashers as the side and she agreed with my underwhelming sentiment but thought the tacos were excellent The Baja Chicken Bowl my other sister ordered was large and had a unique presentation It had good flavor but the chicken was a little dry My mom ordered the seasonal veggies with her Blackened Mahi Tacos and seemed to enjoy both So in my personal opinion a couple of the side items need some improvement (I ordered the Baja Rice at the Charlotte location and also wasn\'t impressed) With that said it was an overall enjoyable meal and great visit I would come here any day of the week for the delicious taco options I highly recommend trying the Shrimp & Crab dip if you come here Quick reviewCame here while visiting friends at VTech It was lunch time on a Friday so it wasn\'t busy I didn\'t explore the entire restaurant but it looked like a chill place for the night crowd I enjoyed the BBQ Mahi tacos with the blacks beans and rice Will definitely eat here again the next time i\'m in town! Agh This place should not have a 4 star rating  Maybe 3 but surely not 4! The artichoke and spinach dip is kinda bland and is missing something It tasted more like melted cream cheese with sprinkles of artichoke and spinach The pita chips that are served with the dip are fried unnecessarily and topped with cheese At $850 it is an overpriced appetizer The bbq fish taco basically could be bbq chicken/beef/tofu because you wouldn\'t know the difference since the bbq sauce over powers the fish I guess this food is best eaten when drinking since anything tastes good in that state This is nothing like the fish tacos in California so don\'t expect delicious fish tacos - rather passable food Great atmosphere friendly waitstaff and delicious food If you have to wait during the dinner rush it\'s well worth the wait Great for family dinners and date nights! It might seem a bit pricey at first compared to the sports bars etc but it\'s well worth the priceThis is definitely more upscale than your typical college bar and the prices definitely reflect it but so does the quality You always get some complementary chips and dip to start off the meal They have some killer dips followed by some tasty tacos that really hit the spot I\'ve had the Soy Ginger Shrimp Tacos and the Tuna Tacos and they were both flavorfuk and juicy As far as the dips go you have to get the Baja Shrimp and Crab Dip! The margaritas come in so many flavors that it can be hard to choose which one but all are great tasting! Definitely try the soy ginger shrimp You can also mix and match taco styles Food was ok I just couldn\'t get past paying $30 for a tea and four tacos Very expensive for what you get The Cole slaw was not cold and the battered white fish had so much breaking in it you couldn\'t taste the fish Husbands beef tacos were tasty but seriously not for $6 a taco Went there for Taco Tuesday with $200 tacos and some drinks Had a great time and the server put up with the rowdiness of my group The tacos were good but I wouldn\'t go on a day when they are their normal price of over $6 for a small taco Love the soy ginger shrimp (Best taco on the menu imo) and their happy hour and specials aren\'t that bad either I go here pretty much a couple times a semester over the course of going to VT Food price could be a bit cheaper since apps and a main will cost you an average of $20+ Good food great price/value good selection of craft beers and very prompt and friendly service Highly recommend the Buffalo Shrimp Tacos not so much on the Blackened Tuna Tacos Still worth the stop Oh Cabo - one of my go-to spots when I was living in Blacksburg Reasonably priced food (especially for a college kid) that\'s unique in its own right among the other dining establishments in Blacksburg I\'m a fan of the BBQ/blackened mahi-mahi tacos and the beer-battered fish tacos (you get two tacos per order but keep in mind that you can order two different tacos!); the shrimp and chicken burrito is also a good choice They\'ll start you off with a delicious corn/tomato salsa with crispy tortilla chips (I miss that so much!) and their margaritas are pretty solidService is very friendly and casual (as it should be for a beach-ish shack in the middle of downtown Blacksburg) They have indoor and outdoor seating as well as a pool table upstairs Check out this place next time you\'re in Blacksburg! Very convenient to campus Several trips here across seasons (essentially with students and without) have not disappointed The drinks are ok with good selection but food is real draw In most recent visit our group sampled wide selection including guac queso artichoke dip fish tacos fajitas bufallo shrimp tacos baja bowl and everything was excellent Service was ok when bustling very good when less crowded Having gone to the Charlotte location of Cabo and fallen head over heels for their delicious seafood taco creations I had to give the Blacksburg version a try on my trip up there recently to visit my long-time friendThe exact same menu as the one in Charlotte I couldn\'t stray away from ordering one of their specialty seafood tacos mostly because of how delicious I had remembered it being in the Queen City My friend advised me to get his favorite option the soy ginger shrimp tacos assuring me that they are a life changing experience Quite a tall claimI don\'t know if my life was changed but I do know that the tacos were darn tasty The slightly crispy shrimp were complemented by the soy ginger glaze and slaw and topped with avocado tomato and cheese all resting inside of two flour tortillasThere is an extensive choice of sides to pick from and I wanted to get something different from what I ordered in Charlotte for comparisons sake but couldn\'t bring myself not to order the jalapeno-cheddar mashed potatoes Cheese Mashed potatoes Spicy How can you say no? Trust me it\'s awesome My sister got the fajita burrito and my cousin ordered a seafood pasta both of which looked really good but if I went back I would keep checking a new specialty taco off my list before I ventured on to the rest of the menu Such a classic spot for Blacksburg When I look back on my years in Blacksburg Cabo will always have a special spot in my heart that I will missAll of the tacos on the menu are made fresh and are absolutely delicious The beer battered white fish tacos have such a great batter and the cilantro white sauce is so delicious with the flavorful fish and the crunchy slaw I love the seasonal sides they offer too! The food here is better than you would expect in a college town The seafood items are of good quality and prepared in a tasty way The specials are unique Fantastic service and atmosphere Tyler was our server and he was GREAT We told him what we liked and he found us the perfect craft beer Food was wonderful especially the lemon-pepper grilled tuna tacos Will be back! And thank you Tyler - you\'re an asset to Cabo I visited Cabo Fish Taco after hearing rave reviews from some of my Hokie friends The food was good and the service was quick and friendly Although I do not like seafood there were plenty of options and I ended up getting a steak burrito with a side of cheesy jalapeo mashers (aka mashed potatoes with jalapeos and cheese) My friends got fish tacos and loved every bite There is definitely room for improvement in the queso and salsa department but other than that no complaints! I love cabo Depending how busy it is they will not fry the calamari for the tacos When it\'s a slower day usually during the week I will get the calamari taco If it\'s the weekend I will get a taco with a different kind of fish Their food is amazing The only downside to this place is the wait on busy nights This is my go-to place in Blacksburg I\'ve probably been here 20+ times while at Tech and love everything about it The servers are all chill but they also take good care of you and I like that when they\'re busy you can head over to Starbucks and get something to drink while you wait or get something at the bar The queso and the guac are great and are cheap as compared to other places but their complimentary salsa is the bomb by itself I used to get a BBQ mahi taco and a lemon grilled shrimp taco but the soy ginger shrimp taco changed my life The baja rice is also where it\'s at My friends love the jalapeno cheddar mashers but it\'s a little too spicy for me so I stay with the rice Definitely recommend to anyone coming into town to visit or go to a game it\'s worth the wait Friday night dinner party of 4 - 45 minute wait VERY WORTH THE WAIT! Also their sides are always unique and quite good Super Americanized Mexican food but definitely worth trying if you\'re in the area We had great service particularly attentive to our kids We really appreciate that And the food came out fast  However the food was nothing to right home about The beer battered fish tacos I had were almost flavorless The avocado that was supposed to be present was non-existent and they laid the fish on a bed of cheddar cheese Who does that to a fish taco? Lastly the kids meals were supposed to come with fresh fruit but instead came with canned pineapplenot exactly fresh  To conclude great service but mediocre food Wait time was a little leas than the 30 minutes we were told in a Friday night ( before a game) but it was so worth it Quick friendly servicemeal recommendation of Soy Ginger shrimp was perfect An absolute favorite spot in blacksburg! BBQ mahi tacos and the avocado pasta salad are my go-to and never fail to satisfy :) I get carry out and dine in pretty equally and both are great Cabo is mostly a hit If you can sit outside it\'s a winner every time Margarita\'s are a hit high or low end and most things on their menu are just delicious However on this last visit I was very disappointed in the changes to the Jalapeo Cheddar Mashers These used to be one of the reasons I craved Cabo and this time I we all left them in the dish Bring back the original seasoning and you bring back some fans! My absolute FAVORITE place to eat in all of Blacksburg It\'s pretty much a crime to not stop by and get the ginger soy shrimp tacos with pasta salad on the side if you\'re in town I crave this food in my sleep Seriously though I can\'t give this place enough stars If you don\'t have time to order in just call ahead for pickup and they\'ll have your food ready at the bar in ten minutes or less! Possibly my favorite food in all the world actually Great service too! You won\'t be disappointed ----UPDATE: Jan 15 2011As promised we gave Cabo its second chance Drum rollThis time we were joined by some of our awesome friends And from last time\'s experience we weren\'t expecting a lot Well we were definitely proven wrong Cabo fired back with authorityFor starters our friend Kat had gotten the Veggie Roll and was kind enough to let me taste it One word: Glorious It is portabella and wild mushrooms yellow squash zucchini and the usual works It was presented in sushi style (bigger portions) topped with tequila lime aioli This was also served with salad on the side I had requested to have a sample of their Soy Ginger Shrimp Taco and the Tavarua Tuna Taco The soy ginger taco came with beer battered shrimps that were tossed in a soy ginger glaze stuffed with cabbage tomato avocado monterey jack and cheddar cheese topped altogether with sesame seeds to taste The shrimp were juicy and plump; tasty and savory good The Tavarua Tuna Taco was delightfully fresh; definitely not dry this time around You can taste all the ingredients well and how they complemented each other on your palate To pair I had a glass of their sparkling potable Cabo water The Lover is not as adventurous and as random as I am He ordered the Carne Asada Steak Burrito again This time it was not disappointing for he devoured that thing in 2 minutes --- the whole thing! Good? I\'d say it was a lot better than the first one (Beer pairing to be posted soon The Lover isn\'t here and I can\'t remember for the life of me what it was he drank that night) The tortillas were fresh And like last time the masher was AMAZINGSo overall Cabo has proven to be a respected taco joint in our book We can\'t wait to try more from their menu and maybe even try the bar atmosphere next time Give me a chance! The food here is great Probably the best Baja-style Mexican food in the county Even the drinks are adequate The problem is the service Cabo Fish Taco over and over again has the slowest service in town It doesn\'t matter how many people are being served do not expect more than two drinks per three-hour meal I have been here over seven times in the past 18 months due to the food but we always leave frustrated due to the poor serviceIf you want to have a one drink one menu item lunch meal this is a great way to spend your lunch hour If you want to even add a water to your bill however be sure you have an additional 45 minutes to spareThe staff are friendly just not forward-thinking The building facilities are not that clean or accessible Cabo Fish Taco knows that they have caught their corner of the market and are doing nothing to exceed the expectationPrices are on the upper end for Blacksburg (so well below other towns) but are appropriate considering the high-quality of the food5 stars if I were only rating the quality of food/drink 1 star if I rate any other category beside food/drink I now only visit when I have people from out of town who may of heard of this establishment No other place in town can beat their taco but if you want anything else visit one of the many other Mexican choices in the local area Delicious food and surprisingly lots of options The outside seating is a plus and the beer battered white fish tacos were to die for! Loved it! Gotta say I travel all over the world and when I am in Blacksburg VA this is the only place to eat Not many places I like eating alone but these guys do it right  Service is terrific and the food is "just right" Lots of great flavors with the tacos and the supporting cast of apps and sides are just as good If you are visiting Virginia Tech make sure to stop by! Can\'t wait to try it again I\'m gonna bring the whole bowling team next time The Boring Brothers bowling bonanza Cabo is in a great location across from the VT Bookstore on Main Street While they are always busy service is fast and the food is generally pretty good The margaritas are also tasty (try the Pomerita or Purple Haze) We usually get the queso dip and chips for an appetizer and the shrimp and blackened mahi tacos The tacos could use less cabbage and more guacamole but the seafood is always perfectly cooked and plentiful I love the fact that they fry the flour tortillas - how unique is that?!  Getting a free side is also nice and my favorites are the jalapeno mashed potatoes and mexi-slaw with toasted pumpkin seedsWith their low prices we always go back and are never disappointed It\'s funny that there is a second location in Charlotte (where we live) which we have never tried Somehow this just feels like a Blacksburg destination to us and we certainly don\'t want to mess up that good feeling! I am currently eating the leftovers from my visit to Cabo this weekend I ordered the barbecue mahi-mahi taco with the "Mexi-slaw" on the side Mmmm I did not expect a Blacksburg restaurant to leave me so sated for so cheap! Cabo\'s reviews on Yelp were a mixed back lots of 3/4 stars with the occasional 2 star thrown in there I have to say that we had a great dinning experience there I knocked off one star for two minor issues The frozen margarita that we got could have been a little tastier (but was loaded with booze) and the corn salsa was kind of weak Oh and we found that everything needed a few shakes from the salt shaker - which might be good for some of you low sodium peopleThe food was awesome though I got two tacos and mixed it up a little bit by getting one bbq mahi and one garlic buffalo shrimp The fish/shrimp tasted fresh fresh and the sauces were flavorful The jalepeno mashers live up to their reputation My fiance got the tuna burrito - kind of weird sounding but very tastyBlacksburg has needed a place like this for a long time Go! my dearest cabo fish tacoit\'s been so long since i\'ve last seen you how i miss your cheesy queso dip and funky chlorine-smelling lobby how i long to hear the crunch of your battered white fish tacos until we meet again & eternally yoursclaire Yah this is the freshest and best-tasting Latin food in Blacksburg No question about it Baja feel tacos bowls and salads You also HAVE to try the crab dip It will change you forever!
