Great vibe Fantastic food Our server in training was friendly and made the experience divine Lots of drinks and specials Love! Great food Soy ginger honey wasabi and basic whitefish are all delicious A must try for anyone looking for something that is uniquely blacksburg Insane tequila selection as well Short wait at lunch Four of us tried 4 different entree\' and the fried calamari appetizer Everything was excellent except the beans and rice Beans and rice was not very flavorful and the rice was kind of rubbery Other than that we will definitely try this place again when we\'re in town again I used to work in the kitchen here so I\'m a bit biased in my opinion I think the menu is great - it\'s SoCal-influenced fare (NOT Mexican) and is unlike anything you can find in Blacksburg or anywhere nearby The fish tacos are delicious especially the BBQ Mahi tacos as are the tuna stacks and most of the burritos (Wasabi Tuna was my favorite while I was there) There\'s only one caveat to the food I think: it depends on who prepares your food This is probably true with any restaurant in a college town but I\'ve had some very good food here and some food that really let me down and I can always tell when it\'s someone who likes to cook and does it well versus some schmuck just trying to make a dollar and doesn\'t care about the end product The usual giveaway: the temperature and consistency of the taco shell It should be warm and crispy yet pliableAs far as the bar is concerned you\'ll probably end up drinking with a number of regulars/locals/employees Cabo has the best margaritas in the area quality-wise (El Rodeo will give you the best bang for your buck with the Texas Jumbo Margarita) and if tequila is your thing you\'ll be right at home Cabo offers every tequila available through the ABC in Virginia; last time I checked that was 72 different tequilas If you finish them all (over time) you\'ll get your name on a plaque and maybe even a t-shirt or somethingParking can be a pain in the ass but there is a parking garage over in Kent Square if you need a spot You run the risk of being towed if you park at the Bookstore across the street All in all Cabo\'s definitely a nice change of pace from the normal Blacksburg restaurant and bar I\'d definitely recommend giving it a try Walking in the door of this place at 117 S Main was a flashback to 1978 when it was a nightclub by the same name! Looks about the same- except less sticky LOL The food was excellent as was the service Prices were reasonable Highly recommended The food here is perfect beyond belief The BBQ Mahi tacos are incredible rasta pasta and chicken fajitas are really amazing also If you need a drink they have a full bar and a good bar staff They also frequently have bands and DJs which makes for a fun timeTwo bad things I can say about this place:1 The parking is awful Too small but there are places to park within walking distance2 It\'s busy and noisy It\'s a college town and this is a popular place so that\'s expectedEven with the 2 negative aspects I still give this place 5 stars If I could give 6 I would There are only two Cabo locations but check out the episode of Diners Drive-ins and Dives that features the Charlotte NC location It\'s pretty cool Easily the largest Tequila selection in Blacksburg and maybe in Virginia We had the in house fried Tortilla Chips and Corn/Cilantro Salsa I recommend the Queso Dip too Working Man Margarita Salmon and Guacamole Salad with a vinaigrette dressing Blackened Mahi-Mahi soft tacos Most of the signature tacos come with two tacos and a side I got the re-fried beans Chocolate Lava Cake for dessert YUM The place has surf boards and twisted metal fish bone art on the walls and a relaxed college crowd and a staff to match I love this place the shrimp tacos they have here and the yummy margaritas I have to give it three stars though (which still means A-OK!) Their sides are AWFUL The only time I have enjoyed their sides is if they have a special of the day side that I tried I especially like the spicy grilled pineapple a side that I wish was permanently available but is only available once every month or two If cabo could get their sides up to the quality of their entrees and drinks they\'d be the toast of the town My second review because I am now obsessed with getting Cabo for carry out It usually only takes them 15 minutes or less to get the food ready and I can pick it up on the way home from work for a relaxing evening with my boyfriend which is now my new favorite thing to do in Blacsburg HahaMy side note is this: I agree with everyone who says it depends on who cooks your food Last time I ordered there I couldn\'t finish my second taco because the fish did not taste fresh and a twice my mashers were completely flavorless Other times its absolutely perfectmy favorite comfort food in this town!! :) Though it would please me if they\'d figure out who the dumba$$ cook is who is messing up their food Best margaritas ever! Food is always great as I\'ve tried a dozen different items off their menu and have never been disappointed Descent little taco joint All of there tacos are pretty authentic or as authentic as you can get in southwestern Virginia Can\'t say I have just one favorite but the name sake fish tacos are a pretty safe bet Definitely the best patio drinking spot in Blacksburg Still cant get over the cheesy mashed potatoes as a side item I dont care if they do put jalapenos in them it\'s still mashed potatoes at a taco placeweird As for the service just bring your own cooler of beer to the patio or be prepared to wait and wait and wait although the water did come out quick just not the beers or margaritas so part of that can be blamed on the bar staff Cabo has amazing food and nice ambience Perfect for when the parents come to visit! I definitely recommend getting their signature fish tacos (they\'re two soft tacos btw) if you eat seafood There\'s like 5 different options of different fishes and shrimps to choose from like Mahi Mahi Beer battered white fish And it comes with a side too All of the sides are really delicious but I get the baja rice because I like the sweet kick it has If you\'re a vegetarian there are (kind of) two options for you One is a veggie burrito with a side pretty much like the signature fish tacos but just one tortilla instead of two tortillas The other is the exact same thing just with rice in it So if you\'re not feeling too hungry go with the regular veggie burrito They\'re delicious and cheaper than the fish tacos! Let me just start off by saying that my fiance and I frequent Cabo a few times a month for the following reasons: 1) The food is good and consistent - I typically get either the chicken or tofu tacos and they are yummy! 2) The service is good and when you run out of salsa (this happens in like 5 minutes for us) they readily bring more chips and salsa 3) The atmosphere is awesome and the decor is unique Eat the fish tacos; you won\'t be disappointed! If you\'re looking for classical West Coast food but on a middle class budget this is the place for you Served on a lighter than air tortilla each taco has beautifully cooked seafood and the freshest veggies Sit outside if you can because its a bit dark inside I went here with some friends before moving out of Blacksburg and I have to admit I wasn\'t impressed Maybe I just don\'t like fish tacos but theirs was pretty gross The fish was breaded and deep fried and smothered in a nasty mayo-like sauce I\'ve had fish tacos elsewhere that I\'ve liked but theirs is so rich it makes your stomach queasy The atmosphere was nice and the wait staff was friendly but their food wasn\'t really anything to write home about The only place outside of the southwest that I\'ve had an authentic tortilla Their fish tacos take me back to Puerto Piasco Mexico and the corn salsa is great If you want baha-style Mexican food Cabo is the place to go PRO\'s: strong (and reasonably priced!) drinks; great atmosphereCON\'s: This is NOT Mexican food If you go with this in mind you won\'t be disappointed in the food It\'s pretty standard American fare with a slight hint of Mexican flavors Is it as good as you would find on the West Coast? No Are you kidding yourself if you think you would find something like that in Blacksburg? Cabo has an extensive list of margaritas that are all super yummy! It\'s worth going here just for that fact Besides the yummy (and strong) drinks they make Cabo also makes some super delicious food Their fish tacos are great (imagine that) But I strongly recommend the Sweet Blackened Tuna salad The tuna was seared to perfection and topped with an apple raisin chutney and the greens were both fresh and refreshing Cabo\'s website says it was created with the "idea of combining coastal Mexican cuisine with a healthy California feel" I think they accomplish this The food is stellar The atmosphere is fun and relaxed You can sit inside in a sort of veranda or outside I suggest outside regardless of where you sit it\'s always a good time at CaboJust be prepared that if you like frozen margaritas that\'ll cost you an extra clam or two Fantastic laid back atmospheregreat when it\'s warm out! the best you\'ll get in Blacksburg And I am partial to anywhere you can sit outside in downtown My family hails from California and I lived in Colorado most of my life I have also been to MexicoThe food at Cabo Fish Taco is miserable Mexican miserable tex-mex and miserable California fusion Bland watery the salsa isn\'t even good Canned corn is the base of it with not enough red onion cilantro and absolutely no kick I only went there twice because the second time someone else was deciding and paying I\'ve tried their fish tacos the burrito grande the chicken tacos and an appetizer southwestern roll thing i kept trying other people\'s stuff in hopes that something was palatable Even my Azularita was weakHorrid Do not go there I miss this place It was one of my favorites in the burg when I lived there I was excited to find out the abandoned looking building across the street from the off campus Tech Bookstore was going to be a fish taco place The tacos are really good the chips and corn salsa was delish the salads were a little salty and the fake sushi-esque rolls were so-so I have tried the wraps and burritos as well but can\'t remember if I was wooed by them or not Oh and I enjoyed the cheap margsOn a different note: There is a tequila club here where you get a card with your name on it And everytime you take a shot of a specific tequila you can check it off the list of 50+ tequilas I definitely did not join the club however my friend did He vowed to complete the card in one summer It was a very drunken summer for him and me who tagged along for support I asked if he won a tshirt or anything he said no just the satisfaction of checking off every tequila on the card! hahahaha Aww I miss the drunken days/nights of blacksburg! The food is decent but there\'s nothing exceptional or interesting about it It\'s a shame that the menu isn\'t a little more interesting When I go I get the bbq mahi tacos or the epic tuna burrito which are two of the better items on the menu They do have good margaritas and a huge tequila list They also have a pretty nice patio outside so it\'s a great place to go in the summer with friends for margaritas Excellent fish tacos! We have a junior at VT and this was our first time at Cabo They will let you try different tacos on your two-taco order The Tavarua (tav-a-roo) Tuna Tacos and BBQ/blackened mahi-mahi are definitely recommended Staff is very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu and the IPA is cold This place will be a regular stop for us from now on! Great mexican food with american flair at fair prices I have been here several times and have never been disappointed This is my favorite place in BlacksburgI go in about twice a week It\'s pretty quick prices usually range about 8 or 9 for a burrito or tacos with a side It has a baja southwest theme and they have an assortment of tuna shimp mahi mahi for their taco and burritos also chicken and steak as wellThe shrimp an crab dip as an appetizer runs about 7 and is probably the best thing on the menu Decent priced drinks Margarita Monday you can get a basic margarita for 250 They\'re usually playing some type of reggae music yeah I\'m not sure how that fits the baja theme either The wait staff is pretty cool on the hippie sideOn nice days you can eat outside I sit at the bar most of the time because I am a regular but you also have an almost separate non smoking section too I would hop a plane to Bburg just for Cabo well almost! Love this place! Plenty of menu options for all your friends and the buffalo shrimp tacos are to die for! Inside and outside seating and you can grab a couple drinks and play pool upstairs if you have to wait for a table And for Steppin\' Out 2007- they filled the entire parking lot with sand how can you not love it!? This is a great place to grab something light to eat The tacos and burritos are great The bar staff is always friendly Good selection of beer and spirits Tons of different tequilas to make your night interesting It\'s great to eat on the patio when it\'s nice out Inexpensive and fresh food - GREAT place!Only negative is lack of on-site parking Only 6 or 7 spots in the gravel lot You can find some parking north in the neighborhoods but would be easier to walk there But this is true for anywhere in downtown Blacksburg Be sure to try the Epic Tuna with cabbage! I love this place It has a good options for various food restrictions and staff is wonderfully good-natured and helpful I highly recommend it for anyone who wants a laid-back delicious meal (it will fill you up for sure) Just be warned they don\'t take reservations and get extremely busy so you might want to try early dinner or lunch or wait a while to get seated at normal hours That\'s the only negative and that\'s only one because everyone else loves them too! Great place Have been here twice while in town for business Waitresses are awesome Food comes quick It can be a little loud inside when the place is packed but it\'s really all about the food which is outstanding This is a great place to go if you sit outside and order one of the fish tacos The inside atmosphere is loud and crowded with students I have always enjoyed the fish tacos and a workman margarita When I have ventured out to try other entrees I have invariably been disappointedThe side dishes are also lacking in flavor Luckily the tacos are sufficient and worth going for We go about once a month during good weather Did takeout so we could eat at the hospital nearby Loved the BBQ mahi tacos and the carnitas The soy ginger shrimp tacos were too sweet for me I didn\'t enjoy the sides: black beans and rice and the rice with mango chutney or whatever The jalapeo mashers had WAY too many jalapenos Scrape them off and they were great The best part was the crab and artichoke dip and the fried pitas Wow! Delicious! based sauce that smacked of laziness on the part of the cooking staff that prides itself on "fresh ingredients" To make matters worse the dinner did not sit well so I think I am being generous giving food in The cilantro white sauce was some cakey tasteless sauce and very minimal filling Again the tortilla was fried in rancid oil The calamari was slightly better since I drenched it in aioli Ive also never had calamari served with cocktail sauce definately a disappointment Even if I didnt compare it to SoCal fish tacos it was not worth the calories The only reason Im giving it 2 stars is I havent tried (and probably wont) the other dishes Very good This was a road trip stop for lunch and worth the few extra miles out of the way After living in Charlotte NC for two years I was psyched that the "other" location of Cabo Fish Taco would be in my new home Blacksburg I really enjoy their corn salsa chips and margaritas The tacos are good but not quite as good as the same menu items in Charlotte It just seems like their other location makes the tacos with a bit more love more fish better tortillas and more flavorful mexi-slaw I would give this place 4 stars if I hadn\'t been to the Charlotte version Still a good standby Energetic yet we could still talk as a family Absolutely delicious food Flash fried homemade taco shells ( so they are light not greasy) filled with perfectly cooked fish shrimp calamari chicken and then crunchy cabbage Flavorful fresh salads Friendly atmosphere pool table upstairs Loved it! Sublime Wonderful food (and a not-to-bad margarita either) Really enjoyed the Silver Surfer Margarita a combo plate of BBQ Fish Taco and the Cabo Fish Taco but the Cabo got my attention Crisp fish and crunchy cabbage with a great sauce They also have a Jalapeno Mashed Potato as an excellent side The food is really good I love their corn salsa which they bring you with tortilla chips They also have this amazing crap and shrimp dip This dip is very flavorful The best part of this dip though is the pita chips I\'m pretty sure they fry them They then dust cheese on them This appetizer is super good and is sure to be a table hitTheir crab and shrimp cakes are also good They have very little filler These are grilled and not fried which is the way I love them They\'re topped with a spicy aioli which is a sort of a creamy southwestern sauce I always get them with the mexi slawTheir best dish though is the rasta pasta It\'s sort of a spin on alfredo pasta It has a pineapple cream sauce with bowtie pasta The sauce is awesome It also has shrimp and chicken which are both sort of spicy but so goodThey have these ridiculous cheap and oh so good margaritas The workman\'s and el cheapo YummyNow here\'s why I took away a star It seem like about 1/4 of the time I go in there with just my husband we get horrible service because they have these big tables I guess these waiters just assume because there\'s only 2 of us the tip isn\'t worth caring aboutSummary: This is great mexi-cali food cheap alcohol typically good service Great for celebrating anything with parents if they\'re in town visiting especially if your parents love margaritas Great soy-ginger shrimp tacos Very accomodating with kids as far as menu options! We always head to this place It\'s one of our regular B\'burg restaurants Cabo Fish Taco was not around during my years in Blacksburg as an undergrad so I was pleasantly surprised when I visited town over the summer and ate here and vowed to add it to my regular places to eat for future visits to town It\'s a huge step above other places in town if you\'re in the mood for tacos and \'ritas The food here is amazing It tastes fresh and natural and isn\'t weighed down with grease and cheese My husband and I each ordered an order of tacos (the beer battered white fish and the lemon grilled shrimp) and split them I had previously had the garlic buffalo shrimp and loved them but wanted to branch out and try something new since I don\'t get to visit that often All of the food I\'ve had here has been delicious I enjoy that you can choose a side and they are different than the typical rice and beans The \'ritas here are also highly recommended There are many to choose from but the restaurant doesn\'t use pre-made bottled margarita mix it is their own recipe made in house so they are much more flavorful than what you might typically get at a restaurant The reason this restaurant loses one star is due to the service We went at dinner time on a Football weekend Saturday so I expected there to be a wait The restaurant does not allow you to call ahead to have your name placed on the list but if you show up in person to be put on the list they will call your phone when your table is ready so during the hour+ wait we were able to go to a nearby bar and have a few drinks while we waited for the call When we hadn\'t heard back in an hour one of the members of our party walked back and they told her it would be another 20 minutes Within 5 minutes of that they called her and said she had 2 minutes to get back to the restaurant When we arrived we were told our table wasn\'t ready and were asked to wait upstairs I\'m not sure if perhaps two different hosts had been dealing with her but it was annoying to be told we had 20 minutes then told we had only 2 or we would lose our table only to show up and have to wait even longer They also had quite a number of tables in the upstairs area that were empty where the supposedly serve appetizers only I didn\'t quite understand why a restaurant would have an hour wait and not be utilizing all of it\'s available space which was frustrating Once we were finally seated the service was fine and we had an enjoyable meal In the future I will go put my name on the list an hour before I\'d like to eat or I will wait and enjoy Cabo on Sunday before I leave town when perhaps the wait isn\'t as bad NB: My ratings are scaled for Blacksburg Five stars here is equivalent to about three stars in the San Francisco Bay Area Cabo is passable for Southwestern Virginia but don\'t go here hoping to find California-style fish tacos The corn-based salsa is fairly tasteless and features frozen or canned corn The fish tacos are be soggy and flavorless or rather the flavor is mainly that of mayonnaise Some of the fish burritos such as the wasabi or the epic tuna have a hint of flavor but again they suffer from bland doughy tortillas and other low-grade ingredients that you\'ll find at a high school cafeteria I\'ve been on a serious fish taco kick for more than a year and ordered them recently in coastal California Minnesota coastal North Carolina and Virginia The best by far were at the Cabo Fish Taco in Blacksburg The fish was perfectly prepared and the cabbage was extra fresh and crunchy I\'ve been twice and can\'t wait to go back soonworth the drive from Roanoke I like this place and for the Blacksburg area it\'s unique Their fish tacos are okay and possibly the best I\'ve had in Virginia They don\'t really compare to something from So Cal though I usually either play it safe with the fish tacos or gamble with the special Depending on the night I\'ve had some really good food off the specials menu then I\'ve had some I\'d of rather sent back Overall it\'s hit or miss Everything else off the regular menu is usually a disappointment Although you would not think it from the external decor Cabo Fish Taco is one of the best restaurants in downtown Blacksburg The menu is a great combination for seafood and non-seafood lovers The inside decor is amazing with high ceilings and big screen televisions for sports Wait staff is helpful and knows the menu well Get the Rasta Pasta!!! then move to the serviceThe food is definitely overpriced I\'m paying $13 (before tax) for steak fajitas and receive half a plate full of just chopped tomatoes cheese and lettuce and on the other half of the plate a small pile of grilled meat and veggies which was more like 2/3rds veggies and the rest meat I could get that (and maybe more and/or better) for 1/3rd the price at Taco Bell and 1/2 the price at Chipotle Their margaritas are very expensive and you can receive something twice the size for the same price at Chu-Cho\'s or El Rodeo (3-5 minute drive from Cabo) For not being sat mediocre service loud and bar-like surroundings dining at Cabo isn\'t worth your buck But if you\'re all for supporting local business go for itService-wise I had a terrible experience I have a medical condition which prohibits me from consuming gluten - I made this clear to the waitress prior to even ordering any drinks When I inquired her about any marinades sauces etc that were used on the meat she readily assured me that everything was "fine" and gluten free Upon receiving my dish the meat was drenched in soy sauce I asked her to double check what the meat was cooked in and what do you know teriyaki sauce and soy sauce (almost all generic brands of teriyaki and all brands of soy sauce contain wheat)! She didn\'t even know what the dish was cooked in and had prior told me everything was fine without checking with the cooks At this point I wasn\'t offered an alternative dish or half price on my meal or anything I didn\'t even receive a "sorry" This definitely left me with a bad impression of the restaurant and the service provided If you have a medical problem I can\'t give you any other advice other than to hassle your server to make sure all your needs are metAll in all not happy with the place My first and last time there I wish I could give it 35 stars since this place is a little out of the ordinary The food is a little above average but lacks good flavor It\'s mostly fresh but not much imagination put into it It\'s too much of a college bar to be a good quality restaurant but the tequila list is decent The margaritas are also slightly above average but better than most in the area They do use mix in the drinks but it\'s better than most other places that use mix If you\'re drink comes out bright green it\'s as fake as a UVA football fan Go ahead and squeeze a lime into a glass it\'s not very green Nobody needs that artificial crap in your body just demand more out of a restaurant The corn salsa is decent but takes quite a bit of Tapatio to get it anywhere near spicy enough The service is usually pretty decent despite the drunk dudes occasionally trying to make their You can\'t beat this flavor They sell out quickly your chances are slim after noon on the weekends so make sure to get there in the morning This is one of the gems of Blacksburg and a place that I look forward to every time we are in town This business has taken many shapes in my lifetime my favorite was when it was on College Avenue and you could watch people pass by Now it is located on North Main Street and has only outdoor seating It is set up now to be more of a take out restaurant A dozen non-filled doughnuts is $8 This includes flavors like maple glazed chocolate with sprinkles vanilla with sprinkles Oreo Cake and blueberry cake I also highly recommend the raspberry filled doughnuts If you are on a budget and don\'t mind broken or ugly doughnuts they also sell "Grab Bags" It was perfect for me when I was a broke college student Carol Lee is the way doughnuts are meant to be! Fresh yeasty delicious donuts They are the best and not overpriced like the donut shops in the DMV We got a dozen for less than 10 bucks Alright Carol Lee you did your reputation justice I had never been in this area before but I came down for a VTech weddingand of course everyone literally EVERYONE told me I MUST go get Carol Lee Donuts I mean I like donuts but I was really thinking "how good can a donut place be?" And to be honest I am impressed It\'s such a small and simple shop with big flavors and really delicious donuts I like that it\'s simp shop and it has a homemade feel to it It doesn\'t have any bells and whistles and it doesn\'t need any They just let the donuts speak for themselves What I like most about the donuts from here is that they are not overly sweet and I think the dough has a better bite and fluff to it than other places They remain soft even the next day and never get that hard shell with expired donuts from DD or other places They are CASH ONLY and it\'s easy to pick up a dozen donuts for $8-$10 depending on what kinds you are getting They will certainly run out of flavors later in the day so go early I especially liked the White fluff filling donuts the blueberry and the cinnamon rolls I picked up a dozen to bring back to my co-workers and the box was gone in minutes! Try them!! If you didn\'t get Carol Lees at least a thousand times did you really go to Tech? LOL jk but really Carol Lees has some of the BEST donuts I\'ve ever had (and I\'ve tried a lot of donut places) The store itself is tiny It was in walking distance from my apartment so I\'d walk out there on the weekends for my donut fix Bring cash because if you need to withdrawal the ATM takes a fee My favorite donuts are the blueberry and chocolate cake donuts They are perfectly made The Bavarian cream donuts and the sprinkles were also a hit in my apartment I typically don\'t like filled donuts but the Bavarian cream one is not overly sweet and is quite delicious Actually all the donuts here are delicious I recommend them all A Blacksburg staple! Small donut shop with limited parking spaces but rarely found a time where it was difficult to find a parking spot I rarely ever give out 5/5 star reviews - but this place really deserves it The donuts here are a perfect combination of fluffiness and stuffing that isn\'t replicated at any other bakery or donut shop I\'ve been too in the US That coupled with the great service and amazing prices makes this place one of the best hidden treasures in Blacksburg VA Awesome place with awesome people! Carol Lee Donuts is an iconic Blacksburg spot that everyone needs to try at some point Pros:VALUE: Their normal donuts are $070 each and the filled donuts are $085 It doesn\'t get much better than thatTASTE: These are the best donuts I\'ve ever had VARIETY: They have tons of different donuts to choose from! Everything from cream filled to sprinkles or just plain! :) FAMILY OWNED: I love that Carol Lee Donuts is a family owned spot that has been in operation since 1968 Everyone who works there is super friendly! :) Cons:I can only think of 1 but they only accept cash or checks Although there is an ATM on site :) This place is amazing and I hope it\'s around for many more generations to come! No It is just plain good It wouldn\'t matter how large a city I lived in or how much selection I had access to I would come here Price and donuts are great Just note that they are cash only The curse of Carol Lee is that no other donut will ever stack up Despite slight inconveniences (cash only have to get there earlyish a little far from campus) these are the best donuts I\'ve ever tasted and I would easily go far out of my way to get them They are cooked morning of so they\'re incredibly fresh they pretty much melt in your mouth are never dry and the owners are wonderful people You can place large orders ahead of time and the donuts taste just as good for up to two days (if you can restrain yourself!) Don\'t hesitate to try any flavor; they\'re all amazing Carol Lee\'s is a Blacksburg staple Back in the day they were located down on College Avenue They have always had THE best blueberry cake donuts Especially good warm as are the blueberry holes! Still worth trying! A shining star in Blacksburg Cannot say enough good things about them I\'ve never been disappointed with the donuts or the staff or the quality of product Amazing every single time you go and if you\'re lucky enough to get a warm oneyou just may get a glimpse of heaven I have stopped at Carol\'s on several occasions finding the best donuts I have ever had A great way to treat yourself The donuts made here are like little morsels of heavenliness They don\'t make a bad flavor - they all taste great My personal favorite are the raspberry or blackberry filled ones They are so good You should definitely make this a stop if you are ever in Blacksburg Va Folks --we tried this on a hunch --and all the way from Alaska --( on our way to the Greenbrier) ITS A MUST --the only ? There is an ATM in the store in case you forget Hands down some of the best donuts I\'ve had in the US They were fresh and absolutely delicious Cash only which is annoying but the donuts are inexpensive so it\'s understandable The bottom line is that Carol Lee Donuts is a fantastic find in a part of the country littered by substandard chain restaurants Highly recommended Stopped by late on Saturday so selection was not great but the cinnamon rolls filled and cake donuts we were able to sample were excellent! I decided to order a box of a half-dozen to get a good variety I picked the Blueberry Cake Toasted Coconut Devil\'s Food Chocolate Iced Chocolate Iced with Peanuts Cinnamon Sugar & Bavarian Creme filled for my six doughnuts They are $70 each individually and I believe it was just under $400 for a half-dozenAfter now having tried all six flavors the Blueberry Cake & Toasted Coconut are my two favorites There\'s nothing fancy about the blueberry cake but this cake doughnut is extremely light and the berries tasted stronger than usual in most other blueberry doughnuts I\'ve tried For a contrast the Toasted Coconut was a glazed yeast doughnut but topped with shavings of toasted coconut The coconut gives a unique texture and a sweet nutty flavor that works well with the yeast doughnut I\'m not a coffee drinker but this seemed like a doughnut that would pair perfectly with a cup of coffee Carol Lee I don\'t know who you are but I thank you for a delectable and extremely cheap breakfast Especially your toasted coconut yeast doughnut Yes indeed I wish I had been able to wake up early enough to try them hot and fresh but a couple seconds in the microwave brings me just as much joy A must when in Blacksburg Oh my word these are the most amazing donuts I have ever had These donuts are dream-stuff wrapped in dough and then fried in such a way as to just explode with deliciousness in your mouthYou may think I\'m overstating things that I\'m letting myself get carried away with how awesome these donuts really are but all I can say is that I assure you that these are otherworldly and lovely Best donuts I\'ve ever had!! In addition to the taste visiting Carol Lee Donuts has brought decades of meaningful tradition to our family I even keep a list on hand of everyone\'s preferences! Lemon filled and old fashioned cake for her blueberry and chocolate glazed for him maple yeast and cinnamon sugar for me etc The price is affordable the tiny shop is clean and the owners show pride by still making the doughnuts and serving their guests every day! Last time we visited we were so inquisitive that the owner gave us a tour of the doughnut-making process in the back of the shop They still use old fashioned machines and make doughnuts the best possible way without cutting corners on quality Because the shop is small don\'t expect to sit down inside If it\'s warm enough outside you\'ll be able to enjoy your doughnuts at a picnic table out front In the winter you\'ll want to take your doughnuts to devour at home This old time family business is charming and just plain good! This place is the reason I get up early on weekends and why I gained so much weight Good donuts the blueberry one was small but really good the chocolate covered one was good but I didn\'t love the white filling as much I\'ll definitely be coming back I\'ll look forward to the Bavarian cream Solid donut shop Its no chain deal and the donuts are always fresh I have been there at least 10 times and the quality never wavers I\'ve had their doughnuts once and here\'s what I have to sayThe doughnuts were artisan quality good feel good taste but not overly sweet like the Krispy Kreme or even Dunkin They are simple yet amazing Best donuts anywhere I travel a lot am far from a health but and can assure you these are the best donuts you will find I have no idea how long CL has been open but I have been going for over 40 years; downtown and now on North Main There are great breakfast and brunch options in Blacksburg but if you only have one morning make it Carol Lee It doesn\'t get much better than thisCarol Lee Donuts is known for being the go-to donut store in the Blacksburg areaThe donuts are fresh delicious and cheap With choices from Bavarian creme to maple iced to vanilla iced with maroon and orange sprinkles you really can\'t go wrong You can pick up one two or have them fill a box with a dozen of your choosingCoffee is diner quality but it\'s hot cheap and gets the job doneNOTE: The only reason they\'re not getting the fifth star is because they only take cash NO CREDIT CARDS They do have a conveniently located ATM inside that charges a fee I do not know what it is I get that maybe they don\'t want to pay credit card merchant fees but it\'s 2014 Overall amazing donut shop Local not a chain a town favorite You do need to go early and have cash but it is worth it! I went here 3 separate times for 3 separate meals over this week I\'ve visited my friends in VA so I\'ve broken my review up by meal The dinner option of pacos is also on the lunch menu too!!DINNER: The vegan pacos is SO good That\'s an entree in and of itself honestly I ordered the Tofu Gado Gado subbed seitan and brown rice it was a nice spicy peanut sauce The bite of Korean bbq tempeh and broccoli I had was really good too like a beefy steak I didn\'t get to try the Gillie\'s and Mushroom burger but they looked /really/ good My friend wasn\'t enthused with the Gillie\'s burger herself but i didn\'t get to grab a bite personally The only issues we had with a party of 8 was a glass with a lip print on it (although my friend was too shy to speak up) and the waitress misheard us and brought us a nonvegan pacos at first Luckily my group was suspicious of how melty the cheese was so we caught it! Service was very nicThe mousse is vegan and DIVINE SO RICH Seriously you\'re going to want to split it it\'s the best My cheeks tingled with happiness as I ate it If you\'re unfamiliar with mousse it\'s like a dark chocolate aerated pudding must try BREAKFAST: came for Sunday brunch and got a Veganized Red Earth It was really yummy they did try to upsell with vegan cheese which would be even more yummy but I didn\'t feel like spending the extra $2 at the time The tofu sub was $150 more which was a bit of a bummer but understandable The tofu was cubed and tasted pretty nice! I wonder if they\'ve ever tried to crumble it for texture Overall I\'m really happy I chose the Vegan Red Earth I chose the honey wheat bread because I don\'t mind honey and don\'t like white breads I think next time I\'ll try buckwheat pancakes with blueberries although I\'m not sure if they have real maple syrup or vegan butterLUNCH: I tried their seitan bbq wrap and it was godly I didn\'t know if I would like it because I hadn\'t had coleslaw in a long time (being vegan and all) but it was definitely the right decision I would recommend the BBQ Seitan Wrap or Pacos for lunch based on my personal experience Overall this is definitely a great place to come eat and I can see myself going back here for sure when I\'m in town Great to have these options in Blacksburg  My daughters veggie burger was wonderful My lentil soup was too although the bowl portion seemed smallOut of guacamole  settled for chips and salsa Shouldn\'t have bothered  Tostito cup chips and average salsaNice to have gluten free cookies at cash register for the road at a fair price of $175 Staff great atmosphere quaint and relaxing I had come to this place couple times now and it is famous for being a vegetarian restaurant It is a surprise that vegetarian food can also be tasty I had a smoke salmon salad which the smoke salmon is good but the salad is kind of disappointing I guess I was expecting a little more stuff for the salad part whereas it only have the one type of leaves some carrots and some cheese The sauce is pretty good tho My friend order a another dish with bread with different toppings looks really good and can\'t wait to try it!In general food is good but can be tricky depends on the food you get Not a have to go place but definitely a try if you want something special Love the mostly vegetarian cuisine! The brunch that I had eaten in weekends is yummy! I highly recommend the food! After reading some bad reviews regarding service and portion size I did not know what to expect when trying Gillie\'s I was not a single bit disappointed! Our party of 5 walked in and were immediately greeted by the hostess We chose a table sat down and they brought us water with lemons immediately Our server greeted us told us the specials and gave us some time with the menu He was a very pleasant guy I wanted to try everything on the menu but I ended up going with the make your own stir fry I got seitan with a Thai sauce and soba noodles We also got a side of vegan nachos as an appetizer The nachos did not blow me away They were loaded with toppings but did not have enough chips We ordered vegan cheese on them but I only found two chips that actually had cheese on them My stir fry on the other hand was very tasty There was plenty of seitan and fresh veggies and the portion size was perfect! I really enjoyed this dish My mom especially loved her dish She had the Gado gado tofu It is a tofu dish with veggies and rice in a peanut sauce I tried it and found the sauce to be so tasty! She would highly recommend this dish We went on a Friday night at about 6:30 and there was a solo acoustic act that started playing at 7 It was a bit intimate since it was just us and maybe two other tables in the restaurant The music was pleasant though and not too loud Overall my experience at Gillie\'s was way better than expected I hope that I will be able to return to this restaurant in the future to try some of the other dishes! As an alum I\'m embarrassed to say I never had Gillie\'s before a recent trip back but glad to check it off the Blacksburg restaurant list The little cafe is perfect for locals students and visiting familiesWe arrived shortly after 11 am on a Saturday so we expected a wait given its size Our party of four was quoted 30 minutes and we happily waited outside in the sun for our table They had open tables outside in the shade but it was a little brisk while out of the sun so we opted to wait inside The host was personable and did a great job managing the waiting list We were seated within our quoted time and immediately given waters Our waiter walked over shortly after to get any other drink orders When he returned we were ready to order (& very hungry) I picked the Chappie\'s choice which was two scrambled eggs over potatoes with white cheddar and a biscuit The menu is vegan and vegetarian and has great labeling so that choices are clear Gluten-free friends would like this place too! My friends also ordered the banana walnut French toast which looked great Fun tip- they offer French toast both the traditional way with honey wheat bread or sliced baguette Service was pretty quick and staff was friendly After our meal we were given a check to pay up front before leaving - super great way to avoid the hassle of splitting checks at the table Definitely check out this for breakfast - just know that good things sometimes come with a short wait! This isn\'t my usual go-to place when in Blacksburg but a it\'s a lot of people\'s favorite Food is delicious and cheap I got open spanish frittata and my boyfriend got juevos rancheros The flavor combinations are great and portions are pretty big I really like how they get bread form Bollo\'s right around the corner Service could be improved as they don\'t keep up with water and coffee refills and we weren\'t even given silverware this time The wait for food is on the longer side There can be a pretty long wait to even sit down on the weekends Went here for lunch and brunch (on separate occasions) both were delicious! I got the focaccia pizza - they have a large selection of toppings It was good! Wish they had red chili flakes though Brunch was even better had the banana walnut French toast Super yum perfect amount of sweetness The ambiance is really nice lively during brunch and has a good mix of different types of people- from townies to college students Another Blacksburg Gem! Gillies is a mostly vegetarian restaurant (they serve fish) in the heart of downtown Blacksburg They started out as an ice cream store in the 1970s and then gradually expanded into a full restaurant and then added a coffee shop (Bollos) two stores down Gillies is hands down the best place for brunch in Blacksburg They have a variety of delightful entrees; my favorite being the 122 Special (Eggs Grits or homefries biscuit or toast and coffee or tea) It is named for its original price $122 but now costs $650 Other entrees that I adore are French Toast Biscuits and vegetarian gravy and for lunch Pacos Taco Pound Gillies has so much history for me and my family my husband and I had our rehearsal dinner there We used the whole restaurant and had our own menu It was lovely While gillie\'s has always been a favorite of mine they really disappointed me today when I ordered lunch for my colleagues and myself for pickup I came to get our order and part of the order was wrong While that was quickly corrected I was very frustrated when I asked for a bag to carry my order and was told there were none I had walked several blocks to pick up our food and had 3 boxes and 2 cups of soup and was told they have a new policy of not giving bags The server told my my only option was to "make a few trips" and said she wasn\'t able to help me carry the order despite the fact that there were 4-5 other servers working 5 blocks and two trips later I finally got the food back to my office Very frustrating I\'m all for reducing carbon footprints but not at the expense of customer service Simply the best brunch anywhere My usual is the El Dorado omelette with fresh organic spinach salmon and feta Coupled with squeezed orange juice it is the perfect lazy day meal! I grew up knowing Gillie\'s as my favorite ice cream spot with HUGE scoops No longer for me or them but they have matured with me for the better! Love this downtown classic for 5 decades in the \'burg I have enjoyed coming here So does everyone else on a Sunday morning so get there before 9 or plan to wait awhile! By far the best vegetarian restaurant in Blacksburg The poached eggs Benedict offered on Saturday and Sunday mornings is a must try I finally tried Gillie\'s for the first time after hearing about it so much!I had one of the specials which was a blueberry goat cheese and arugula grilled cheese and I got it with the Asian slaw as my side The Asian slaw was very good and I loved the sandwich! One thing I would say is that it was a little bit too heavy on the blueberry and not enough on the actual cheese but I still really enjoyed eating itThe huge deterrent that would keep me from coming back to Gillie\'s was the service The restaurant was pretty empty when we went yet our server somehow managed to ignore us completely The only times he came to our table without us asking him to was to give us the menus and our food We repeatedly had to ask for things (to order ask for water ask for boxes and to ask for the check) I really hope that the service is better if I decide to come back This place is a gem Its vegetarian but great breakfast I had got the Chappie Choice and my friends got pancakes and French toast Sampled each others great food!!! Gillie\'s had very good vegetarian breakfast fare There was a large variety of dishes to select from on the menu with the expected regulars and some interesting specialties It was a small homey place that serves breakfast lunch and dinner I had the open face Spanish frittata It was excellent!!! It had potatoes artichokes onions black olives tomatoes and feta on it The seasoning was delicious The service was very friendly I would definitely go back Always yummy! By far my favorite place in Blacksburg to eat Their brunch lunch and dinner is always great and their specials always offer something new to try I love that there are so many vegetarian/vegan options since you often can\'t find that around here My favorite thing to order is the Tofu Ruben and potato pancakes You can definitely tell that everything is made fresh and homemade I also like that their little patio outside is dog friendly :) I love the breakfast/brunch menu and the lunch menuHaven\'t been to dinner for YEARS - was over-priced the last time I was there in 00sPS: The coffee still sucks Gillies is a very good choice for vegetarian cuisine I went for their lunch and got the Gillie\'s Burger which is a black bean burger It was a little dry but still extremely tasty The prices were actually pretty cheap and not as expensive as I thought The atmosphere was very relaxed and the service was very good Overall a great choice for vegetarian food and lunch option One of my all time favorite restaurants Everything is fresh the wait staff is always friendly and interesting and prices are ridiculously cheap My only complaint is I wish they had alcohol and served more meat But hey it\'s a vegetarian restaurant Try the "red earth" dish for breakfast and definitely get a biscuit as well I came with my mother and sister on Mother\'s Day to grab brunch after my sister\'s graduation before heading back home to Northern Virginia Since it was Mother\'s Day the wait was quite long but we managed to get a spot at the bar pretty quickly However it took 40 minutes after we ordered to receive our food Apparently they only had two cooks working which was unfortunate I ordered the Smoked Salmon Hash with potatoes instead of grits and was a bit underwhelmed There wasn\'t much salmon and the overwhelming flavor in the dish was tomato from the salsa I also had the toast with the dish which tasted fresh and crisp but didn\'t have much flavor I felt like I could have made something better at home My mother got the Bruschetta which had smoked salmon on top of cream cheese and was quite tasty My sister had the Chappie\'s Choice with a biscuit - the scrambled eggs looked quite good soft with cheddar on top and the biscuit was very fluffy and butteryThe servers were friendly and one even came over to explain the kitchen situation He also made small talk with us while we were waiting for the billOverall I would order something else if I were to return but I was disappointed by the Smoked Salmon Hash and long wait They need to hire more kitchen staff Gillie\'s is a Blacksburg classic and despite being here for years I\'ve never had brunch here This has been remedied and I will be back! Come early and come prepared to wait outside - it\'s popular and there will always be people waiting outside The turnover isn\'t too bad though - my group of four came around 9:45AM on a Sunday morning and had an estimated wait for 40 minutes but only waited for maybe 30 minutes Since it\'s busy don\'t expect the best service in the world since it\'s small crowded and bustling! But the servers will make an effort to be warm and inviting which I was appreciative of Be careful of sitting anywhere near the door they hold the door open to get the next party in and it can get a little cold if it\'s windy outside! Food is affordable and a good mix of sweet and savory options as well as a daily specials menu on the wall I got the bruschetta and a short stack of buttermilk pancakes (two pancakes) and was really happy - bread comes from Bollo\'s so the quality is great and I loved the goat cheese spread with the smoked salmon Pancakes are denser than what I\'m used to with buttermilk pancakes - they\'re not fluffy but they\'re still good almost like a thick crepe? Everyone else at the table enjoyed what they had too - I was definitely eyeing my friend\'s Mediterranean special with salmon poached eggs cous cous and olives! I haven\'t had the chance to come before since my fiance swears off anything that calls itself "vegetarian" but now he says that we should come back I might turn into a breakfast person yet! Also on an unrelated note: there\'s a super cool music scene at Gillies with local bands coming to play and the space becoming a small mosh pit (but there\'s seating if you\'re not into that) It\'s super fun and a great taste of the local culture - I highly suggest going if you spend the weekend visiting! I was expecting this place to be overpriced and mediocre but was pleasantly surprised that it was neither of those things The portions here are pretty big and perfect I ordered the black cat sub and it blew my mind The catfish looked really burnt but after biting into it i realized it looked like that just because of the way it was marinated The sub was great! All of the flavors complemented each other very well and nothing was too over powering The catfish itself was cooked perfectly and not at all dry or chalky It came with a nice little salad of purple cabbage and carrots with a light vinaigrette sauce that also went well with the sub All in all i had a great experience The service is minimal but they check in at the right times If i lived here This is easily the worst service I\'ve ever had I\'m genuinely stunned at how abysmal the entire experience wasIn summary: Ordered a dish kitchen ran out of an ingredient so they gave me a dish with shrimp in it Waitress never came back to ask what else I wanted Left without payingTerrible serviceEven worse management0/10We dined here on Tuesday August 14th at around 6:30 pm It was busy but nothing extreme; the student traffic hadn\'t really started in full swing yet We were able to get a table right away and the waitress provided us the menus and later water immediately Unfortunately it was all downhill after thisMy friend ordered the Sonoma Sandwich and I ordered the Fresh Basil Pesto These dishes took far too long to prepare which seems to be a trend for this restaurant On top of the kitchen taking far too long to prepare the food the waitress was absolutely terrible at her job - she might as well not have even been thereWhen the food finally arrived I noticed that my dish had shrimp in it and it didn\'t really look like pesto at all I made sure to double check to see if I missed an ingredient in the description but the Fresh Basil Pesto has no shrimp in it I was eventually able to ask about the shrimp when the waitress returned only to be informed that the kitchen gave me a different dish because they ran out of an ingredient Oh but wait she also told me I could just "eat around the shrimp" One would think you could also bring out the right dish but I guess that\'s too much for this establishmentWhat kind of restaurant substitutes a dish without informing the customer?! Let alone with shrimp something people are notoriously allergic to?! Both my friend and I were shocked that any restaurant would ever operate this wayInstead of eating something I didn\'t order I asked for the menu so I could choose something else I made my choice but I never got a chance to inform the waitress because she never once stopped by our table My friend was able to finish his entire meal which took about fifteen minutes and the waitress never stopped by once There is no excuse for this; I\'ve eaten at far busier restaurants and never experienced such lousy serviceAs my friend was finishing his meal I went up to the cashier and informed them that this was the worst service I\'ve ever had at any restaurant The cashier a blonde girl tried to excuse this away by saying "Well you should know that we\'re very busy right now I\'m not even supposed to be working here" Seriously?! It doesn\'t matter how busy you are or that you\'re not supposed to be here Thats not how you respond to that - you messed up own up to itAround this same time the waitress managed to reappear from whatever dark void she vanished into and asked condescendingly "are you getting your ticket comped?" I told her I was leaving I told them I wasn\'t going to pay for my meal and left My friend later assured me that I didn\'t miss much as his sandwich was subpar Weekend visiting my brother and friends wouldn\'t be complete without a nice brunch :D My friend is a huge fan of this place and I was a little confused when she said it was a vegetarian place It was great though! about a place good or badWhen I visited Gillie\'s I was in the area from out of town also vegetarian and really excited that the town had something that was directed more towards vegetariansWhen we walked in we were greeted and told we could sit wherever that our server would be right with us We sat at the bar and were given menus with two waters We waited ten minutes after getting those menus for anyone to even speak to us the only reason I know this is because we were on our way somewhere and had a timeline which we didn\'t mention to the server because they were obviously busy and didn\'t want to be rude Being on vacation your used to being on a small time crunch anywaysDuring the ten minutes of waiting we had a bunch of questions! What soup they had and what were they out of because it seemed that the 86\' list on the wall was pretty full I mean the list had at least 6 items they were out of Kinda unfortunate when you don\'t even know what you can or can\'t order on the menu I feel maybe the server could have told us what they were out of to help us have a better experience with deciding on what they actually had to offerAfter the ten minutes pass the same girl who greeted us and told us that our server would be with us came up to us and asked us "what can I get for ya" Didn\'t ask if we had questions didn\'t ask if wanted anything besides water nothing We had to respond with "well we have a few questions" With a little prying with what seemed to be pretty difficult questions (such as "what is your soup of the day?) we finally got some answers Rudely we were answered with "I\'m not sure it\'s written on the board over here" Which remind you I didn\'t even know they had any specials or a board because A I wasn\'t told about them and B I was sitting at the bar which the board wasn\'t visible from my seatWhile waiting for the food which was barely up to par we hear her talking to coworkers about how she\'s "grumpy today for no reason just grumpy today" We observed the cook preparing our food wearing a hat with a decent amount of hair hanging out the sides I\'m pretty sure a hairnet should be worn I don\'t think the hair length would be okay by health code The bread for my sandwich was so thick I could barely chew it and it\'s served with chips and salsa that I could buy at the grocery store walnut french toast and I have to force myself to stop eating when I\'m full These two things with two coffees and tip is only $10 each which is almost the same as going to Panera I also recommend for When the server (and another person who turned out to be the owner) acted so friendly I thought that I might order some food Turned out to be a good idea and most likely a whole lot better than the tailgate fare that was waiting for me with some friendsOrdered what I thought was steak and eggs and the proprietor told me that they were vegetarian I wanted to leave but since they were so friendly I thought to give it a try Good idea Had some sort of fake steak and eggs in a huevos rancheros style They were excellent And they seemed to take some pride in their hash brown potatoes so I ordered that up as wellreally fabulous and I mostly like that stuff as a ketchup delivery device So good without the ketchup You should give this place a try Great people cool vibe tasty food Gillieyou have a great place here and I am sure that the lines outside say more than I can say here Oh Gillie\'s you\'ve captured a part of my heart that I don\'t think I will ever get back From your eclectic southern hipster charm to your fresh vegetarian dishes I am completely smitten I am glad that this was my last meal prior to leaving Blacksburg We came on a weekday morning for breakfast and found the restaurant not busy in the slightest The food was superb: Their freshly squeezed pear juice is unique and an absolute must for the morning as are their made from scratch cheese biscuits The salmon bruschetta was a blissful bite of dill cream cheese smooth slightly salty salmon and sweet red peppers My boyfriend had the specialty French toast which had more than plentiful bananas and walnuts as the name guarantees; I really enjoyed the fact that they have options for toast: honey wheat or French baguette and that the slices are not overdrenched in eggI was extremely gleeful throughout the whole meal and I\'ve found myself lusting for more since we left The portions of our brunch were huge almost insane We waited long to get our food and when we finally got it it wasn\'t as good as we were expecting AMAZING! As a celiac there were A Lot of great and delicious choices! Bread from the bakery next door was fantastic We will be back a lot Super friendly staff and quite fast considering it was move in weekend at VT and they were full with a wait 5 stars all around! We were looking for typical diner food during a visit to Blacksburg nut the nearby greasy spoon was closed so we ended up here While my older son lamented he couldn\'t get bacon his French toast made up for that The egg dishes were delicious and the grits with greens were fabulous - who would\'ve thunk it? Very good brewed coffee too Great food and friendly waitress! Recommend the Florentine breakfast which has beans instead of potatoes Sitting outside is really a nice choice! Solid down to earth food that has simple ingredients No meat restaurant Hipster for the two decades I have been eating here  Great biscuits and breads  Breakfast is best followed by dinner Went to Gillie\'s for lunch though we were sad that we couldn\'t make it there for the delicious sounding Brunch! There were tons of options pretty amazing considering the stereotype that Vegetarians have less options The aura is awesome the mismatched chairs are a staple of Gillie\'s that were around in 70\'s when my parents attended Virginia Tech They loved the place and it\'s still a great local spot today! I had a Pumpkin-Apple Bisque which was the soup of the day and being somewhat bland was the only disappointing item The salad with apples and walnuts was AWESOME the fresh wedge of bread awesome and the coffee yummy My friends go a quesadilla (lot\'s of options to go in these!) and the nachos which also tasted amazing when I tried them (the chips are unique maybe homemade?) Don\'t pass this place up also was well heated on a chilly day! Obsessed with their brunch Pancakes!!! Yum yum yum!! Only thing lacking is some breakfast sausage (this girl likes her meat - and the soysage just didn\'t cut it for me) FOOD IS GREAT BATHROOM IS DISGUSTINGCome on Gilly\'s CLEAN YOUR FREAKING BATHROOM GROSSI almost did not want to eat here because the bathroom was GROSS But I was hungry and wanted veg food And I\'ve travelled in numerous third world countries so perspectiveQuesedilla with veggies - fantasticAlmond arugula salad - fantasticPizza - fantasticLots of beer on tapGROSS BATHROOM YUCK Jeeze Not too shabby but they can step up some of their options A lot of their food comes with scrambled eggs but there could be great options with over easy or boiled eggs Not a huge fan of the potatoes here and the portions are huge I had lived in Blacksburg for about 4 years and I never once stepped inside of Gillie\'s Personally the whole appeal of "vegetarian" cuisine just never sounded appealing I\'m a steak and potatoes kind of guy down to the core However after not being in Blacksburg for nearly 7 years I had the opportunity to visit over this past weekend and my fiancee really wanted to give Gille\'s a shot for brunch so we didAnd I was really impressed Although on the breakfast/brunch menu you won\'t find your typical breakfast staples of bacon and eggs or eggs and sausage there are some alternative dishes available and all sounded pretty decentI went with the Red Earth dish which is their seasoned potatoes at the bottom topped with scrambled egg (or tofu if you want to go that route) and then topped with salsa (I believe this is home made) with a side of a thick piece of homemade bread The potatoes were seasoned awesome the eggs were nice and fluffy and the salsa really added a nice kick to the entire dish Overall super impressed with Gillie\'s from my initial experience and kind of kicking myself that I never enjoyed their offerings while I lived in Hokie Nation Excellent brunch! I would recommend their brunch to anybody and especially the Gillie\'s special Their potatoes and salsa are both delicious I haven\'t had a poor experience at Gillies They must have changed their coffee provider recently though When I was at vt ~2years ago it was the best cup of coffee I\'d ever had I went back recently and it was underwhelming Still a good cup of joe but nothing to rave about Hands down the best brunch in town! Their lunch and dinner isn\'t as phenomenal however (I learned that pretty early on during my undergrad career dining here) Definitely expect a wait if you\'re going on a morning during the weekend! Depending on the amount of people in your party it can be anywhere from 20-40 minutes Their best dishes are the Salmon Bruschetta the Molettes and the Spanish Frittata If you come early enough they might still have some of their delicious scratch-made biscuits left for you (they run out quickly)! Their potatoes that come with any of "Our Old Favorites" choices are also great and if you decide to go for an omelet don\'t worry - they don\'t skimp out on the fillings you choose! My boyfriend recently had their Tofu Scramble as well and he loved it While you\'re paying your bill at the register don\'t forget to snag some of the freshly-baked desserts at the counter baked from Bollos Cafe down the street! I\'ve been a loyal Gillies fan for the past 5 years and haven\'t been disappointed I hope you join the fanclub soon! :) To start off with gillies food is a 4 I love(d) getting the red earth for breakfast Overall the food is pretty good The problem is the service as I\'ve seen in a few other reviews Gillies does well because many of the workers are friendly and active community members but there are some servers who are incredibly rude I was yelled at outside for giving a 17% tip I won\'t be going back here sad to say This is one of the better restaurants in Blacksburg The brunch is outstanding - I especially like the banana walnut French toast and anything with potatoesThe fresh juices are great too I always get a carrot Apple ginger juice for me and my sonAt lunch my favorite dishes are the tofu Reuben and blackened catfish sandwich Both are really flavorful The food is filling and some days quite good Unfortunately the food can not make up for the rude and often brusque staff The place may continue to draw large crowds but I believe that I will choose other restaurants in the future I am a person who will always tip over 20% they were not able to get over 15% from me I can only assume staff is paid a good hourly rate and does not need tips In a nutshell; service =2 and food =4 Went for lunch Nice ambiance Menu is indeed heavily vegetarian and gluten free I ordered the Black Cat Sandwich - blackened catfish filet with lettuce tomato and chipotle mayo on french bread Good flavor but the bread really overwhelmed the other ingredients Took a while to settle my bill because the waitress was busy talking to the other staff members This is an outstanding restaurant with unique dishes that\'s a good detour from the routine chain restaurants Though I\'m not a strict vegetarian this restaurant is a testament that tasty recipes can be created devoid of meats We went there for brunch on a cold winter Saturday and - as my picky eating kids proclaimed - had the best breakfast of our lives The Belgian waffles with chocolate was outstanding the French toast baguettes with blueberries were terrific and my red earth scrambled eggs on rosemary potatoes was completely awesome Portions were big and the check was not! Bon appetite! The vegan buckwheat pancakes are my favorite and also the potatoes!!!! Food is either good or great so you never have to worry! All of my friends are always wary about going but once they do they are always asking to go again I went to Gillie\'s with my buddy when I was visiting him in Blacksburg recently He suggested it as a good place to grab breakfast and I\'m so glad that he didIt has a cool college town vibe to it (including the mostly vegetarian and vegan inspired menu) and getting to sit outside on a beautiful Saturday morning is always a plusThere\'s no meat on the breakfast menu at Gillies but for me that was no problem I got the Red Earth which was two scrambled eggs on a bed of potato\'s topped with fresh salsa and served with an airy homemade buttermilk biscuit A filling meal to say the least it was flavorful and fresh without being too much foodI can see how this place would be a popular joint with the Virginia Tech students when class is in session an excellent array of interesting food at an affordable price tag that left me satisfied and ready to take on the day Gillie\'s is THE brunch place in Blacksburg However you have to check out their lunch and dinner options if you have the chance; it\'s all amazing and I\'d argue that the dinner options are better You will forget that this place is vegetarian/pescetarian and don\'t let the hippie vibe turn you off My dad is the biggest red meat eater and hippie-basher on the planet and very reluctantly entered the restaurant with me but he was so impressed by their brunch that he suggested we come back for dinner on his next visit - and he was even more impressed by that (I believe he had some sort of shrimp alfredo dish)Gillie\'s often has local musical artists perform and there\'s always art on the walls from someone in the area Additionally you\'ll find various objects -- a Darth Vader figure a sewing machine a cat clock etc I get the feeling that having at least one tattoo or some other unusual look is mandatory for employees; in any case the employees are all interesting One of them (I\'m not sure if he still works there) squats down on the floor and gets comfy while taking your orderBottom line: If you ask me where we should eat in Blacksburg I will say Gillie\'s I stopped by Gillie\'s for breakfast while in Blacksburg for some business I liked the variety of the breakfast menu and it was tough to pick just one thing - so I had a fewI had half an order of the French Toast and I was glad that I made that decision because half an order was still plenty of french toast for me It wasn\'t the most amazing french toast I\'ve ever had but it was goodI also ordered some fruit on the side and I was a bit disappointed in the blueberries - they didn\'t seem fresh The juicer was also broken so I wasn\'t able to taste the pear juice but I was able to get some orange juiceI won\'t hold it against them that they don\'t have the best part of breakfast (bacon) but that definitely would have made it better Bacon makes everything better If you\'re okay with a bacon-less breakfast check out Gillie\'s Atmosphere and Delicious FoodSome people complain about the service here but I haven\'t had any issues in the 4 years I\'ve eaten here I think their eclectic wait staff and decor are a nice touch for a vegetarian restaurant in a college townThere are MANY vegetarian options plus wine and beer selections They have delicious breads and desserts from their sister coffee shop Bollo\'s Bakery I\'ve had some of the most delicious salads soups and wraps I\'ve had anywhere The Nut Sure salad is DE-LICIOUS!!! And my favorite wrap there is the Peanut Tofu Wrap with a side of chips and salsaAdditionally Gillie\'s features a rotating show of artists on the walls of their fine establishment They also have live music weekly It\'s a wonderful tie-in for a city so full of artists and musicians Gillie\'s is one of the only places in the area to have exceptional vegetarian food It\'s definitely out of the way for me but when given the chance I\'ll never hesitate to drive the 45 minutes for their brunch or dinner I try to get something different every time (which is easy to do because of their wide variety of dishes) and I\'ve yet to be disappointedIt\'s also a great music venue I\'ve been lucky enough to play here once and the staff was very accommodating and had great deals for bands It was very easy to book and the pay reflected the fact that we had to play for 2 hoursBasically I\'ll recommend this place to anyone and everyone because it\'s great and always a pleasant experience Gillie\'s is definitely THE restaurant in Blacksburg that people flock to for brunch; it does get very crowded on the weekends (especially football game weekends) so I would advise to arrive early Yes it\'s vegetarian but I promise that you won\'t miss the meat at all! I\'m a fan of the poached eggs florentine with smoked salmon for brunch but they also offer sweet options if that\'s your cup-of-tea You MUST order their breakfast potatoes: they\'re so perfectly seasoned and addicting However their biscuits are really not great (sorry I still love this place!)  They offer great dinner items too and you feel really healthy after you leave The South Meets Southwest (catfish with goat cheese grits/chipotle butter and arugula) was actually very light and satisfyingService is casual and can be somewhat flaky but that\'s sort of the nature of this place; it\'s local and I think the staff isn\'t too concerned about turnover There\'s live music on certain nights too! Gillie\'s is an absolute gem in Blacksburg and a must whenever you\'re in town Love love love the brunch here The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming the food is great the portion big and the servers make you feel welcoming and at home Not only that but the food comes out fast and fresh and delicious and they cater to vegetarians and vegans Service is excellent and overall the experience will brighten your day This is one of our favorite places for Sunday breakfast We\'ve been happy with all the dishes we\'ve had so farFrittata with veggies and balsamic vinaigrette made to order omelets buckwheat pancakes french toast and tofu scramble yum! Why 4 stars? Arguably one of the best places for brunch in all of Blacksburg Great atmosphere friendly service unique specials and great food They also support other local businesses! Gillies - quintessential stop for college students visiting parents and the hipsters that frequent this placeGillies is a vegetarian restaurant that serves fish although they are most notably known for their brunch With freshly made biscuits Tibetan prayer flags and shade grown coffee - the combination provides for a delicious brunch experienceThe banana walnut french toast consists of hearty pieces of thick french toast drizzled in a caramelized banana glaze topped with sweet walnuts and bananas The combination is impeccable The chappie\'s choice is a mixture of fried potatoes with a strong flavor (I\'ve always tasted curry powder in them) topped with scrambled eggs and white cheddar For the prices ($8 or less) it\'s a great deal!The only problem I have with this place is the service or lack thereof The servers are often very inattentive and all over the place That\'s what happens when the food has a great reputation - the service is lacklusterStill if you\'re in Blacksburg this is definitely a place to go The food is delicious! Red Earth is a great breakfast heresalsa over eggs and their famous potatoes Very tasty place kind of holier-than-thou hipster but whatever They do not have bloody mary\'s or mimosas here so expect to drink some of their yummy coffee or juice They have specials which is also niceThis place is a veggie place Meaning there is no meat Some reviewers talk about the fish but in my 11 years at Blacksburg I\'ve never visited them when they offered fish and I\'ve eaten there a lot Funny story my friend once brought bacon in her purse so she could eat bacon with her breakfast The waitstaff had a conniption They were so dramatic and declared they would now have to "throw the plate away" Really? Then when she did not leave a large tip the waiter chased her down the street complainingSo the moral of the story is do not allow friends to BYOB (Bring your own bacon)??? such as jams in store-bought packets and "fresh squeezed orange juice" served cold (?)I think Gillies should really try to be almost completely locally sourced food rather than just offering (currently) local spinach from Greenstar Farms I am pretty sure most of their clientele would appreciate the shift and be happy to pay a bit more for a truly "local" experienceService is hit or miss some are great some are off-putting I am thankful to have Gillies though because there are not many other decent places within walking distance of campus!
