service I still love it! The Cellar was my favorite restaurant in downtown Blacksburg and one of the few that I really miss since having moved away I ate there frequently during my time as a student at Virginia Tech Their pita wedge with dip appetizers are to die for the crab cheese dip being my absolute favorite!Their sandwiches and pizzas are very good too and their pasta dishes were amazing! Definitely one of the more "mature" feeling places to dine in the college town The upstairs area is well-lit and great for lunch of a quiet dinner with friends (they often have live music) and the downstairs basement area is good for when you want to enjoy dinner and drinks with a larger group of friends This "cellar" area is pretty dark and usually very rowdy though so be forewarnedThe service is sometimes very slow but this is due to the fact that they are usually pretty busy -- a testament to their great food and popularity LOVE The Cellar If you want to have a thoughtful conversation over a delicately prepared entree this isn\'t the place If your main goal in a bar is to guzzle as much bud lite in for as cheap as possible this is also not the place for you The real star at the Cellar is BEER It\'s a place for people who love good beer and their wine list is growing too They have a huge draft list with lots of artisan/craft domestics along with imports It used to be the best place to get New River Pale Ale draft (RIP) :(Upstairs at the Cellar on a week-night can be a nice place to have a conversation plus live music several nights a week Downstairs is always smoky crowded noisy but wonderfully cozy When you keep running into your art/art history professors down there you know you\'re in the right place Around Hammertime the place gets packed If you were thinking about eating during hammertime you are wrong Just getting a pitcher might take 20 min It\'s worth it if you get their early and snag a table for your group of friends You can get a large pitcher for $6 of something that might normally cost $10 or $12 A whole lot of the entrees and pastas are pre-frozen nothing special Don\'t bother with having them de-frost a piece of cheesecake for you either Pizzas are pretty good try the Mexican or the Cellar House Special pizza Subs meh Pita and French Bread pizzas are a great deal and tons of food Aside from recent arrivals like Cafe de Bangkok the Cellar is as close to "real people" (aka not a bunch of stupid frat guys) as Blacksburg gets The pita pizzas are a good deal $5 for a pizza that can be 2 meals! The subs are also pretty decent there However the service is generally slow and sometimes forgetful! I ordered a ginger ale with my meal once and it never came! And I still got charged for it! The moussaka was ehhh the baklava was so-so the beer selection was decent I used to choose this place cause they are the only ones who served Flying Dog Ales but now Rivermill has that as well Awesome food badass service Atmosphere is fun and laid back So much beer! Great selection of foreign and domestic beers and always great food Open Mic nights are always a personal favorite too! A Blacksburg staple Best place to eat and drink in town great food beer and service I\'m a big fan of The Cellar They have yummo food and a great beer selection The pita pizzas are amazeballs but don\'t forget the rest of the menu The salads pastas soups I like them all My favorite was artichoke and roasted red pepper bisque but I haven\'t seen it back on the menu in years The atmosphere is low-key until you hit the live music night I do love going there but service can be slow at times Ah you must try the cucumber dip with warm pita chips it too is delicious The pita pizzas here are amazing I can\'t comment on any other food they serve because the first time I went I ordered a pita pizza and every time after that I did the same The atmosphere is cute and cozy the wait staff friendly though a bit slow and the food is wonderful It is noisy and dark but they have great food Their eggplant parmesan is to die for Their baklava is something special--one time they were out of it because the old lady who makes it was snowed in--wow! I always tried to hit up the cellar with my friends Thursday nights because they have $7 pitchers of any kind of beer on tap! I\'ve never eaten here before so I\'m not sure how the food is The cellar\'s a cool place to hang This place has the biggest balls of meat I\'ve ever seen!!! The beer specials and good pizza make this a solid place especially to avoid the typical Blacksburg undergrad crowd The service is hit-or-miss which is frustrating especially when you know how good it could be don\'t remember much from my two visits here the food was average one thing that i do remember was very very very slow service  it took forever to get our drinks  it took forever to order our food  we got real hungry waiting for the food  and took another 25 minutes to get our checks  So this place has amazing food and the proportions are huge for great prices I especially love their cucumber dip It\'s always fresh and goes well with pita chips or the spanakopitas They also have an amazing crap and shrimp dip that is sometimes spicy but good but something not spicy at all Not real sure why it\'s so variable BUT it\'s always goodTheir best alcohol deal is Luck of the Draw You pay 1$ for a beer of their choosing I\'ve always had good beer with this deal Ohhhh but man has their service went way downhill In the last couple of months I\'ve had horrible service everytime I went They are super super slow One night I was downstairs and I was trying for about 45 minutes to pay for my beer I must have asked each bartender 5 times to bring the check Finally I just gave up and walked out I felt a little guilty for walking out but I didn\'t have all night to sit there and wait for them to get their act together And then most recently our table ordered a pizza some soup and cucumber dip with pita bread The soup and cucumber dip came out fast but then all of a sudden we were waiting for 35 minutes to get our pizza The server never questioned why the tables that arrives after us were receiving their food before us Needless to say we finally got his attention and said we didn\'t want the pizza and that we wanted the checks So we told him which food belonged to which people and which card to charge He got this wrong and charged the wrong amounts on each cardI\'m not so sure if I\'ll be going back It just seems like they need new managers or something to fix the service Good place for cheap beer and huge plates of food with many vegetarian selections - I wouldn\'t make a special trip to eat there (I live ~1 hour away) but pop in when I\'m in town great beer list and happy hour specials the servers are busy but generally attentive great pita wedges too! The service was good and the food was great! I really enjoyed the steak very tasty and tender The side veggies mushroom red yellow peppers and grilled zucchini were awesome! This is a new favorite hangout now whenever we come visit VT Love the atmosphere and the Brazilian fare! Wonderful sauces to select with the steaks! The bean dishes are full of spicy flavor! This is not your typical hole in the wall college restaurant Right outside of downtown this authentic Brazilian cuisine will have your taste buds jumpingI ordered the estrogonofe with a side of grilled pineapple The beef had so much flavor and the rice was lightly buttered with a hint of perfect!!I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a different course of meal in a college town Gaucho Brazilian Grille is a wonderful affordable steakhouse with lots of tasty options The chicken hearts are delicious and can be ordered as an add-on to the entree at 3-4 dollars I got their square meal which is a set meal with veggies rice beans and choice of protein I chose the house-made sausage and it was tasty with good seasoning The rice and salad in the square meals were wonderful as well! I also ordered the tapioca dices I love them! They are sticky inside and crispy outside and taste amazing with the spiced ketchup sauce! Really a pleasant surprise once again thanks to the Yelpers that steered us to it Extensive menu with lots of unique items on it My wife started with a traditional Brazilian drink -? - passion fruit based that she really liked The starters ranged from pretty basic ( plantains) to very unique ( gaucho bacon - aka sweetbreads) I had the combination greens potato salad pickled veggies as an appetizer ( from the side dish menu) and it was good! For the main course my wife had the Brazilian stroganoff - it had great flavor and closely resembled other stroganoffs she has had I had the picanha (sirloin steak) with chimi-rice Steak was good - not great but the chimi-rice was amazing Their potato sticks side was also fantasticOne of our friends ordered off of the vegetarian menu and raved about the portobello mushroom and sweet onionsReasonably priced on top of it all I have never had Brazilian food and this place is absolutely a hidden gem I was in the area for a work trip and was recommended to go to this spot by a coworker We had two appetizers the Dado de Tapioca and the Provolera The tapioca is a fried cheese bread which is sweet decadent crispy and gooey all at once Isabella suggested it with the Agridoce a guava sauce that was spicy and rich and perfect Provolera sounds strange but you will NOT be disappointed (try it with the guava sauce )I tried the Gaucho beer which was interesting and did not disappoint It\'s like a wheat beer with an earthy taste; light flavorful and different from anything I\'ve ever had! I wish I had a growler handy to take this stuff home with me For dinner we shared a half order of Moqueca and added a side of black beans and fried plantains Even a half order between two people was plenty! Everything was cooked perfectly and although the ingredients don\'t sound like they go together it\'s like having a bit is So Paulo in your mouth I\'m not typically a dessert person but I couldn\'t pass it up after all this goodness! Pudim de Leite is similar to a Mexican flan it wasn\'t overly sweet and was the smoothest flan I\'ve ever had Isabella gave us a taste of the Brazilian fudge as well which is TO DIE for I will absolutely be finding any possible excuse to have work bring me back to Gaucho Grille! Hands down one of the best meals I\'ve had in a very long time Everything was cooked to perfection! The jasmine rice was phenomenal and surprisingly simple Wonderfully authentic and flavorful It\'s a good thing I don\'t live here because I would be here daily! Make sure you ask for Alec! He is incredibly knowledgeable about the offerings and made some great suggestions (and some great drinks! ) My niece and I visited Gaucho\'s on a Thursday night while staying in Blackburg for college visits The food was delicious Our waiter was very helpful in making suggestions as I was unfamiliar with the cuisine Good food friendly and helpful service Good mealLocation - a very short safe walk (on sidewalks) from the Hyatt My wife and I came here on an impromptu dinner date before coffee with friends Everything we had was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was relaxing I loved the black beans and the steak was perfect Our server was attentive but wasn\'t hovering We will definitely be back Have been there so many times Love the service and the food My favorite is the sobrecoxa with the chimichurri sauce and the potato salad I like their steak and the Kielbasa sausage beans stew as well Overall it\'s one of my favorite places in Blacksburg My husband and I love this place for date night- it\'s our go to! Great atmosphere- friendly staff and food/drinks are always on point Parking maybe limited in front of the restaurant but there is additional parking at the back It\'s located right behind Starbucks On busy nights it may be good idea to call ahead and make reservations- we\'ve always lucked out but it definitely fills up quick! Great place for a quick lunch date- I met up with an old BumbleBFF friend who was in town for her fall break and we had a great time Food was delicious and the employees were very helpful My boyfriend and I are new to the area and have been working our way through all the fun places to eat then we finally got the chance to try this place and we weren\'t disappointed Great atmosphere and decor our waiter was kind enough to give us a tour of the whole menu since we had never dined here before and even give us his favorites which was extremely helpful Also since we were sitting at a high top in the bar area we got to watch all the meat get grilled up on the huge open grille which was cool The food was absolutely delicious the meat tender and juicy and the sides were flavorful with a ton of different options We will definitely be back to try more of the fun choices on the menu! The food is excellent This was the best meal I had while on a 5 day trip to the area Smells good But that\'s all our family of 5 could experience Walk in lady hardly greets us ask for a table says"No we don\'t have any" Ok"Like for the night?" Fortunately another guy chimes in and says it may be like an hour to hour and a half "Ok no thanks"I would definitely look at getting a better system or greeter for the door What a lovely taste of Brazil in Blacksburg Not only is the service friendly and quick but the food and drinks are delicious I ordered the 5oz sirloin with yucca fries and house salad The chef actually prepares the steaks properly (imagine ordering rare and it actually comes out rare unlike a lot of restaurants that over cook perfectly tasty steaks) and the seasonings used are both simple and delicious that accentuate the natural flavors rather than mask them The Gaucho appetizer platter was also tasty and the chimichurri was a great add to the steak and fries This is a keeper (especially for the price point) Highly recommend to check out their online menu before going if you are not familiar with Brazilian food as the on-line version presents you pictures for better visualization (but be aware that discrepancy may exist For example my corcovado did not contain green leaves but the online menu has) Located just around the corner of a Starbucks Food taste good in general but is a little pricey compared to the portion Also not sure if Brazillian style is pretty close to American style I didn\'t feel strongly any unique Brazillian flavor Anyway a good place to have some high-tier food in Blacksburg Gaucho has some of the best food in Blacksburg and provides a nice environment for great company The service is attentive really makes your experience that much better For dinner I created my own plate I ordered the 5oz Picanha (steak) and the 6oz Manns (sausage) I ordered my steak rare and it was cooked perfectly just as I expected it! Some places tend to overcook your meat but I was surprised that they didn\'t I also got brie cheese on top of the steak with a size of zucchini garlic bread with the chimichurri sauce I have to say that this was one of the best meals I have had in Blacksburg; but with great quality it was a little expensive (my wallet is crying) DEFINITELY get the brie cheese on one of your meats; you won\'t regret it! The steak was delicious and the sausage was amazing as well Again I seriously recommend you get brie cheese it makes your meal so much tastier!! The chimichurri sauce adds a lot of flavor in each bite tooI highly recommend bringing someone here for a cute date or if you are craving steak/meat The atmosphere caters towards a romantic date and the service adds onto that This restaurant is really lowkey too I don\'t think it will get crowded But if you want to play it safe having reservations would not hurt Tonight\'s dinner only qualifies for 1 star but I\'ll give it 2 We went here last year that experience was much better I\'ve been to different sorts of Brazilian restaurants whether it\'s churrascaria style or plated Not only our steak we wanted to order they no longer carry so we just decided to get the Picanha which is Brazilians specialty sirloin So disappointed not only did my husband order the 10oz for 2995 and that\'s just the steak Salad black beans and rice he ordered was a la carte crazy The steak he had was tough too tough not very good quality meat My 5oz Picanha was $1795 just the steak I ordered the rice and eggplant topped with mozzarella also a la carte My favorite thing on my plate was a small portion of eggplant topped with mozzarella We definitely don\'t mind paying more for our steak which we have but this was definitely the worst steak we\'ve ever had Now mind you we live in Yorktown we came up and drove over 4 hours to surprise my stepson for his 20th Birthday just to have dinner with him and we picked this restaurant to celebrate it in because of the meal experienced we had last year We were actually excited to come back Boy was that a disappointment Another thing we brought our own cake to give to him we asked if we can have small plates to serve the cake in there\'s a $10 charge for usage of the plates Wow if that didn\'t "top the icing on the cake" pun intended We decided not to do the cake there That\'s ridiculous really a charge for using the plates??? Picanha steak was dry and overcooked despite being cooked at medium The sandwich was difficult to eat with my hands so ate it with a fork and knife instead Ordered the Chimichurri dipping sauce again I haven\'t eaten many steaks but this was easily the best steak I have ever had (Chuleta for those who are wondering) It was juicy and flavorful and not ridiculously expensive As for the sides I got pineapple and onions The pineapple was great but the onions were not as good Overall this is a great steakhouse and I highly recommend it Just don\'t get the onions Decent steak place great for a treat Menu a bit confusing though that is the only thing id change I really loved the food I ordered the Pitaco a pita version of a taco with perfectly cooked and flavored sirloin (they also offer pork and chicken) with the optional brie The pita was crisped on the grill so it had crunch The flavor was awesome I ordered one and it was enough for me but a big guy would need 2 Service was good and attentive The atmosphere was nice relaxing and casual As others have noted it is expensive for what it is I\'ve eaten here before and will come back but it is not a daily event Came in with 2 toddlers and a baby and they were so accommodating One of the waitresses even brought over paper and highlighters to distract the kids and they had plastic cups! The food was solid Sides were good meat was good sauces were good and the drinks were good (although strong) It\'s on the expensive side - especially for Blacksburg - but sometimes expensive is worth it The decor/menu/ambiance feels a little cheaper than the prices might suggest but with little ones that\'s maybe a plus Great visit perfect score across the board!In Blacksburg there are several good places to eat I visit a few times each year so I\'ve tried several and find the only limitations are locations and atmosphere Gauchos is in a courtyard strip mall which could mean takeout joint with a few tables yet step inside and you get the complete opposite It\'s well decorated and nicely detailed The service is very good relaxed happy servers will Shepard you through the small plate ordering process I\'ve seen some yelp comments about the prices but I think they are fare keeping in mind you can get small plates of anything on the menu and try several items This is the way to go but the bill will add up however the food is really good so the value equals out I met Kiko the owner chef and he\'s a terrific fellow He asked me how I was enjoying my meal as a good I asked for a kiss (exclaims it was terrific) he hugged me and kissed the top of my head that was funny and really a nice human exchange Just try this place and you will see for yourselves this is a gem Parking in the lot is ample and the place has a bar This place has it all FoodDude! It is located in the strip mall across from Kroger behind the Starbucks The restaurant is not visible until you passed the Starbucks There were more parking spaces in the back We did not have any trouble finding a parking space on a Saturday night I did notice the strip mall and the parking area were pretty darkService - everyone was very friendly We had reservation and was seated on time Our waitress was really nice She found out we were there for the first time and went through the menu with us She made some recommendations and checked on us through out the meal The chef came out to check on the guests (probably because it was the end of the dinner hours) and he seemed really niceFood - The four dishes we ordered had nice presentation We all ordered steaks and they were good well seasoned and cooked to order I thought the steak were good cut but slightly more chewy than I expected based on the price point The yucca was crispy on the outside and really fluffy on the inside It was delicious I got guava sauce with my steak The sauce was slightly sweet and had a really nice guava flavor I used it as my salad dressing instead of a dipping sauce The sauteed vegetables (mushroom onion peppers) were VERY salty It was late and we did not bother to send it back to the kitchenPrice (minus 1 star) - This is definitely an expensive restaurant Steak (10 oz - 12 oz) meals were around $25 - $30 This is a good anniversary dinner date type of restaurant It\'s casual but very cozy The food except the sauteed veggies and service were good Even with that I still thought the food was slightly too expensive This is not a typical Brazilian buffet place but much better! The service is fantastic and the food is outstanding We were not expecting having great food in this area and we\'re pleased and stuffed with the awesome appetizers steak and chicken dishes Ask for what\'s a must have here the helpful waiter can make your mouth water when he is describing them We have been three times and the last time way carry out All was great! Carry out took 20 mins (they text you when it\'s ready!) Food is cooked perfectly it\'s delicious and they give you plenty!! Service is great! I\'ve been three times and see this place becoming a regular Love the authentic flavors I wish this place opened for lunch hours some days a week too No matter what you order it\'s simply delicious The menu works best when you share dishes and try several items I\'ll write a full review laterEverything I\'ve ate here is amazing The steak is the best in town It\'s all worth the pricetag Eat here Soft opening now!Gaucho is a new restaurant in Blacksburg but has been in town for a while now in other forms The owners had been regular vendors at the Blacksburg Farmers Market prepared food for local events and festivals and has products in several local independent grocery stores With that said Gaucho\'s new restaurant is a huge step up from what I\'ve seen them make before Which of course makes sense since they were only working with a single gas grill like you\'d have at home Right now during their soft opening they are great variety of food options for you to try Everything we had was excellent I went with another person and we sat right at the grilling area where we were able to talk to the owner (Kiko) We tried out (shared) the signature steak a pork loin a cheese appetizer tapioca cubes potato salad and yucca It was well prepared with a great presentation I think my favorite was the pork loin but I\'d be happy with any of it again Sometimes when I eat food that is from another culture I accept any \'strangeness\' as just part of the experience But all the variation from what I might get at a more common steak place was just plain delicious We didn\'t get a chance to have dessert though but only because there wasn\'t any room left in us! I\'m definitely going back soon though The redesign of the space is great (it used to be a 5 Guys) and parking is easy The service is fast and friendly To go boxes are available and well used thanks to large servings I am not sure if it was pricey or not I\'d say it was a good price for what we got which was a lot (2 appetizers 2 entrees and a beer came to about $50 with tax) So give it a shot! Great new Blacksburg restaurant with lots of good options for everyone Have been to other expensive Brazilian steakhouses where it is all you can eat and this is better! Create your own meal of your favorites without overeating or spending a fortune All food was amazing! Service pleasant and owners attentive and caring recommend as one of the best!!! This place is simply the best I have had since coming to Blacksburg in terms of food quality and friendly prompt service The Gaucho Bomb is out of this world good the steak is always cooked perfectly and the staff is very friendly and eager to make your dinning experience a great one!!!!! I always feel very happy and welcome when eating here which is more than I can say for most places I\'ve tried in this area and for ME service is a very important aspect of dining out This place gets that!!!Keep up the great work!!!! This is the best restaurant in blacksburg by far From the moment you walk in to after you leave amazing environment The best meat appetizers sides you can buy!! If your looking for a good honest yet upscale restaurant Gaucho\'s is the one for you!! Gaucho is like a shiny fragrant beacon in Blacksburg which can seem like a food desert at time replete with only so-so burgers and pizza So Gaucho how do I love thee? Let me (literally) count the ways: 1 Wonderfully savory seasoned meats grilled to perfection; 2 Fresh tasty vegetables to even the guilt about #1;3 Strong cachaa cocktails;4 Ever-expanding menu loaded with new favorites;5 Delightfully strange and addictive appetizers and desserts;6 Lovely green decor with Brazilian jazz soundtrack; and of course 7 Warm and committed staffI\'ve tried something new at every visit and haven\'t had a miss yet Nevertheless you can\'t go wrong with the square meals If you\'re on a budget the chicken is just as delicious as the beef Be adventurous! Try ordering out of your comfort zone! The chef (who is also the owner I think) makes some of the best food I\'ve ever had in my life It\'s clear that taste is of the upmost importance The atmosphere is great for a date You can even see the chef cooking all the food on the wood grill in the center of the restaurant Took our son and three of his friends for dinner on this past Friday night We made reservations online when we got to town and our table was waiting for us Based on others recommendations we all went for the square meal and we all loved it Would definitely go again (and treat our son and his friends this place is not college budget friendly) Given the quality of the food we thought it was a good value If you are a meat lover you will definitely love this place I am living in NYC and love to try all kinds of food I am confident to give a five star review and recommend it The smoke sausage is too good to miss and the steak is also amazing better than lots of steakhouses The restaurant has bar small tables and large tables so it is great for any events I have been to a number of Brazilian restaurants Gaucho\'s is right up there at the top Although not the "turn over a card glutton factory" you get plenty of food What separates Goucho\'s is their side dishes and deserts One of the few Brazilian places that you can actually go to and have small portions Great atmosphere and service Given what I\'ve read on Yelp about this place my wife and I were so disappointed The food is really nothing special at all The pork chop I had was the toughest meat I think I\'ve ever had Literally after finishing half of the portion I was given my jaws were fatigued I didn\'t actually finish it--I brought half of it home with the hopes that my wife could salvage the meat and use it to make something edible My wife had the potato salad which was not very different from the stuff you can get from Sam\'s club The beans that we both got were watery and overcooked The only decent thing was the fried tapioca but that wasn\'t even anything special Overall if you are looking to blow $50-$70 on a meal you could do much better than this placebut perhaps not in Blacksburg Seems like in this town if you aren\'t looking for pizza burgers or burritos you\'re pretty much out of luck This is the real thing This is Brazil Best steak ever Order with the feijo and the flight of caipirinhas The best restaurant in Blacksburg I was walking down N Main St following directions from my phone when I realized I had walked too far If you\'re like me and ended up walking to the National Bank on the corner you missed the small sign a few stores ago so head back until you get to The UPS Store and turn down the alleyway They have two entrances and plenty of seating for being a small coffee shop I used the check in special for 25% off a hand made drink which includes almost anything except maybe the nitro coffee I ordered the 16oz Sweet Latte and it came out to $413 It\'s the perfect blend of espresso and sweetness If I wasn\'t from out of town I\'d definitely come back It has a good vibe if you want to study or read a book Cute coffee shop and friendly staff! I had an iced mocha which was define (they use ganache as their mocha flavoring rather than a sugary syrup so good!) The location of this shop Is perfect for the farmers market I ordered a vanilla latte and my husband ordered a drip coffee both of which were delicious The only funky thing about this shop is the area where you order It felt like we were hovering over people who were already seated But if you are looking for a good cup of coffee that is reasonably priced and delicious then go here I like it but I don\'t love it The coffee is quality but I\'ve had the pumpkin latte and a mocha latte and was less than impressed with both I also tried a jam bar and it was just ok the jam was more gummy in texture and did not taste fresh I\'ve been trying to find a local coffee place since moving here from California and I feel that my standards may be set a little high I\'ll probably come here again just not regularly This is a place that I\'ll sincerely miss once I\'ve left Blacksburg and I\'m sad that it opened up in my later years here at Tech The location is rather small so there is seating but usually only single seats or two person tables I\'ve been here before with a group of four and it definitely felt a little cramped but they try to make the most of their small space Their menu is small but very very good - every drink I\'ve tried here has been wonderful Their cappuccino is one of the best and I had their iced sweet latte today and was pleased to see that it was handshaken and just sweet enough The baristas are friendly but can sometimes be a little slow as it\'s usually manned by one person (or two at the most) The atmosphere is very calming and soothing so a little atypical from typical coffee shop bustle but with a steady stream of customers even late in the afternoon Overall I highly recommend checking Idego out and supporting its small business! Small and cozy and hidden off the main strip Also great barista and great coffee Almond milk as a substitute Very impressed Clean bright place and a very friendly and helpful barista (Gary) who made perhaps the best iced mocha I\'ve ever had Their selection of drinks on their menu is short but I\'m of the impression that they can pretty much make up whatever you may desire and request I also like how clean the interior is which is a nice departure from the clutter you find in some coffeehouses Fresh coffee and pleasant atmosphere Nice customer service Terrific local coffee shop Highly recommend We were in town to visit some friends on the way to DC and were looking for a good local coffee shop The reviews caught my eye so we came here We simply ordered a "good cup of coffee" and we got a GREAT cup of coffee My husband is from Seattle so we consider ourselves coffee snobs--this little purveyor is totally on pointe Even as the coffee cooled (I\'m a slow drinker) the flavors were delicious and complex I\'m not kidding when I say that if you want to be wowed by a cup of brewed coffee come here You\'ll forget how much you paid for it and feel supremely smug about supporting a local establishment that sources it\'s beans from small domestic roasters Blacksburg is so lucky to have this place Paul cares about coffee and it shows The drinks are amazing by any standard The food comes from Roanoke and is decent If you are a coffee snob you won\'t be disappointed No sickly sweet drizzling of caramel all over everything No weird milk/coffee ratios in lattes or cappuccinos If you just want a regular cup of coffee you also won\'t be disappointed No one giving you a 2 hour lecture about the hillside where the beans were grown No one condescending to you because you don\'t know whether you want the Ethiopian or the Mexican No one judging you for adding milk to your coffee or not knowing what a cortado is Awesome experience here! Paul\'s your manI had the Maker\'s Reserve in a Chemex and it was wonderfulFYI: Internet speeds were (tested 3 times): 66M bps down / 06 Mbps upOh and the coffee is amazing but prices are super cheap! $250 for a Chemex? That\'s nuts (Compare to a typical $4-$5) Great cappuccino Great service Great window seat Great music Great location The pattern in my cappuccino remainder until the bottom of the cup! By far this is the best coffee shop in Blacksburg (in the NRV really) Their coffee selection is excellent only using really well-sourced well-roasted beans Plus they know how to brew so that it brings out the different flavors Also just a nice calm place to hang out for a while Oh and they bring in pastries from Bread Craft in Roanoke - sooooo good I was invited to meet a friend at Idego today I walked in and there was a woman sitting at the bar and a baby in a car seat on the floor This was the wife & child of the man behind the counter; who didn\'t smile nor did he scowl He sort of waited for me to respond but to what I had not decided According to Wikipedia (hahah) Id references uncoordinated instinctual trends Ego references organized realistic part that mediates between the desires of the id and the super-ego The super-ego can stop one from doing things the id may want to do I was not sure if I was in his head or if he was in mine I quickly ordered a mocha I always start with a mocha and then on the second visit will try a cup of dark brew These two things tend to solidify my thoughts on knowing whether or not a coffee shop knows what they are doing The sign on the door said LaMarzocco A superb machine! The mocha was a gold standard No whip cream but rather a frothie milk so delicate it feels like silk on your lips; topped off with a beautiful heart My only regret is that I did not take a picture Don\'t come expecting to eat; they have a small selection of muffins scones and cookies However if a perfectly made cup of coffee if your thing; I think the Id is worth the interaction because the Ego leads the mark on perfection Awaiting to hear the storyplease Idego do tellI will be back and would encourage you to go out of your way for a cup at Idego See what part of their story you can find out After seeing the great reviews I came in here to get an iced coffee - wherever the coffee is from - it is the best coffee I had in town! I hate to say but Bollos comes second for me! They have been open for about 6 months no doubt this place is going to thrive for years to come! Best espresso you can get anywhere in the Blacksburg Christiansburg area Closest real competition is sweet donkey in Roanoke Absolutely stunning prices for the quality of the drinks much lower cost than surrounding locations WiFi could be better and i find it too chilly at times but this is a great place of you\'re looking for a friendly atmosphere Get to know the barista and regulars at the counter they are always up for a chat Definitely the best coffee in the area A close second is Lucie Monroe\'s in Christiansburg This place deserves a 5/5 for the coffee alone and has a great vibe but the inside feels a tad sterile and could use some sprucing up They just recently relocated though so I suspect the atmosphere will improve with time It\'s also close enough downtown to grab food at multiple places Parking is dumb - I recommend parking on the street somewhere or in a lot elsewhere and walking a bit to save some money Idego Coffee is unlike any other caf you could go to Paul is such an interesting and involved guy especially when he is making your coffee This place gives you the full experience They even offer coffee tastings every Friday evening! If you are looking for more an exprerience than speed or love that honetown feel don\'t pass up Idego; and also be sure to try the caramel latte it\'s incredible! Every thing about this place is amazing You can\'t go wrong with anything you order They are priced very well for what you get too! The owner is a wonderful person as well Very cute little shop Visiting my mom and dropped by for a coffee great stuff Good to see places like this in the area Lovely art from locals adorns the walls (some for sale) Paul can help you key in on a drink you would enjoy while explaining why you do things specific ways to improve the process snd get the best possible drink Love the "Sweet Tooth" options I am not a coffee person so I enjoy having other items to choose from The hot chocolate is wonderful! Best I have ever had! Easily the best in Southwest Virginia Really a world-class coffee shop Great coffee and a very knowledgable staff The shop itself is small but has a sleek feel to it that is a refreshing alternative to the other coffee shops in town Best coffee out there!! Don\'t waste money on anything else as they can\'t come close and great customer service! Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings The staff is super kind and patient Willing to answer any questions you may have if you\'re not sure about an item Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings I\'ve been MANY times over the last few years and I keep telling people about it so more and more people will know it\'s there and it will stay! Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings - Fried Dumplings Did I mention the fried dumplings and sauce? NOMNOMNOM I may or may not have gone there and ordered two orders to make a meal of them {I really wanted 3 orders but contained my cravings} Essentially pan-asian street food Exactly what we came for The dumplings were as great as other reviewers lead you to believe! They grew on me even more as we ate themThe Sweet and Spicy cold noodles were alright There were some good flavor combinations in there but I think wife and I are hot noodle peopleThe guy taking our order was very nice and quick on getting things ready A second worker was really hard to understand when yelling out the orders but equally niceI\'d love to see a slightly expanded menu By university mall there are a bunch of places especially the dreaded math emporium Now even though no one likes the math emporium there are a bunch of food options around there One of them being Marco & LucaMarco & Luca is located all the way on the left of the mall strip so a lot of people tend miss it They mainly serve dumplings and cold noodles but they also have other items such as the soup and steam buns I ordered dumplings sesame noodles a pork bun and hot and sour soup This place is relatively fair priced except for the dumplings They are relatively small and $4 for 6 For me though the dumplings are probably the best item on the menu They serve fried dumplings on top of a sauce that taste amazing The sesame noodles look pretty bland but they have a nice settle flavor to them Works perfectly with the dumpling sauce if you want to pour some of it on your noodles I am not a fan of the pork buns There is very little filling and they top it off with some type of sauce but you can\'t really taste it As for the soup I was not a huge fan of it either The ingredients and color were different from the hot and sour soup that I am familiar with The soup also was hot from the temperature not really from the taste There was also a slight note of sourness but unless you were looking for it you probably wouldn\'t have noticed Overall I probably wouldn\'t come back because it\'s a little too pricey for the amount of food I get However if you are ever looking for something light to eat in between meals I highly suggest the dumplings here The sauce for the dumplings is really good It\'s a little hole in the wall place in university mall that you won\'t be sorry you checked out It\'s got great food for great prices There\'s not much in the way of ambience and it\'s a no frills kinda place but it\'s good for a quick bite or takeout The people who work there are always friendly and the food comes out very quickly They don\'t have a very extensive menu but what they do have is very good - especially the pan fried pork dumplings! The sauce that comes with it is sooo good Ordered the fried dumpling and sesame noodles (sorry I forgot the name ) The service was super fast and the man in charge was very polite The dumplings were juicy and perfect like usual And the noodles were a refreshing contrast Overall a great place to get a quick meal Prices are not worth the food you get Fried dumplings are about have the size expected with little flavor soaked in a sauce Pork bun is bland with weird glaze Why do these little dumplings taste like heaven?! Do yourself a favor and get two orders instead of one because you\'re going to want to keep eating them! So cheap and so delicious! Try to eat them there because they do get soggy if you get them to go or wait till the next day to eat them (though I don\'t know who would wait that long to eat them) The noodles and buns were average and I probably would just skip them and get another order of the dumplings instead Service is fast and the workers were kind Would definitely come back here! i\'m in town from NoVa so i guess i am just used to a certain standard of asian food i brought my parents here (they are asian) and it was so disappointing that the meal was just uncomfortably silent as we quietly powered through our meal the dumplings are fine (probably best part of the meal) the buns are ok the sesame noodles we threw them away the food isadequate the man working there was very nice i guess i just don\'t understand the high reviews for extremely average food UPDATE: After being told "Shut up bitch!" I spoke with the new management at Marco and Luca - Blacksburg location as well as the original Marco and Luca owners in Charlottesville The owners of Marco and Luca in Charlottesville told me the Blacksburg locations\' management has been transitioned to Bill therefore they didn\'t have much control over the employees However they were still interested in hearing me out and once they heard the story they apologized over and over again also displaying a bit of fiery anger for their children\'s names being butchered (Marco and Luca are their children) When I talked to Bill same deal he was very apologetic and he\'s in this massive management transition this very month (Oct 2018) so I\'m sure a lot were out of his hands as well The point here is that the owners/managers are aware of such guy working and representing their business and they all seemed to be pretty furious Bill gave me the word that he will replace this employee as soon as possible I hope he\'s a man of his word Not just for my sake but for the character and integrity of their business Paul and I ate at Marco & Luca for the first time today Service was speedy and friendly I was impressed by the young man who was running the counter cooking and serving food The best part of our experience was the sweet sesame noodles Paul ordered They were absolutely delightful The hot and sour soup was good but it was missing the sour component which made it hot soup (temperature and spiciness) If you like to feel the burn and/or want your sinuses opened up give this soup a tryOn a less positive note the dumplings which so many reviewers rave about are essentially flavorless Neither the dough nor the filling have any oomph Besides the dismal dumplings the restaurant serves all their food in styrofoam and paper containers which is a sin in my opinion The seats are terribly uncomfortable--hard and ricketyNext time I will order the noodles and soup and opt for takeout Came here at 7:20 on a Saturday night Walked up with a couple who had called ahead their order to find people inside eating and working but all locked doors We tried to get the attention of the guy behind the counter after double checking the sign on the neon door saying open and the posted hours claiming they were open until 8:30 He ignored us and when another patron asked him if she could open it for us he had her sign to us that it was closed The other couple had already paid for their order If they\'re this bad up front I don\'t want to try the food Excellent quick light meal at a good price I had the sesame noodles and an order of dumplings and will return soon The dumplings here are great! A must have if you stop by I also get their sweet and sour noodles which are yummy The only thing I miss ALMOST as much as college is this place When they opened my Sophmore year I was apprehensive Dumplings? I can make these at home can\'t I? Well not like this The sauce they serve them with is exactlty the perfect mixture of sweet and salty The dumplings are great quality and even when they are busy the food is served quickly The cold noodles werent my favorite but I always loved their egg drop soup I haven\'t been in years but the food was great for a solid 3 years Was looking for dinner and Marco & Luca showed up on my yelp search It says on yelp that this restaurant is open until 9 but I got there at 8 and they were locking the doors and closing down for the night I didn\'t catch his name but this very nice man let me in and made me dumplings even though they were closing down shop The dumplings were absolutely delicious and the soy sauce and sweet chili sauce were a great touch I will definitely be coming back the next time I\'m craving dumplings! (: THE dumpling place Nothing more impressive than this one guy making killer food for a whole line of people This is a small place with a small menu that is apparently a popular spot for VA Tech students It was the weekend and school was out so the place was totally quiet I got the sweet & sour & spicy noodles and some fried dumplings The noodles are served cold but the fusion of flavors of sliced apples cilantro green onions and that sweet and spicy sauce was a great mix If you\'re looking for something different that you haven\'t had anywhere else this place is quick and easyand cheap Hands down best dumplings I\'ve ever had! This quirky little place has a corner location in an outdoor strip mall It has a really inviting atmosphere and in nicer weather there are even several outdoor tables around the side Order/pay at the counter and they\'ll let you know when your order is ready When I was visiting there was only one employee working He took about six orders at a time and then prepared them all at once That\'s a logical way to do it since he didn\'t have any help and if he made them in batches they were prepped faster He was really friendly even thanking me for stopping by and saying goodbye when I left I had taken a tiny table near the window and I read a book there for about an hour and I didn\'t get frowned on for spending a longer time at a table than necessary for eating I was very impressed by both the dumplings and the cold noodles I tried Excellent food at really reasonable prices! Highly recommended! Can\'t get enough if this place Honestly just go I usually order the dumplings and the spicy noodles and they are a fantastic combination I literally live this place and love going here It\'s good food that is cheap and SUPER FAST service I always recommend this to friends! I went here TWICE within a day Came to VT to visit my friends and because I heard such great things about this place I made sure to stop by! My first visit I got two orders of the friend dumplings and goodness gracious it was delicious! For only about $7 you get 14 mini dumplings that will make your mouth water The signature sauce is unforgettable! The second time I visited (a few hours later) I got the dumplings and tried the cucumber cold noodles To me it was very ordinary nothing special about those noodles but my boyfriend seemed to really enjoy itIf you go to VT or in the area make sure to stop by for some yum dumplings!! This place is awesome for those who eat pork The cold apple noodles are awesome but man those dumplings smell so much better! A very great option but not for people who don\'t eat pork or meat in general This is a great little placeI love the fact that they have such a small menu I see a lot of reviews here mention it like it\'s a bad thing but I dig it I\'d much rather go to a place with a just few great choices than to a place with a long list of mediocre options It simplifies thingsThe first thing I tried was the cold noodles with peanut sauce because my GF brought some home for me to try It was very delicious; reminiscent of the cold noodles I had in Tokyo and the peanut sauces I\'ve had in various Thai places Again I see a lot of other reviews here complaining about the noodles being cold but cold noodle dishes are not uncommon in the East Yes they did kind of seem like spaghetti noodles but they were fantastic nonethelessBecause the noodles were so good we went back a couple of days later and tried a few more thingsThe dumplings were truly incredible I wouldn\'t say there were the best dumplings that I have ever eaten (I\'ve had a LOT of dumplings in my life) but they were definitely amazing Furthermore the sauce they are served with is really wonderfulWe also tried the pork buns Again awesome Spongy and filled with porky goodness Plus they are served with that same delicious sauceHonestly this place is so good I would continue to go there even if they only one item on the menu  and it wouldn\'t matter which one! I would drive up there just for the noodles I would drive up there just for the dumplings And I would drive up there just for the pork buns The fact that they have all three just means I have three times as many reasons to go! With such a small menu you know that their heart and soul must go into each dish - and it shows! Delicious steamed buns and crispy dumplings and the cold sesame peanut noodles are so refreshing on a warm day Prompt service with fresh dumplings dropped in the pan as you order them An excellent spot to hit right after spending some time at the Math Empo A real Blacksburg treasure Very simple very delicious!Dumplings are always crispy and packed full of flavor especially coupled with the Marco Luca Soy SauceSesame and Sweet and Sour Spicy noodles are a good sized serving and never fail to satisfyTry the Hot and Sour Soup when you have a chance it\'s very cheap and very yummy! Good not amazing but hella cheap! There is something to be said for finding quick chow on a college campus A place with a very limited menu can pan out one of two ways One be a hole in the wall and serve a menu one can count on one hand because they\'ve perfected all of it OR two be a hole in the wall out of choice with so-so dishes taking advantage of circumstanceI think this place is maybe more the second AND perhaps journeying toward the first I wanted to "literally" (think Chris from Parks and Rec) stumble into an awesome dumpling shop hidden from everyone but the privy and gustatory collegiate elite at VT but did notThe place has a great wall of soda in front of their counter The service is quick and stern Atmosphere inside takes advantage of whatever business was there before and adds some Chinese (??) decor like painted scrawls wooden gates and oversized red paper lanternsThe dumplings are on the smaller side come fried and swimming in the special house sauce I like for the dumpling to be a little more bready but these were pretty good The steamed pork bun wasn\'t as fluffy as I\'m used to but still pretty good Sweet and sour soup had seaweed tofu egg drop in it I didn\'t care too much for it The cold noodles in sesame and peanut sauce were nice Sauce was a little sweet and noodle serving very generousOverall I docked the stars because the atmosphere was lacking and the dishes offered though inexpensive were not incredible Given that the atmosphere doesn\'t give me a reason to hang out and 4/4 items I ordered were just ok I don\'t have much reason to come back Marco & Luca is the type of place that focuses on what they know best offering a limited menu of dumplings buns or noodles Their dumplings are some of my favorite always crispy and flavorful and served with a sauce that\'s reminiscent of thick slightly sweet hoisin sauce and hot chili oil Their noodles served cold always hit the spot packing that same perfectly balanced sweet and heat taste that the dumpling sauce has The only issue I\'ve ever had was that once I was served a bun that was still cold inside; I assume they buy those or make them ahead and freeze them but either way it just needed to be steamed a little longer Without a doubt when I am visiting Blacksburg and craving Asian food I had straight to Marco & Luca The dumplings are heavenly as is the sauce Not much else going on but good for a quick stop or light dinner! Very solid place for dumplings The food here is simple tasty and at very reasonable price I usually pair my dumplings with sesame noodle As a Hokie you\'re deprived of "Asian" food on campus Venturing off campus to find Asian food spots may take you to a gem like Marco & Luca Known for their cheap and tasty dumplings Marco & Luca never fails to satisfy my craving They have a very small menu but each item is crafted to perfectionOther than the dumplings my personal favorites would be the sesame noodles w/ peanut sauce and their hot & sour soup The sesame noodles are cold and refreshing which is a different but pleasurable take on conventional noodles The hot & sour soup provides a remedy for all sicknesses tooAs I look back at my time at Virginia Tech Marco & Luca has been one of top go-to food options I highly recommend you come here even if you\'re not craving dumplings It\'s a nice small snack while you\'re studying at the Math Empo and a great option if you\'re adventurous and want to try something new One day I hope to meet Marco & Luca so I can tell them how much I love their food I enjoy their pasta dishes especially the cold sesame noodles I just get bummed when I go in and everyone\'s getting dumplings but there are no vegetarian dumplings If dumplings are what they\'re known for couldn\'t they consider offering a vegetarian option? Great place to eat--I\'ve eaten here dozens of times Soup is very good dumplings are very good and the sesame noodles are very good Super delicious dumplings in a savory sauce Came through Blacksburg on our way out east The drive off of interstate 81 is well worth the detour The place did not have many people in it and I was surprised as the food was out of this world Lovely porky bun a little pricey for two fifty for one but tasty none the less Highly recommend this place The dumplings were fantastic and inexpensive! They are fried and come in the most amazing sauce What I liked best was the employees--very friendly and quick After reading the reviews I thought I should try the fare at this restaurant I\'ve never had steamed pork bun and was excited to try it Have to say I was disappointed in how tough it was Very unexpected Not much meat inside as well The dumplings were tasty and I\'d go back again for those when the craving hits me Indian music Italian name Chinese food KindaI didn\'t realize it at the time but this is a dumpling house and not a Chinese food restaurant I came in on a cold day wanting some nice hot food and saw that the menu options were limited Dumplings Steamed buns Soup Cold noodles They appear to have a limited kitchen capability The cold noodles were true to their name in temperature but very flavorful The hot and sour soup was a little bit peppery for my taste The steamed bun tasted very good I\'ll have to come in again to try to dumplings since that\'s their specialty A small eatery famous for its fried dumplings Besides that it serves cold noodles steam buns soups and fountain drinks that\'s all The fried dumplings are different from potstickers as they are completely fried to form a crispy yet a little hard shell I would prefer potstickers with only the bottom deep fried The apple pieces makes the cold noodle bowl unique I\'ve never seen people do that before and I think to put apple pieces is a brilliant idea: apple\'s sweet taste neutralize the hot flavor from the noodle source Hot and sour soup is similar as other Chinese restaurants but is spicier Will come and try the buns next time Marco & Lucaoh how I\'ve missed you guys During undergrad you guys were my best friends I saw you guys so often that you even thanked me with extra dumplings all the time! You guys are the best most Hokies would agree and if you\'re a new Hokie reading this to determine whether or not you must try this place then let me tell youYOU MUST Cheap Satisfying Filling What more could you ask for?! The dumplings are fried to perfection and the cold noodles are delicious Both sesame or sweet & sour are great option but I personally prefer the sweet & sour a little bit more For $350 you get 7 dumplings and $4 for noodles You also have the option of choosing pork buns as well Don\'t expect gourmet dumplings but for a money conscious college student this is a great place to grab food for less than $10 Depending on the time of day or the time of year this place can get pretty busy or just the complete opposite Regardless the service is always friendly and fast Have I convinced you yet?! My fiance and I used to drive from Blacksburg to Charlottesville just for these famous dumplings Of course now that we\'ve left Blacksburg for good this place comes and plants itself right in the Math Empo strip mallAnyway we were visiting Tech this weekend and stopped in two days in a row It\'s just as delicious as we remember it Of course we got the dumplings We both got double orders because you can\'t possibly just have one The dumplings were cooked perfectly and the sauce the sauce is just the best I don\'t know what they put in it but it\'s amazing Also for $3 an order there\'s no excuse not to eat theseI also got their sesame noodles in peanut sauce This was a cold noodle dish that\'s kind of like a salad and that too was very good The sauce made the dish Though these noodles were great I think the best item on their menu are the dumplings so the next time I go I\'ll prob double up on those again Actually the next time I go I\'ll probably call ahead and buy 100 frozen ones and a big cup of sauce and just take them home with me Real talk though you guys just go eat here and order a million dumplings you won\'t regret it Wish there were warm noodles cold just isn\'t my taste I guess Also I thought the sauces were too sweet Otherwise this place is a great spot for a quick and simple meal on a student budget Dumplings are great and I love their dipping sauce However with such a limited menu it\'s not worth my time to go Not sure how this is such a popular chain Amazing food for great prices Fast and friendly service too! Definitely recommend to anyone in the Blacksburg area One day I was taking the bus from the empo home when I noticed a new sign where the Quizno\'s used to be - what the hell was Marco & Luca? I quickly googled it on my phone and then became determined to try it out asap Alas! I was not the first one to get a review in on Yelp but I am here to leave a review Marco & Luca are famous for their dumplings in Charlottesville and rightfully so Thank goodness they opened up a location in Blacksburg! And for 6 dumplings for the price of $3 it\'s definitely not a bad deal - in fact it\'s a great one! They\'re smaller more ball-shaped dumplings but they are pretty filling and do come with the Marco & Luca special soy sauce Besides being really flavorful and tasty they\'re also nicely crunchy The first time I ordered these I had to stop myself from getting up to get another order even though I felt full Along with my sampling of dumplings I also got the steamed bun (pork) and the hot & sour soup Personally I didn\'t like the steamed bun all that much - the dough for it felt a little thick (a little like the thick traditional pancakes you eat with Peking duck if you\'re Asian savvy) and it wasn\'t as fluffy or as full of meat as it could have been As another review mentioned maybe if the price was a little lower (it\'s $2 a bun) On the other hand for only $150 the hot & sour soup definitely delivered - it was extremely flavorful and warmed me right up! They\'re not skimpy on the tofu or seaweed in the soup as well which really adds to the flavor Other things on the menu include two cold noodle dishes and a veggie steamed bun but I\'ll have to save that for a followup I\'ve heard good things about the noodles and also spotted a few people eating it while I was there! All in all you can\'t go wrong with the dumplings - they\'re delicious Though with the prices it\'s easy enough to eat through Marco & Luca\'s entire menu I\'ll definitely be coming here more often! Basic cheap $9 for dumplings pork bun and soup I liked the soup more than the food items to be honest The sauce on the food was plentiful so much so that it leaked from the crappy take out containers I was given about 25 napkins so somewhere a tree is crying Would love to give it a 5 star review because we were excited to try everything after reading other reviews BUT Walked in at 8ready to order at 8:05NOTE Clock said 8:10 He wanted to know eat in or carry out We said eat in He was quick to tell us that they close at 8:30and obviously didn\'t care to have our business So we walked out Good luck with any success with that attitude! Completely awesome dumplings soup and cold noodles Visited multiple times and will continue to do so Chinese buns Dumplings Coke It\'s simple and you can\'t really get it anywhere else around here That makes it damn good when you\'re craving dumplings Those were some solid Dumplings!  Just a tad crispy nice thicker Soy sauce Very good  The Hot and Sour cold noodles were very good as well and the Hot and Sour Soup was unique and delicious  Might have to eat here again before I head back to Cincy!I am not a fan of the "to go" styrofoam containers Come On! Get with the 2010s and Go Green!  Compost Friendly Paper Container would be much cooler!!!!! The perfect local spot Has a very friendly atmosphere and cheap prices $350 for a TON of dumplings that are incredible I will definitely be back to try the other few menu items but for the price and quality Marco & Luca cannot be beat Giving it 5 stars because the fried dumplings and hot & sour soup are some of the best I\'ve ever had I wasn\'t a huge fan of the cold noodles but I think that was more of a personal preference I like my food hot The steamed bun is different and worth a try but get some dumplings and soup and you\'ll be very very happy Super cheap too A great lunch spot! I just wish they had some kinda of hot noodle dish like a veggie lo mein to go with the dumplings Great food that is ready very fast I had:Fried dumplings - you get 6 and they were perfectly crispySweet and sour spicy noodle - dish is served cold but is goodPort hot bun - comes out really really hot but is satisfying and filling My husband and I have been going to Marco and Luca since we were dating (we\'re young but that\'s still about 4 or 5 years) We used to go to the one in Charlottesville so we were elated to find out there was one in Blacksburg (We even got our engagement pictures taken in the one back home)Marco and Luca\'s is great it\'s good food it\'s inexpensive and they\'re always friendly Walked in and saw a very very small menu and got a little concerned but don\'t let that alter your decision Easily the best fried dumplings I\'ve ever had and their Marco Luca soy sauce is amazing Definitely coming here again The menu is pretty limited but what they have is done pretty well It\'s also worth it for the amount you pay For under $20 we got two serves of dumplings two buns a thing of noodles and a soup and that was enough to adequately feed two people without being super stuffed The buns were okay but not great They came with sauce on the bottom which made the bread a bit soggy Noodles were good (we got the spicy ones with apple) and even though they\'re cold noodles the spicy sauce was a good belly-warmer The dumplings were tasty--I\'d probably just get these and the noodles next time and forgo the buns No way I was expecting such a great experience from a place that looks like this does Simple menu perfectly executed The cold noodles are spiced in such a way that the flavor becomes more complex as the meal continues Dumplings are perfectly crisp while not being dry Very nice Get the dumplings and a pork bun and you\'ll be a happy soul Tried this place yesterday after driving by numerous times I didn\'t know what they served only that they had a dumplings sign in the windowNeedless to say i walked in and saw that their menu consisted of dumplings cold noodles pork or vegetable bun and hot and sour soup Not a huge fan of hot and sour soup in general nor cold noodles and since the sign in the window said dumplings I thought i would get an orderAnd wowthat saucethe dumplingsdelicious! Simply amazing dumplings You get 5 or 6 but they are really filling and enough to leave you satisfied The best part about Marco and Luca\'s is how inexpensive it is The only downside to this place is that they have very few menu options They are so good at dumplings I wonder what other delicious cuisine they could whip up But it seems to be working so more power to them! When my boyfriend told me he knew where to get delicious dumplings I thought he was nuts I swore I wouldn\'t like them because I\'m a very picky eater However one bite changed my mind completely I crave these like no other I typically get 2 orders each time I go because I haven\'t gotten brave enough to try some other thingsI have had a bite of my boyfriend\'s sesame noodles but I was not a fan because they tasted too much like peanut butter for my taste I\'m excited to try the sweet and spicy noodles though! Wonderful place and now I\'m craving dumplings again so I guess I know where I\'m eating lunch tomorrow! Great food! Can\'t beat it for the price and friendly service Although I just started reviewing this is the place that I would reviewed beginning Came here to try the dumplings had to order 2 more and the sweet & sour soup which was surprisingly delicious (I didn\'t think I\'d like the tofu) Great food for a great price! I\'ve come here several times and their menu is consistently good I always get the dumplings because they are filling flavorful and a great deal Also there aren\'t any other places in town with fresh dumplings soThe dumplings are fried so they have a crunchy exterior The oil makes it more difficult to overload them with sauce but I usually manage Speaking of which they have a unique sweet slightly spicy soy-ish sauce that they put with their dumplings and buns which is rather tasty although I wish it was a bit more spicy to balance out the sweetness I\'ve had both the veggie bun and the pork bun I find the cabbage flavor to be a hair strong in the veggie bun but it\'s filled with cabbage so that is to be expected The pork bun is filled with tender pulled barbecue pork that makes me weep tears of gold Seriously it is that good I\'ve gotten their peanut sauce noodles and they were good but not my favorite of their offerings They are cold not room temperature Maybe I will try again in he summer The hot and sour soup seems to be a bit unpopular on here but I adore it It has big pieces of soft (but not silken) tofu and egg in it as well as seaweed and scallions and a strong flavor of black pepper It is piping hot when served and so even though it is not extremely spicy it can clear you out by the time you reach the bottom of the container which has to be about three to four cups in volume-extremely generous for the 250 priceThat\'s the other thing about Marco and Luca\'s you can eat a lot for less than ten dollars I usually get a soup and dumplings and pay about seven after taxes I could not recommend a place more fervently The price point of this place is really the main attraction The food itself is a hit or miss depending on what you order Overall it\'s okay I recommend it for a quick bite and if you\'re up for something new Very good soup and pork buns! 9 bucks with a drink! Went there while traveling based in the reviews and they don\'t lie very good simple food Pretty much the best dumplings ever My daily lunch spot basically Its super cheap (Used to be cheaper though they shadow raise the price twice a couple years back but it\'s still a great deal) You pretty much can\'t go wrong with anything on that menu my favorite is the dumpling and soup combo Pretty much the perfect lunchor snack I\'ll miss this place when I leave Blacksburg I wandered into this place and wasn\'t entirely sure what to expect I was surprised by the friendly service and by how quickly my food was ready I ordered dumplings and steamed pork buns and I really enjoyed both The prices were pretty cheap and I spent less than nine dollars on dumplings pork buns and a drink I\'m a little used to Chinese food practices where they stuff a ton of food into each order but even though the serving sizes were a little smaller than expected they were still pretty filling The dumplings were fried and soaked in their house sauce which tastes almost like soy sauce and complements the dumplings The steamed pork buns were very fluffy and the pork inside was really good Overall the food was nothing to write home about but I still liked it and I\'ll definitely go back to try some other things on the menu Their dumplings are amazing worth the slightly longer walk from mall entrance to their place They fry up frozen dumplings for you and serve them with their \'specialty\' sauce It\'s pretty good but not phenomenal You can purchase similar dumplings from any Asian markets for much cheaper price This shop is certainly better than overpriced mediocre Panera So if you are tempted to go to Panera for a quick lunch just go here and you\'ll be more pleased This place is quite good compared to many other Chinese places that I\'ve been to The service is always quick The dumplings and soup are the best I\'ve ever had I\'ve tried not to go here too often but the food is so good!
