Been coming here for the past four months just for their soup and dumplings It\'s cheap and when you craved dumplings and don\'t want to make it--come here Should warned that their dumplings can get very oily Asked for extra napkins to squeeze the oil out I\'ve tried their soup with soft tofu sliced wood fungus mushrooms and scallions on top for $2 The soup is a hit or missed sometime it\'s so salty and starchy I just eat the tofu and dumped the rest The dumplings and cold noodles are yummy Buns are so-so (outside/bottom is a bit chewy at times) but fine when I\'m feeling like having that sort of thing and I\'m just personally not a fan of hot and sour type soups All in all this is a great place to get a quick bite that isn\'t fast food and definitely one of the better restaurants I\'ve visited in Blacksburg Fried dumplings are recommended Cold noodles do not have meat but they also taste good I drove 4 hours from Richmond to Virginia Tech to take my daughter to try out for the dance team I wouldn\'t have thought a town like Blacksburg would have anything interesting to eat When I found this place from Yelp I had to stop by to see what was all the hype about the dumplings I can honestly say that is was very good! I wish it was a little bit more crunchy but overall it was quite delicious with the sweet soy sauce I will definitely stop by again and try the other dishes on the menu After finding out about this place less than a week ago I\'ve been here three times This should give you an indication of how amazing their dumplings areSeriously get the dumplings It\'s an order of six but they give you one extra I haven\'t had the noodles yet (because how can I walk in and not get dumplings?) and the pork bun was decent but I wouldn\'t recommend it (Especially in light of the dumplings)The soup though The soup was absolutely fantastic (This is my first review on yelp because I just had to write one for this I may have a problem But luckily at these prices I don\'t mind :3) Went back to Blacksburg to relive my college years this past weekend On the drive down my friend mentioned that Marco & Luca of Charlottesville opened up right here in Hokie territory! We had planned to eat lunch there for Sunday and I could not wait all weekend I ordered the hot & sour soup the sweet spicy noodles and dumplingsMy whole order only cost ~ $8! My friends were\'t big fans but I LOVED the soup! It was a combination of egg drop hot & sour miso and seaweed It was piping hot and perfect after a day of drinking The noodles were sweet and tangy The apples really brought out the sweetness of the sauce I liked it so much that I got another order to go! And nowthe dumplings! The dumplings were a great deal $3 for 6 (they give you an extra one so 7) I\'m sad that they didn\'t open up when I was a student there! I got 2 orders of these for my brother in Northern VAOverall awesome food for an affordable price That\'s a winner in my book I\'m definitely coming back the next time I visit Blacksburg I could always go to Charlottesville but I don\'t think they really like us Hokies over there ;) The Dumplings are very good and inexpensive The staff are friendly It\'s nice to get one of these here in Blacksburg Give it a try It was amazing!I had the pork bun and the sesame noodlesThe sauce in the noodles was divine and tasted very goodThe hubby and the kids had the small fried wontonspork and a vegetable bunThe cashier at Oasis recommended this place and we will be back Just as good as the original in good old Charlottesville! Those crispy dumplings with that amazing sauce AND you can pay by credit card? A+ for me! I can\'t remember what was in the dumpling but he microwaved it Tough as shoe leather Never again The cold noodle were a required taste I first had these dumplings when I went to Charlottesville on my way back to Blacksburg I would say these really do live up to how good people say they are For the price I think it\'s a good deal how much they give you However I did not like the cold noodles I ordered they were tasteless and there was not enough sauce If you are looking for a place for quick lunch or dinner this is it! Let me just say the dumplings were amazing The soy sauce that they served them with was a nice sweet and savory It was a good thing that we ordered 2 servings! The two noodle dishes we got were tasty but couldn\'t hold a candle to the dumplings I would go back just for the dumplings Although slightly more expensive than it\'s Charlottesville counterparts (I think it\'s due to Blacksburg tax laws) it\'s just as simple and delicious A filling satisfying lunch of warm dumplings with a sweet (not so spicy) sauce and cold noodles makes it my favorite goto spot in Blacksburg This place has great food and a truly amazing story:Dumplings for Virginia ("Der Spiegel" 02/2007)There are stories which are true and there are stories which are beautiful This one here is almost too beautiful to be true but it isDragana was born in 1967 in Doboj a city in the North of Bosnia Her Dad was a catholic her Mom greek-orthodox She went to school in Banja Luka and went on to study agriculture then education and psychology at Sarajevo University When the civil war started and Yugoslavia started to fall apart she thought "this cannot be true I cannot live like this"; and left via Hungary and Austria to Augsburg Germany where one of her aunts was living After two months Dragana was recognized as a refugee of war With her aunt\'s help she found a job in a Chinese restaurant on Theaterstrasse "The usual: washing dishes in the kitchen I was glad that I was able to work and that I could send my parents a little bit of money"Sun Da from Beijing China was working in the same kitchen A chef by profession he legally entered Germany late in the year 1990 "I had never seen a Chinese man before It was love at first sight" But Sun Da was "a little shy" He accompanied Dragana to the tram stop every night after work and one day she just took him in her arms and kissed him They married in 1994 and one and a half years later their first son Marco was born"We would have loved to stay in Germany" Dragana who learned German during her time in Augsburg remembers "We tried everything we could but it was impossible" She completed an apprenticeship as a nurse with Malteser Hilfsdienst but was not able to get a work permit afterwards Thus she went to work as a maid at a hotel and had a cleaning job on the side When after the Dayton agreement Yugoslavian refugees were supposed to be "repatriated" Dragana and her husband filed - with the help of Caritas - for immigration in the US "We received approval at the end of January 1999 and left Germany mid March" From Augsburg via Frankfurt and New York to Charlottesville VA where distant relatives of Sun Da were livingFour weeks after their arrival Dragana was already working at the restaurant of the Omni Hotel She cleared dishes from the tables A year later she had become an Assitant Manager "I was proud of this achievement They gave me a chance" Her husband renovated apartments during the day and cooked at the Omni at night In May 2001 their second son Luca was bornSun Da had always wanted to be self-employed One day they came across a tiny store on Second Street A door and a window with 60 square feet attached They celebrated the "Grand Opening" in December 2001 Dragana and her husband were standing on the inside and on the outside people were lining up to buy dumplings fresh from the pan for $3 per serving "Something like this hadn\'t existed in Charlottesville before it worked out great"Dragana and Sun Da were working back to back He did the cooking she was selling dumplings at the window "It was tough We neither had air con in the summer nor heating in the winter" After two years they moved into a proper store with a kitchen air conditioning tables and chairs on Main Street The menu stayed the same however: two types of dumplings two types of cold noodles one soup In March of 2004 their third son Nicola was born"The city was very good to us Everyone helped us And we felt at home from the very first day on" The International Rescue Committee a private organization which helps refugees took care of the rent for their apartment for the first three months "Medicare" provided health insurance for the first eight months Local volunteers donated furniture clothes and toys for the kids - "everything we needed in the beginning but couldn\'t afford" And older lady Camille Price helped the young family with administrative paperworkToday Dragana Sun Da and their three sons live in their own house that they bought for $300000 The bank gave them good conditions for the financing "In Germany we wouldn\'t even have been able to get a loan to buy a car" Marco and Luca go to a school for gifted kids In the summer Dragana and Sun Da want to refurbish their small restaurant and re-open it as an "Organic Juice Bar" They have been living in Virginia for eight years now but haven\'t seen a whole lot of their new home country "We went to Virginia Beach twice for a two day beach vacation" Nevertheless they appear to be happy They became American citizens a year ago Dragana from Doboj her husband Sun Da from Beijing and their son Marco from Augsburg The two American born sons were citizens right away hey want to extend the restaurant and travel to Beijing in the fall to visit Sun Da\'s relatives And who knows maybe there will be the possibility for a joint business venture with a Chinese partner in China "That\'s our Plan B" says Dragana and puts on a Chinese smile I\'ve been 3 times in the last two weeks I\'ve only had the dumplings they are so good I haven\'t felt the urge to try anything else Really wonderful food I\'m so glad they decided to come to our area The dumplings are good and the sauce they come with is incredible I\'ve also had the cold noodles and think they are a good choice as well I\'m not a fan of the buns though A little thick/soggy/not quite enough filling Really they just don\'t compare to the dumplings which are only about $3 a serving Get two orders and something else to make a meal of it They raised their prices on everything with the explanation that the cost of doing business in Blacksburg is more than Charlottesville ??? $250 foe a steamed bun you can by a dozen for that amount at an Asian is absurd To top it off I saw the cook microwave the frozen bun in the back It stuck to the paper plate and was chewy The dumplings are good but not exceptional People say this place is cheap but $350 for 7 small dumplings is high in my estimation The secret sauce is good but it is just Horsain and soy sauce mixed together The soup here is incredible At $2 a bowl I find myself stopping in and getting it all the time As others have said it seems to be a mix of hot and sour and egg drop with a few other tasty things thrown in I haven\'t tried the dumplings since I don\'t eat pork but the veggie bun was not so great and only had a few small shreds of cabbage in it The noodle dishes are also forgettable but that soup the dumplings are delicious! fried to perfection and the sauce is amazing one order is not enoughjust sayin\' :) YES YES YES!!I can not drive past this place It is so good! All of the Tibetan dishes are traditionally flavored well made and worthy of an experience I would highly recommend that you stop by and order a bowl of Thenduk (its a meal) and a side of Momo\'s Not all food is ethnically Tibetan but their curry is delicious! Go ahead grab that home-made Lassi from the fridge Happy Eating! In Blacksburg when I was a freshman one day I noticed a shop called Himalayan curry cafe and went in because I never had Himalayan style curry before and wanted to give it a try Now being a senior I still go to this place because it is pretty good! A lot of my friends and I absolutely love their sweet and spicy pork curry The taste of it is pretty good and when it covers the rice its amazing Going to Himalayan curry they also have this unique hot sauce and a sweet soy sauce Adding these two sauces to your curry (or anything really at this shop) makes the dish that much more amazing for me Out of all their menu options my top 5 dishes here are the sweet and spicy pork curry chicken biryani vegetable curry fried rice and their samosa\'s Beside getting their pork curry sometimes I like to get their biryani which is a flavorful rice dish A nice addition is also their samosas which come with a green sauceOverall Himalayan curry cafe has really good food and a wide selection so there is something for everyone A staple when I visit Blacksburg The curry is a unique taste and is a large portion for the price that you pay It is served over rice and you get it when you orderThey also have a house made hot sauce that pairs nicely with the chicken that you have to ask for when you pay I usually ask for less sauce since the sauce is pretty runny This way the rice isn\'t soaked in the same sauce as the chicken is Chicken for the curry chicken is white meat!It\'s not the best curry ive ever had by any means but for the area it is a good value and it is a comforting meal One of the only Nepalese restaurant in Blacksburg the food was mediocre but it is filling for the price A lot of Asians come here just to have the famous chicken biriyani The employees are very kind and deserves a tip The music around the cafe is wholesome and gives a chill vibe I would recommended this restaurant for people who want good asian food! My nepali boyfriend and I went here for dinner and went back for lunch We ordered spicy chicken curry and chung king chili Overall the place is really nice and my boyfriend said that the decoration is pretty authentic The food is good and the curry is not so strong (both taste and smell) We also ordered chili chicken and he said that you could find the same taste in Nepal The momos however was ordinary--nothing special This is a great place Very nice people at the counter They weren\'t super-busy but had a fairly steady stream of customers The Samosas are gargantuan and they taste great without the sauce Their green sauce put it at the next levelThe Biryani was very flavorful and the perfect amount of spicy Our lips and gums were tingling Do watch our for the bones though -they leave them in for this recipe The chicken was awesomely tender thoughToday we were making a run to several places for dinner but that curry looked extremely tempting too If we every make it back through Blacksburg this will be a required stop The Chicken curry and Beef curry is amazing every time as well as the lentil soup! A good place to go for a home cooked meal feel Food was very bland Chicken curry had no taste They dump so much of rice and curry and lost my appetite the minute I saw that Not many choice on the menu One of my co-workers frequently recommends this place Tonight I finally made it over thereThe dumplings were goodThe spicy chicken curry was goodThe butter chicken was goodService was friendlyThe tables were cleanThe prices were fantasticNo complaints uhhhhhhhhhh please see attached my photo of the "butter chicken" i ordered what is this? what did they serve me? it was  okay my mom had some and was like "why does it taste like nothing?" my sister got the chicken curry and that had slightly more flavor overall i am just confused i\'m sorry this was just disappointing I could be really skeptical when it comes to an exotic cuisine When I had it at first it was alright and then it really grew on me and now I come here too often They give you a lot of food for the priceFOOD: (5/5)*Authenticity: the food here is not strictly from a certain country but a fusion of Tibetan Chinese and Indian food Trust me it\'s a good combination*Menu:- Curry: they have different types of curry My favorite is the Spicy Chicken curry They give you small sample cups if you want to try The curry goes really with their signature Himalayan sauce (the orange sauce) The cilantro topping adds good freshness to the rich curry sauce They do half and half for the curry also (for example: half chicken half vegetable curry)- Fried rice: the fried rice is dry (which is a good thing for fried rice) and flavorful I love it - Samosas: I love their homemade samosas The samosa comes with the green sauce I like it better with the Himalayan sauce- Momos (steamed dumplings): It\'s similar to Chinese dumplings but with some Tibetan twist The momos come with the chili paste sauce It\'s even better if you ask them to add some soy sauce to the chili paste- Chili and Chung King: Chinese style stir fried meat (chicken or pork) with some peppers It\'s not as flavorful as it looks I\'m not a fan but people seem to like it- Lassi: don\'t miss the homemade yogurt Grab one from the fridge when it\'s available!SERVICE: (5/5)It\'s a local and family-owned business Everyone is really friendly here ATMOSPHERE: (4/5)I\'m not a fan of their interior design but I can let it go because the food is really good here This is honest food and it\'s a good value And if I\'m honest I\'m a little disappointed with the curries which were the feature items judging by their prominence on the menu The chicken curry was fine and ready-on-order The vegetable curry however needed time to prepare and was a bit undercooked when it came out Cauliflower can be undercooked but potatoes no There are a few other menu items you could try like the soups and the dumplings I actually like this place I only had a limited try of their menu to date but what I tasted was great (momos lentil soup and somosas) Staff is very friendly Just a fun place to eat inexpensively (from plastic plates etc)  but so be it Hidden gem!I always felt like Himalayan was a lowkey place to eat at and I hope this review gives them the more exposure! Himalayan probably offers the best curry in town no doubt For the low prices and the portions that they give you it\'s definitely a bargain and you\'ll leave with full stomachs for sure I personally like the beef or chicken curry What\'s also unique is that they have bingsu (although I\'ve never tried it I hear it\'s good)Himalayan is a great place to go to even if you don\'t have a craving for curry It\'s a solid choice for anyone who\'s hungry and doesn\'t want to spend a lot of money All I can say is I\'m sorry Blacksburg if this is a representation of a well reviewed restaurant hostess encouraged me to order curry over momos because "curry is quick" So I did and man the beef in it was so low quality and it was basically $8 for white rice and beef stew with half of it cartilage I had a samosa too and it was ok but had obviously been cooked a while ago and just kept warm as the outside was super limp Food like this makes me sad inside Everything about this place Blacksburg needs places like this Just reiterating my undying love for himalayan I now always get half lentil soup half veggie The ingredients are all listed which as someone who has food allergies and is vegetarian is amazing The Lentil soup has an excellent flavor You can get half meat half veggie if you so desire! Don\'t forget the sauce Everything is made with love here Hwy 55 is next door and I will never eat there If anyone chooses that business over this one they are making a huge mistake They\'re expanding their menu and incorporating Bingsoo -- I love it The owner is one of the most kind people you will ever meet in your entire life His story is on google Eating here supports his family and journey What a sweet little find near Virginia Tech I have no clue why anyone would say this food lacks flavor I got the Pork sweet and spicy curry and it was great Not a lot of sweet but a nice little kick at the end For the price you can\'t beat this place I\'ll definitely be back! This is one of those places I frequent when I\'m craving comfort food without the hassles of cooking and cleaning up I\'m really glad they added the chicken fried rice and the chilli chicken to their menu They\'re deliciously spicy with ample amounts of heat yet entirely flavorful I\'m a huge fan of their lentil soup as well The food is usually made to order and so sometimes there may be instances of over cooked meat or excess salt but the owner is really nice and always replaces the food if I tell him the problem with it Discovered this gem shortly after moving here Everything I have tried is delicious: Curry Biryani Lentils Menu is small which makes ordering easy they top meal with fresh cilatro (or not depending on preference) and most of the menu selections are plated to order allowing for short wait times First time in Blacksburg and I was hungry Was recommended to come here by a friend and I am super glad I did I had the chicken curry served with lots of cilantro and the dumplings The curry wasn\'t thick like Japanese curry and it was served with Jasmine rice? idk forgive my ignorance but it was long grain rice I liked the consistency of the curry and the generous portion given The staff was very nice and the food quality made me feel like I was eating a home-cooked meal The sauces on the tables were really good too There is a mild soy-sauce one and a spicy/sweet sauce that brings out a lot of flavor They also seem to serve Bingsoo here but I did not try it This is great Curry is fine If you don\'t like one kind of meat there is variety I liked the pork But definitely try the momos they are great! Excellent food Excellent service What more needs to be said??As a student at Virginia Tech I have made Himalayan curry a part of my regular diet and it never gets old The pork sweet spicy curry is my personal favorite If you have a bad idea about curry I implore you to break out of your comfort zone You won\'t regret it! Definitely a place to hit up in Blacksburg if you are tired of the same old same old down town or looking for some good reasonably priced eastern foodThe staff has always been very pleasant and the store always clean! The portions were giant We both got the beef curry plates and the flavor was really good! However the beef was pretty tough And there was so much of it I didn\'t really even want to finish it There\'s a lot of space in the restaurant so we hung out for near an hour The people working there were very friendly! I love the curry here The pork curry is my personal favorite and the hot sauce they have on the tables is delicious The portions are very generous and the prices are extremely reasonable; I have a difficult time finishing a $7 plate of their curry The only con I have for this place is the parking can occasionally be awful during dinner time due to the students I want to like this place because it\'s a Nepali restaurant in Blacksburg but the food is just so mediocre Nothing I have ordered here the 3 times I\'ve come can disabuse me of its meh-ness At this price point I\'d rather get dumplings from Marco and Luca or fast food The food here was delicious I would recommend the chicken curry chicken momo\'s and the lentil soup Getting cilantro on any of these 3 dishes is a must I also tried the beef curry and the beef momo\'s the beef wasn\'t that great compared to the chicken I really liked the fact that the rice and curry was available instantly The momo\'s took about 10min to get the wait was worth it I would recommend all sauces as well they were quite tasty and delicious Nice and spicy very delicious This curry reinvigorates my life and soul It lights a passion in my stomach and my heart I shed a tear for every day that I do not indulge in this sacred feast I would definitely recommend this deliciousness to anyone who has never laid curry on their delicate tongues because this is something that will fill that void in your life I have been graced to have eaten the chicken and pork curries both fantasticall in all:A LOT OF GOOD FOOD FOR NOT A LOT OF MONEY This has become one of our favorite go-to restaurants in Blacksburg Food is priced well and tastes GREAT! Butter chicken was really good and the samosas and green chutney excellent The new Thenthuk soup is to die for! If you like ramen or Asian noodle soups I highly recommend! They keep adding great stuff to the menu keep it up! Very solid and cheap food! I ordered the Sweet and Spicy Pork Curry and it was quite tasty The portion size was very good and filling especially for the price If you are someone who has a smaller appetitite you will have plenty left over too (luckily they give it to you in a to-go box) My brother ordered the Chicken Curry and it was only okay (which is why I am giving this place 4 stars rather than 5) I feel like this place can definitely be hit or miss depending on what you order so if you don\'t like a certain item I wouldn\'t write off the restaurant right away We also ordered the Classic PatBingsoo for dessert and that was great as well I have never had BingSoo before but I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it If you aren\'t aware BingSoo is a dessert with sweet red beans a sweet malt-like powder mochi and bran flakes strewn throughout a big bowl of shaved ice We split a bowl ($5) and it was plenty for the both of us Would recommend if you are in the market for inexpensive ethnic food! Love this place!!!! Big portion for its cheap price! The curry doesn\'t smell too! The workers are really friendly and full of smiles whenever I visit! it\'s just across Prices Fork Definitely had a college-y vibe to it I felt like I was grabbing a quick meal between a last-minute cram sesh and rushing to my afternoon physics exam even though I\'ve been out of school for 2 years If you like this type of food this place is good It\'s basic and delicious And you can\'t get this food anywhere else around here And did I mention it\'s really good My favorite is the pork curry Simosas It\'s worth a try My friends and I stopped by on our first night in town and the Himalayan Curry Cafe is a true revelation and gem It is modest in many ways - small storefront simple menu inexpensive prices and a single proprietorBut once we tasted the curries we were hooked for sure We each tried a different selection (except the veggie) which was easy since there are only four different kinds to choose from The pork was the best in my opinion but the chicken and beef were very tasty as well They are all saucy and served with basmati rice on the side and are made even better with hoisin or garlic hot sauce that is on the table Even the lentil soup was amazingly delicious and the next time I stop by I\'ll have to try the cold Kheer (a sweet chilled veggie mix) The best part is that everything was a straight $550 with the lentil soup and Kheer being $300Did I mention this place was super cheap? Pork curry is the way to go! I\'ve tried everything on the menu at Himalayan Curry Cafe My advice is to go for the pork sweet spicy curry try the lentil soup at least once and don\'t forget the kheer Tibetan curry is less heavy than Indian curry (not as creamy) and spiced a bit differently The chicken and beef curries here are rather bland and the veggie curry is even more bland (and possibly made with just frozen vegetables) The lentil soup is great but there is a sharp herbal flavor in the beginning that I still can\'t figure out (perhaps it\'s the black mustard seeds) and may not be to everyone\'s taste The kheer is always good although some batches have more carrots than others (I prefer more cardamom)Something I learned by accident is that the curries taste better at night because (presumably) they\'ve been simmering all day It\'s a working hypothesis anyway The staff are super nice They keep extra-spicy sauce behind the counter if that\'s your thing I find the pork curry to have a perfect amount of \'kick\' It\'s cheap nutritious and generously-portioned Where else can you get a huge heap of fancy basmati rice as a part of a $5 meal? The food here is pretty good! They serve really large quantities and the prices are really low! You do get the food in foam plates and take out boxes but you pay for what you getThe owners are always here and they\'re really friendly! I love this family owned local restaurant Very reasonably priced and the food is delicious!!I would come here just for the hot sauce it\'s that good Disclaimer: I am of south-Asian descent so I am rather acclimated to eating curry dishes I might have higher standards than most of the customers at this place hence why I found it bland This place is perhaps good for a person who is attempting to dip their toes into the world of curry dishes I ordered the pork curry dish to-go and was disappointed For $612 after tax I received only 6-7 small pieces of pork and a whole box-full of rice with the sauce The sauce was a bit bland flavor-wise Another huge suggestion I have for the establishment is to switch their take-out styrofoam boxes to plastic ones similar to Chinese take-out containers The sauce leaked a little bit out of the box and into the plastic bag which resulted in an unwanted mess 1 star off for the disappointing amount of meat and another for the inadequate take-out containerNot sure if I\'ll be returning again maybe to try other dishes because it is pretty affordable for a filling meal in Blacksburg Tried it for the first time today with the girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised!I got the Pork Sweet Spicy Curry and the Kheer while she got the Vegetable Curry and the Lentil Soup The Staff was EXTREMELY friendly and kind enough to answer questions regarding the food (ie The vegetable curry kheer and lentil soup are indeed vegetarian friendly)For $550 a pop they offer a generous helping of rice to curry ratio! Like the other reviews have stated this Tibetan curry is not as strong (aroma/spice wise) as a traditional Indian or Japanese curry but still great none the less My girlfriend really liked the soup which had a very distinct taste of some seasoning (black mustard seeds?) that reminded me of tea The Kheer was unexpectedly amazing! It is an Indian rice pudding that is just absolutely delicious For only 3 dollars you HAVE to give it a try at least once Other notes to mention: The extra spicy sauce seems to be sriracha based so we all know sriracha goes with everything literally everything So you can\'t go wrong here4/5 (for now at least due to the slightly dry pork/lack of pieces) but definitely will be back again (possibly at an earlier time of the day) A decent student type of place The food was okay but not great The meat was okay but not great Very much geared toward the students in the area Nicly priced meal clean tables and bathroom fast service This restaurant is very casual and simple The sweet pork had more flavor than the chicken and the Kheer was very tasty A perfect place to eat out on a budget Oh the spicy pork currybest thing to eat ever Rainy day? The menu is simple the food is delicious and reasonably priced and the owners are extremely nice I eat here all the time- it\'s my favorite restaurant in Blacksburg Eating here is as warm and inviting as eating a home-cooked meal This place is phenomenal for the price or otherwise Each of the curries is tailored to the meat (or lack thereof) The sweet and spicy pork is probably my favorite a medium-brown curry with loads of flavor neither too sweet nor especially spicy (the spice can easily be increased) The chicken is similar but not spicy The beef is a darker curry sometimes reminiscent of an especially good gravy The veggie is probably the most distinctive of the four although it reminds me of a basic (but excellent) Indian-style yellow curry The kheer is also excellent and very refreshing for something sweet Couple of hints: each of the tables has an orange-pink sauce He\'s got a spicy version of this behind the counter if you ask which seems to be designed to go with the pork It\'s awesome and I get it every time Also the portions are more than adequate (and totally fair for the price) but for those who might want more meat he will gladly give you more for under $2 The service is informal (cafeteria-style) but the tables and floors are clean and look nice This is a great place to take a date so long as your date puts food above "ambience" (all the best dates will)This rapidly became my absolute favorite restaurant in Blacksburg and given the price and quality I eat here several times a weekHighly recommended Great food and the amount is good for the price friendly nice people Will go back! found that the vinegarette sauce was from Italy!)Service was great and friendly at the beginning then when tables were getting full it was not consistent I ordered only a few starters without main entree and wish they brought them somewhat slowly When I was still working on salad and bread soup crab cake and portabello came all together Unfortunately I had most of those food when they got coldChocolate Bombe seems the most popular dessert It tasted as good as it looks Overall this place must be one of the high quality restaurants in town It is costly but for celebrating special occasion it would be wonderful spot This visit was okthe place is expensive for what it offers The waiter was nice but seemed to not really care that we were there or nothe did not invest in the dinner at all and for 16000 dinner tab he could have made us feel a little more special My daughter and I had dinner here while visited my Blacksburg In my opinion it\'s the best dining experience to be had in the town The bartender made my daughter a virgin pina colada that was exquisite You could see the artistry in the glass and taste it in the cup Their wine menu is great so I had a nice Pinot and took the rest of the bottle (corked) with me when I left We shared a lentil soup Caesar salad charcuterie Board and some risotto for dinner It was such a tasty bit truly pleasant dining experience Cvs And one I will remember I hope for a long time Started off the meal by ordering a cheese slate (platter) with raspberry reduction and onion reduction We selected the smoked Gouda Brie and el trigal manchego Each one had a very different type of taste but was very tasty Gouda and Brie were on the softer ends in terms of softness but the el trigal manchego was firm They tasted very well with the crackers available The complimentary bread that they offer tastes amazing I absolutely love their bread Slight buttery with a bit of crunch Could you ask for anymore?For my entree I selected the tuna fish It was rich with flavor and juice plus the seasoning on it was pretty good I think the ratio of fish to rice was perfect; however if you are trying to get full from your meal I would not recommend this restaurant Finally we waited a long time to receive our checks The waiter/waitress did not come to our table that often and the situation was a bit frustrating I have been here about five times and it is still my favorite restaurant in Blacksburg! It is on the expensive side so not a restaurant I go to frequently but I love going to it on special occasionsThe menu changes all the time and all of the ingredients are fresh and cooked to perfection The waiters/waitresses have always been very attentive and I have yet to have a bad food or service experience here! Try the Charcuterie board! Who knew that a college town could have such a nice up-scale restaurant like the Black Hen?Let\'s jump right into it The complimentary bread is REALLY good Don\'t be afraid My friends and I ordered the cheese slate with 3 different cheeses The one that I would recommend trying it the brie! The brie came with a nice raspberry reduction which complemented the bread and brie very well For the entree I balled out and got the filet mignon or what I would like to call the filet migYUMMY One bite into the juicy piece of steak and I knew it was well worth it They cooked it to a perfect medium-rare! The steak was also accompanied by very tasty veggies and potatoes They also have a complimentary chocolates at the end (SO GOOD)!I want to add that it DOES take awhile to receive your food so beware The service was a little slow which was noticeable when it took awhile to return our credit cards after we paid If you come here plan on sticking around for about an hour and a half LOLOverall this is a really expensive place with pretty good food It has a really romantic vibe to it if you wanna take a date I probably won\'t be coming back but it was good experience nevertheless Wow! This place is delicious! This is a higher end gem in the downtown Blacksburg area and definitely a keeper The filet mignon topped with baked Brie is beautiful (plated and in the mouth) and the chocolate bomb with raspberry is something magical I would expect from a high end restaurant in DC This one is worth the stop! I was informed as I was ordering that they had a new chef and it was his first week so I was a bit hesitant I started with the Blue Crab potato soup that was extremely good I then went with the Crispy egg which I was a bit hesitant ordering and paying $8 for one egg but OMG it was AWESOME and I could have eaten a dozen of them and gladly paid that price I decided to put my trust in and let the chef pick my entree since they all sounded amazing and the lamb chops that were brought out were great! This is NOT an inclusive spaceBrief rundown of a night gone awry My fianc was in town and some of my colleagues and I from the Vet School decided to get cocktails Usually we hit 622 and have a great time but decided let\'s try another recommendation Black Hen/Bar Blue It began at 8:30pm Sat Feb 3rd 2018From the moment we entered something was off Maybe it started with the group of guys at the bar who did not let a single second pass from the moment we walked inside to gawk at my fianc and touch her arm and tell her how beautiful she was in a *surprised* tone of voice They were obviously regulars or friends of staff by the way they were being catered to "Good" I thought at least this place is attentive even to jerks who touch random women and make them feel uncomfortable Mind you all these men were middle aged white guys and we are people of color Reeks of "coveting the exotic" Did I begin to suspect something was up? It was bubbling on the inside yes but I wanted to believe this wasn\'t that and maintain an open mind After all this place was recommended and we didn\'t want to judge an establishment by the actions of a few of its drunk patrons  Now bar blue is tiny Like 4 or 5 tables total tiny and everybody is within a few feet of the bar Places like these its touch or go whether you order at the bar or get table service A brief scan of the room shows that it\'s not very busy and there\'s people with glasses of water cocktails and menus on their table A minute more of observation and we see waiters and waitresses checking in on the guests at the tables So we do what good patrons do We sit at one of the two open tables in the middle of the room and await our server Simple right?Here\'s an important tidbit Our table is in the path of foot traffic for all the servers Clearly visible to everybody in the bar Again servers have to pass us in order to get anywhere From my seat I have straight line of sight and solid eye contact for every staff member going in and out of the bar Am I hammering the point in enough? You couldn\'t miss us is what I\'m saying**Ten minutes pass** with literally not a single server or host saying hello nobody other than those jerks at the bar acknowledging us nobody bringing us menus or offering us water Just walking right past us The entire time I\'m making pleasant eye contact with the bartender who is behind the bar not more than four feet away from me in a failing attempt to get a server without being a tool Oh yeah! We are also literally a foot away from another table on our right that needed to be cleared for additional guests That table gets cleared and a couple sits down Within a MINUTE a server goes to their table gets them menus talks to them about the drinks and deserts available offers them water and takes an order And walks right on about her merry way Now something is def feeling fishy We are literally the only people in the bar that aren\'t white And we are literally the only people being ignored My fianc is beginning to get that all-too-familiar feeling of disbelief/hurt/anger so I decide to make it social experiment and see how long it will take to get service at bar blue as a brown guy and a black woman There\'s literally only five tables They can\'t have missed us We\'re right in everybody\'s face At the fifteen-minute mark one of my friends joined us and I\'m reminded to text the remainder of our group to avoid this place at all costs and go grab us a table at 622 because this is shaping up to be a huge fail As the only 3 nonwhite people in here we decide we\'re just going to sit here quietly and watch everybody else get served while we are being denied water courtesy and acknowledgement of our existence completely Oh and menus and drinks too Ten more minutes and we\'ve crossed our threshold for the BS Servers are actively avoiding eye contact now as they pass our table to check in on the other tables At exactly 8:55 we put our coats back on and leave Nobody looks at us as we leave actually having to manipulate our bodies to get around one server who passed us over a dozen times to serve the table immediately on our right in order to grab our coats on the way out This wasn\'t a dress code thing we were all dressed professionally This wasn\'t a behavior thing we sat there sober and polite This wasn\'t anything except a deliberate attempt to not provide service to us Plain and simple As a person of color you are invisible at bar blue/black hen And I will be telling this story across all platforms and telling all my colleagues at the Med and Vet schools to avoid this place out of principle at all costs PS Management seriously? It\'s 2018 We were already hesitant to move down here in as tense a social climate that we are in The stereotypes of this area exist How does it feel to know you contribute to that stereotype? Will definitely be back The new Chef is a gem he makes the best crab cakes it\'s been consistently good every visit The Black Hen is a great place to bring family and friends when they are in town The food is upscale fresh and creative The cheese board and the truffle-infused cheese was a highlight as was the mahi mahi with watermelon salsa Yes it is costly Be prepared to splurge Just be sure to call ahead for a reservation So glad such a cute and trendy spot is here in Blacksburg! First visit to Black Hen Friendly attentive waiter They were out of the duck breast and out of the rainbow trout Ordered roast pork loin Was very dry Served on very mushy bed of spinach beets and risotto We had an excellent lunch here! The cocktails were superb and even better still the food was very very good from a wonderfully lemony chicken salad sandwich with a whole lot of depth to a superb BLT and E and whoa- the special: a filet burger with saracha kimchi and a sweet bacon was out of this world The chef nailed the combinations of flavors in these dishes without going overboard And the desserts are a WOW We had to try two because the food so far had been so good! The apple tartin and the lemon merengue were both really really superb!! The foods are locally sourced (Blacksburg Bagels makes some of the best croissants in town and Black Hen is proud to use them for a choice in breads) Locally sourced chicken you get the drift And all this for quite an excellent value- the sandwiches were large and came with a choice of fries (perfectly done) or salad (very nicely put together) or a soup (another dish of beautifully blended flavors) for an incredibly well-valued priceAdd to this a beautiful dining setting friendly professional and well-informed staff and yes we were very happy customers! So Blacksburg has a great place for dinner now also a great place for lunch We were lucky to walk in i\'ll bet they\'ll be swamped soon as the area figures out they\'re open for lunch now I\'ve had this place described to me as \'upscale\' and \'fancy\' and \'can\'t really justify going there unless have something to celebrate\' There is some truth to it It is certainly expensive relative to a typical Blacksburg restaurant out there The average entree on the dinner menu is $29 But if you do end up there that figure doesn\'t get close to explaining the amount of effort put in by staff members you interact with and the quality and care with which the food is prepped and served I had the duck breast with roasted potatoes fried egg veggies with mango sauce The sauce was towards the sweeter end of the scale (pairing it with a dry sauvignon blanc worked) The meat was tender and medium-well done the potatoes only mildly crisp pretty perfect mealI tried their creme brulee as well quite alright They bring complementary chocolates with the checkI\'ll definitely end up here again whenever I get the chance As usual I sat at the barThe ambiance was nice and not too dark It was pretty crowded when I came in around 745 on a Tuesday and just about empty when I left around 9 Service from the bartender was very good She was attentive and friendly and made some good strong cocktails She was accommodating when I asked that a drink off of their cocktail menu be altered with a different spirit but did end up shorting the pour which was very apparent in a martini glass Even so she was a very good server and I appreciated the skillfully-made booze!Crispy and herbed focaccia with a bit of olive oil and balsamic was a wonderful way to whet my appetite but I do wish it came out more than 2 minutes before my dinner That said it was perfect for dipping in the sauce that accompanied my entreeWhich brings me to the main course - flank steak medium rare with extra mixed veg instead of potatoes It was served with a creamy sauce with a touch of sweetness and mustard The dish overall was wonderful Great flavors from the steak veggies (zucchini squash onions sun-dried tomatoes) and sauce The steak was overcooked (medium almost med-well) and a little bit on the tough side but that\'s really my only complaint as the dish was bursting with flavorOverall great service and good food For the price I wish the steak was done correctly and the first cocktail poured full but these are minor complaints for what is a great establishment in downtown Blacksburg 40/5 Amazing!!! Start with the Ruby my dear cocktail The French Hen cocktail is also delicious We were in town for the weekend and came here for Friday lunch Came back for Saturday dinner My fianc and I (both living in NYC for years) have been looking for a nice hand crafted cocktail place in the area and decided to try this place because of the glowing reviewsand I must say I was highly disappointed with the experience We walked into the establishment and sat down and not once were we welcomed with a hello nor offered water to drink or a menu However there was a couple next to us who came in 10 minutes later and their table was cleared they were seated ordered and we STILL weren\'t welcomed I\'ve lived in New York for years and have been at some highly rated restaurants and bars and have NEVER had an encounter like I did here The only conclusion I can make is because my fianc and I are both people of color which is very disappointing I truly hope the bar reads this review and reprimands their staff for discriminating especially for a place that looks sub par in comparison to what I\'m used to in New York We had a group event with 33 people at the Black Hen We started with a happy hour and half the people hung out at the patio and half in the restaurant I love the patio because it\'s comfortable and a great setting for social chats The staff is so responsive and was fine with running a quickly Dessert was chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream and a raspberry It was SO smooth and silky and good One guest doesn\'t like chocolate and the staff quickly brought her an alternate We won\'t be back anytime soon if ever I wanted to leave this review because both chef and menu have changed this past weekend Please note that we are from out of town and had not been to this restaurant before the change We found the food to be wonderful and the service great We sat at the bar because there were no tables available and we were probably lucky to get that Bartender Andrew was fantastic Very knowledgeable about wines and drink He made several suggestions that made our evening better My wife and I split the Caesar which was quite nice I had the filet Cooked perfectly My wife had the salmon on a bed of green lentils also very good You should definitely make a reservation as bar seating is a hit or miss thing The menu is not super long Entrees included lamb chops salmon filet mignon and pork chop I\'m not sure what the hype is all about I came here on a Wednesday around 7:30 pm and I was seated right away It\'s not so busy probably because it\'s summer break I ordered the watermelon wheat beer which was refreshing and the waiter brought a couple squares of bread I ordered the duck breast which was served medium rare with grilled squash and zucchini and quartered potatoes The duck was covered in some type of sauce that\'s a little too sweet for my taste I was expecting the duck skin was seared and crispy with nice juicy MR meat underneath it per their description and the Yelp reviews The duck came out MR alright but the skin is far from being seared Duck has some really fatty skin so when not cooked properly in the case of this dish well imagine eating MR meat wrapped in raw fatty skin I love eating well-cooked skin because of its fat content but only when it\'s crispy! Another thing worth noting is the ambiance of this place - it\'s definitely not as much of a "fine dining" as other reviews have described Sure maybe this place is the only restaurant in town that\'s considered upscale and maybe it gets more serious with their \'dress code\' when the university is open but every table but one (what seemed to be a table of gentlemen that got out of a meeting) wore t shirts and shorts Also the acoustic of the place is pretty awful You don\'t even have to try to evesdrop to hear everyone\'s conversation I noticed there was only two waiters working the front so the service was a bit slow On the good note they provide a free chocolate truffle when you pay the tab I have been here several times and every time was an excellent experience and food has been always on point & delicious In addition some of their in house cocktails are exceptional! promptly when we arrived The decor was a bit underwhelming considering the sophistication that has been proliferated about this place for the past few months It was a very simple bright space perhaps a bit poorly laid out for tables The wine glasses were lower quality pressed glassed rather than the nicer thin glass which was a disappointmentOur server who was probably a student was really slow throughout the entire meal It took about 5 minutes before he greeted us and as the meal progressed disappeared for most of it We got a bottle of wine for the table and the server was quite messy with the pours leaving several dribbles of wine on the table as well as the bottle Bread came out AFTER our appetizers which created a poor pace for the meal Perhaps most egregious was that he took away meal itself was pretty good though I got the North Carolina trout with lump crab meat and the cherry tomato sauce Everything was well cooked and seasoned and tasted fresh The veggies were a bit al dente but I like mine barely balanced so I\'m OK with that My appetizer was the shrimp cocktail and it was good if I had been able to finish it undisturbed The dessert menu left me wanting so I didn\'t get anything though someone else at the table got the chocolate bombe which looked fairly good We did not receive the complementary chocolates with our check that other tables got that night Wow the Black Hen has really hit its stride! The chef shows complete mastery of achieving tenderness and crunch in the same item seasonings strike a perfect balance and have great depth and ingredients are top notch The warm homemade bread was drizzled with olive oil displayed a tender crunch and a perhaps a touch of sourdough starter The blackened steelhead salmon (trout) had a solid layer of blackened spices that was not too hard and not too soft not too thick and not too thin bold but not overpowering the fish intriguing and not too peppery I requested it rare and a smidge in the center was indeed rare although if I were a chef of this skill level I would have gone even rarerMy only minor quibble was that my partner\'s crab cake was too mayonnaise-y for my taste but he loved it Oh he also had the ahi tuna appetizer which was beautifully crusted with sesame seedsThe desserts were amazing the best I\'ve had in a 150-mile radius One was a strawberry-rhubarb shortbread with vanilla ice cream layered between two buttery disks of shortbread replete with crystallized crunchiness topped with intense raspberry sorbet The other was a chocolate-banana pudding cake The roasted banana ice cream was intensely good and the chocolate cake was molten in the middle and again had that crystallized crunch on the outside We will daydream about them and will return to try other desserts We left thinking we were in a space-time warp and had somehow been transported to a big city for a meal My husband and I were walking in downtown Blacksburg and happened upon this gem Even in our shirts and t-shirts (grossly underdressed) they was maybe 2 bites worth of food for 8-10$ Wonderful food and service don\'t miss it if you are in Blacksburg We\'re visiting VTech and we\'re thrilled to find this gem Ingredients were really fresh dishes were interesting and overall the food was delicious I had an asparagus starter that was delicious For a main course I had the filet mignon that was cooked to perfection The steamed lemon cake was a wonderful finish to the meal Everyone in our party was very happy with their selections The strawberry salad was a hit (even if dressing was a little heavy) and the strip steak was a rave The desserts were all fantastic we sampled the blood orange spent and the chocolate mousse My husband was so thrilled with the creme brle he didn\'t share They have a good cocktail menu and wine list to round out the meal The service was outstanding; attentive yet completely unrushed We were able to take our time and linger without any pressure to move on This restaurant is a must if you are in Blacksburg I can\'t remember when I stopped in but I just grabbed a seat in the bar area (these are first come first serve and don\'t require a reservation) Food is great for the most part; however at this price point I would expect to see more local food Some things are local within region but there is definitely opportunity to add more I also think this place would work great for half plates It\'s not the kind of food you want to take home and the full plates are a bit large for me Had a great experience at The Black Hen Quaint little restaurant  food was outstanding and dessert was amazing We were a large group so we tried all the appetizers I felt they were a little on the small side  My only other complaint is that they charged $1 for extra bread  It\'s not the money it\'s the fact that they charged for bread Im pretty sure our total bill was $600-700 4 stars for bread charging and small appetizers However I will return The Black Hen and Bar Blue is a rarity for a town like Blacksburg in terms of both food and service quality The menu is on the smaller side but certainly didn\'t feel like it as there were options that appealed to everyone in my party of three As a self proclaimed cheese addict I ordered the full ($21) cheese platter that contained a delightful variety of sharp nutty and mellow cheeses; certainly an excellent way to start the meal My entree (the delicious Pork Chop) continued to uphold the high bar set by the appetizer and was delightfully complemented by sides of redskin mashed potatoes and coleslaw Our server was personable attentive without being overbearing Overall the Black Hen is an excellent place for that special someone on your anniversary or just a celebratory treat (just be sure to make reservations for good seating)! I will be returning in the near future! Great bar Good food although I wish they would branch out a little Still only destination dining in Blacksburg Amazing food and really great creative cocktails! One of my favorite spots in Blacksburg We decided to give this place a try after hearing good things and it did not disappoint I got the pork loin and my wife got the salmon Everything was excellent from the food to the service I recommend making reservations as seating is a bit limited I had a hard time following the trend and giving this place any more stars than this and here is why:They are over priced on everything from drinks to dinner For the quality I can drive up the road and find better food/drinks for the price The food is good but nothing that special If they would knock the price down by just a small percentage I could have given them an extra star for thatThe drinksthe drinks are the reason my wife and I would frequent that place One of the only if not the only place in Blacksburg to get a real cocktail They had a good selection of drinks and the bartender that had been working would always come up with new and delicious drinks Not sure if he moved got fired or the restaurant went in a different direction but their drinks have suffered They only have 3-4 selections for their cocktails and the bartenders cannot even make a good Old Fashion The last one I had was horrible would have been better just to have whiskey on the rocks They need to change up and go back to be innovating with their drink selection I would have previously given them 4 stars on their drinks alone but sadly they are now mediocre at best and why they only garner 2 stars Perfect in every way! Food is amazing farm to table perfect portions and cooking exquisitely! Desserts and cocktails are also hand crafted and great! Be prepared to spend $$$ but completely worth it Great place glad somebody gets it that there are people in Blacksburg who really want a place like this instead of more pizza and beer NY strip steak was great with mushrooms on top lovely cheese plate for starter and fabulous desserts - lavender creme brulee and chocolate bombe Good service It did take a while for our entree to arrive after the appetizer but that was the only negative Prices are on the high side but we plan to see how the Blue Bar is maybe get an appetizer and a drink some nights and enjoy the relaxing atmosphere Highly recommend this place I am a food writer so I don\'t dish out praise easily My wife and I were so excited to finally try this place as the Yelp reviews were generally positive and it is one of the few "grown up" restaurants in Blacksburg We were hoping to have a nice romantic dinner but were sorely disappointed To start the waiter took our drink order and for some reason it took 10-15 minutes for my wife to get her cocktail It was strange because it was a Tuesday and the restaurant was less than half full This is itself wasn\'t so bad What followed afterwards wasFor appetizers she ordered the crabcakes and I ordered the cheese plate She said the crabcakes were just OK For my cheese plate the toast I was given to eat the cheese with looked NOTHING like the picture here on yelp They were small and thin--translucent even They literally broke under the weight of the cheese and I ran out of toast before even finishing half of the cheese I didn\'t even have a chance to ask for more toast because our entrees arrived before we were even halfway finished with our appetizers! The waiter was nice enough and apologized but things like this shouldn\'t be happening at a restaurant that claims to be fine dining It was like we were at Applebee\'s or Outback during rush hour and the waiter was trying to turn tables fasterAnyhow even this might be forgiven if the entrees were excellent They were not My wife ordered the pork chop and I ordered the filet mignon Both dishes were really salty my wife\'s to the point where she had to send it back She took 3 bites and had to chug a glass of water because it was so salty (the empty glass sat for 5 minutes--again a testament to the lacking service) She was so put off that she didn\'t even want a replacement dish Mine was salty but my palette is not as refined as my wife\'s so I could take it Overall I would say that the steak was just OK (by far not the best filet I\'ve had) but afterward my mouth felt like I had just ate a tub of movie popcorn due to the generous use of saltOverall the night was not the romantic outing we had planned it to be I was there eating my steak while my wife had nothing meaning I felt pressured to wolf it down Again we were so disappointed not only with the taste of the food (we had really high expectations) but also with the general experience I guess next time we need to go to Roanoke if we want a higher-class meal Very delicious food: had the duck Drinks were amazing as well We sat outside for a lovely atmosphere Service was somewhat lacking as it took us about 30 minutes just for our server to take our drink order! Delightful experience We arrived early for our reservation and had a quiet drink in the cozy bar waiting a short time for our table Great French country ambience Our server Corrie was attentive and personable; very good Four of us split the cheese slate and shrimp cocktail for starters - highly recommended I found the pork chop to be ample and prepared perfectly; the light cream sauce with portobello and other mushrooms were savory and delicious I paired the starters with a Sauvignon Blanc and tried a glass of Malbec with the entree; it\'s full spicy flavor was a compliment to the chop We finished with the chocolate bomb and a french press of fresh coffee - wonderful Black Hen earned every one of the five stars My wife and I came here for our anniversary I had notified the restaurant ahead of time of the special occasion and both the host and server greeted us with happy wishes for our anniversary - a very nice personal touch The food was fantastic The rosemary bread warrants a five star rating alone Service was great and the cadence of table visits was very well timed The only negative comment is that I\'m sorry they\'re not in our home town Exceptional wait staff who was very well educated in every part of the menu The new york steak was delicious; tender and flavorful and paired with the most delicious roasted potatoes; I didn\'t know potatoes could taste so great Be sure to save room for dessert; the chocolate bombe is TO DIE FOR Absolutely the most well put together restaurant in Blacksburg if not the entirety of southwest Virginia If you are looking for quality fine dining in a charming atmosphere The Black Hen cannot be beat I will be sure to bring family and friends here for years to come The cheese plate here is worth every penny and the cocktails are delicious and the bartender is very accommodating to requests It will continue to be my #1 cocktail spot in town Their food is expensive which means this should be a upscale restaurant with a good environment But it is not it is way too loud Waiters and managers don\'t want to do anything to stop some rude and loud customers from ruining everyone else\'s dinner In one word you spent the money but you can\'t get what you deserve Absolutely wonderful -- didn\'t have reservation so we sat in the bar We started with drinks and the cheese tray which was great We all ordered different meals and shared The duck lamb chops strip steak and crab cake were ALL amazing The bartender was also our server and he did a great job We will definately be back!! The Black Hen & Bar Blue is not worth the time and price I went there on a date with my boyfriend this past weekend and I have no intentions on going back The service we had was terrible the food was mediocre and overpriced and the venue made it nearly impossible to have a conversation without shouting across the table Service: From our arrival to our departure dinner took 25 hrs Way too long for a dinner if you ask me My boyfriend had made a reservation a week in advance and we still had to wait 15 min for our table Although our server was very friendly the service was terrible After being seated we were given our menus and placed our drink order He came back about 15 min later which we then placed an order for a cheese platter After placing the order our waiter said he would come back with our basket of bread It took 25 min till we got our cheese platter by someone other than him (so we couldn\'t place an order for our meal yet) 20 min later after we finished the platter he comes back to take our order for our main course 30 min later our meal arrives 10 min into our meal our bread basket arrives Funny doesn\'t the bread normally arrive BEFORE the meal? Our server doesn\'t return back to our table until the end of the meal to clear the table which was unfortunate since I needed to refresh my drink mid-way through my course Ironically enough he was able to come back right away with the dessert menu which took another 10 min to receive the actual dessert (which compared to the rest of the night was very swift) He came back 15 min after dropping off the check (because it takes that long to take out a credit card) gave us his farewell and left Food: I ordered the pork chops and my boyfriend ordered the duck His duck was fairly good but nothing spectacular but certainly better than my pork chops My pork chops were mediocre; the sauce it came with was extremely salty and too overpowering to the point where I had to scrape off the sauce just to enjoy the taste of the meat I will say the roasted potatoes and vegetables were very nice For the price I expected better (I\'ve had better) and a bit more unique The texture was great the taste was meh However the portions were a decent size; not so small like other high-end restaurants My favorite part of the night was the creme brulee we had for dessert It was absolutely perfect and although it didn\'t make up for the service it was a decent way to end the night The creme brulee is the reason why I gave this place a two star reviewVenue: To keep it short the restaurant was too small which made it extremely loud The acoustics of the restaurant was just terrible I was hearing conversations that were happening three tables away from us and found myself raising my voice and leaning across the table just to engage in a conversation Not an ideal place to have a date or dinner where you actually want to have a conversation instead of a headacheTo me the biggest disappointment of the night was the poor service which made the whole dining experience a drag I would\'ve expected more from a restaurant that claimed to be "fine dining" We went because we wanted farm fresh food The menu is small but with good variety Over priced for Blacksburg and some of the appetizer portions were pretty small We got the cheese plate and the ruby cocktail (our favorites) the soup of the day mixed lettuces salad ahi tuna crab cake (both seafood dishes were small) tofu pasta(good but not super special) chicken and flat iron steak (tender) Everything was delicious but nothing over the top with unique flavors minus the cheese plate My boyfriend and I just went here for our anniversary I ordered the sangria for a drink and it was amazing in its cute little mason jar I ordered the shrimp pasta and he got the mushroom chicken The vegetables were so fresh and the presentation was great! He absolutely loved his dinner (I\'ve never heard him say "this is so good!" So many times I thoroughly enjoyed my meal the shrimp were huge and fantastic I absolutely loved the atmosphere one of the classier establishments in the area The environment had a French feel to it I would highly recommend especially for a date night The restaurant is smaller which contributes to the romantic mood so I wouldn\'t recommend it for very large parties or plan on splitting into smaller groups Overall I highly recommend This was some of the best food I\'ve had in my life Small little restaurant with great service (we had Brice and he was the man) and a great atmosphere The food didn\'t take long to come out and the presentation was great If you are planning to have a cheap night out this is not the place to go BUT I highly recommend that you go at least once Dinner for two and a few drinks will set you back about $100 but definitely worth every cent Incredible Started off with an amazing seared ahi tuna Then had a pork dish in a cream sauce over pasta Dessert was the chocolate bombe that was out of this world I had my first trip to The Black Hen last night Let me start this by saying that a restaurant like The Black Hen is something that Blacksburg has desperately needed! Conceptually it is well executed with a coherent menu from start to finish a nice atmosphere and generally helpful staff (with one exception that I will get to later) My husband ordered the grouper entree and I had the flat iron steak Both entrees were delicious- flavorful and well seasoned however upon receiving them I wondered if perhaps they put both plates outside to chill before serving They were both stone cold! I have the distinct impression that both meals were plated and then sat to wait for my potatoes to be finished off as the potatoes were the only hot thing we received My steak was actually cool to the touch while the potatoes were piping hot At nearly $30 a plate I expect my food to be served warm I told the waiter that my food was cold and while he was gracious enough to offer to have another plate brought out he also told me that perhaps I shouldn\'t order my steak medium-rare if I wanted it hot Are you kidding me? So apparently my cold steak was my own fault! The last time I checked a medium-rare steak should be brick red in the center but still cooked and warm That is a big difference between a fully rare steak and medium-rare I got the distinct impression that I would really be putting our waiter out if I asked for a fresh cut of meat so I ate what was served as did my husband- but we left disappointed The dishes were wonderful in conceptualization and flavor- but the kitchen needs to work on its timing Letting food get cold in order for the potatoes to finish cooking is poor form (I really think that this is what happened) Hopefully over time The Black Hen will work out these kinks and get its stride In the mean time I will be returning again to give it another shot hoping for food of the same calibre served hot! *On a side note- while this was my first trip to The Black Hen it was my husband\'s second time going He said that it had improved from his first visit with food coming out more speedily Additionally the first time he went they charged the table for bread (seriously? Is that not compliments of the restaurant?) and this time they did not do that which I was happy to see I wonder if they had complaints about charging for bread and they changed their policy No more driving to Roanoke for a good dinner!! Finally Blacksburg has a sophisticated restaurant     small place small menu but everything was great Service was friendly and knowledgeable We had the cheese plate and the mixed greens salad a nice combination to start off with The steak filet and chicken were cooked perfectly and the sides were terrific Lively atmosphere friendly bar   looking forward to a return visit I brought visiting family to the Black Hen on recommendations from a few friends My first impression walking in was not amazing We went to open the door which looks like a "push" door Tried pushing a few times and then felt silly because it was a "pull" door We laughed it off then walked in and jokingly asked the hostess how many times she sees that a night She had absolutely NO response and instead stared at me blankly like I was an idiot didn\'t even ask if I had a reservation or how many were in our party I\'m a pretty chill person so I just moved right along and told her my name for our reservation She coolly showed us to our table and moved along She just didn\'t have a great "welcoming" presence (Contrast to the hostess and waitress we met at Poor Billy\'s the night before who were so friendly and genuine one point for Poor Billy\'s) Our waiter never introduced himself was very quiet and just wordlessly smiled at us every time he walked over but did a fine job (maybe he\'s an introvert?) Fortunately the food was AMAZING The flat iron steak had THE perfect seasoning cooked perfectly great asparagus and potatoes for a side The salmon was excellently cooked and came with a unique pasta (trofie) which I had never had and I\'m SO glad I did You could get the same dish of trofie with grouper instead of salmon (the grouper was fine nothing special) The best part of the salmon/grouper/trofie dish though was the best tomato sauce I\'ve ever had I don\'t think I\'ve EVER had a tomato sauce that I thought was anything special but I could have eaten it plain with a spoon (The pre-dinner focaccia bread was also delicious but charging an extra $1 per person for extra bread seems a little penny-pinching considering the cost for the entrees)Last we shared a few desserts -- the chocolate-nutella (molten cake) and vanilla (creme brle) Both were excellent (loved the fruit on the creme brle and the nutella ice cream) Nice touch at the end with small pieces of rich chocolate/nougat delivered with our billOverall four stars for the amazing menu and unique flavors that were perfectly done One star off for the less-than-welcoming staff Comparable in cost to the neighboring Poor Billy\'s maybe with a slightly more "serious" atmosphere (read: less-welcoming more stuffy) but the entrees were a little more unique as well (also a smaller menu than PB\'s)(Side Note: This restaurant needs to sort out their location on googlemaps because my googlemaps app on my iPhone kept trying to give me directions to Social House instead!) What a great place! Food was excellent and Brice our server was perfect! Hands down the best restaurant in Blacksburg The crab cakes and the steak are to die for Perfectly cooked and amazing flavor It isn\'t cheap but honestly totally worth the money For the NRV this might be the best "nicer restaurant" or "grownup" as another reviewer put it Its really not super fancy and the decor was a little weird (modern white walls matched with country cabinets and rooster quilts on wall- which was not my taste) But the food was good I think the food profile could still be enhanced as some were great and others ok I would say the portions are a bit on the small side I would HIGHLY suggest that the owners get a curtain from the ceiling or something else to put around the door area to keep the winter cold out If you are sitting near the door the breeze gets you The place is too small not to have a weather barrier there They also need an additional coat rack I love to cook and I\'m often disappointed when I eat out However the Black Hen is an exception The food is delicious and unique it\'s the only restaurant in Blacksburg that I don\'t mind spending significant money at It\'s worth the experience First don\'t expect to order what you see in pictures on yelp as complained about in an above rating; this menu changes from one week to the next Although a little noisy the food is worth the price and the atmosphere-C\'MON it\'s BLACKSBURG I read a complaint about waiting for a cocktail It\'s a small restaurant with one bartender Deal with it Perhaps whomever needs their alcohol that fast should have one at home before arrival or check into a 12 step program Food:Top 3 filet I\'ve ever had and I\'ve eaten all over the world I have been several times and very happy with everything I\'ve ordered Cheese plate not to disappoint I ordered the (local) heirloom tomato salad both times this summer which is my favorite and loved it Finally someone who can make it better than I can Never presented the same way twice using different cheeses and sauce reductions Service personable professional knowledgeably yet fun every time Love this place Posted on Google but I had to tell it again on yelp because Lefty\'s made my Friday!!Everything was fantastic! Thanks to George for putting all this together and thanks again to Giuseppe for being an awesome waiter We will be back soon This is my son\'s new favorite place to eat so we decided to check it out on a recent Saturday night visit At 7pm we had to wait a bit for a table which was not surprising for a party of 9 but it wasn\'t bad and smaller tables were being sat in a decent time We started with the spinach dip and nachos as an appetizer The spinach dip was flavorful but not as creamy as you would expect The nachos were definitely the better choice of the two - a decent size and good amount of toppings The kid had a burger (as several others at our table did They are a nice size and cooked as ordered A bit of a warning - they come on toasted sourdough (which is fine for me) but they have Kaiser rolls on request I had the steak au poivre It was a perfectly cooked NY Strip but on the thin side and had a lot of gristle The other person at our table experienced the same It came with a big pile of mashed potatoes (not a lot of flavor) and the veg of the day which was broccolini The sherry cream sauce was good but the quality of the meat means I probably won\'t order it again Hubby had the lasagna which was just "meh" in his words Our server was friendly but the timing was off We got our salads after our entrees and drinks remained unfilled We\'ll probably go again when visiting only because our adult son likes it but we\'ll stick to the burgers Excellent food selection! We went to Lefty\'s for lunch on a Saturday The hostess was great and showed us to a table right away The silverware was wrapped up in a paper napkin clean on inspection I hate when I\'m given utensils and they are smeared or not completely clean We started with sodas for the guys and coffee for me They have the best testing coffee I have ever had Nice full roast with no bitterness We ordered fried cheese curds for an appetizer only because we had never heard of it What a treat! Not greasy at all and the dipping sauce was great I ordered an ahi tuna salad It was presented so beautifully that I didn\'t want to touch it The tuna was pan seared and excellent! It was topped with crispy fried Asian noodles 10 out of 10 My son Rick had a Philly Cheese Steak with onions mushrooms bell peppers and melted cheese He said it\'s the best he\'s had in a long time Josh had a pesto cheese burger which he loved The side of onion rings was homemade and not greasy at all and the French fries were great!My only regret is that we hadn\'t found this gem sooner!
