It is only 10 minutes off the interstate" Sure why not? We pull into the parking lot of what was probably some sort of steak house in a previous life We get inside and discover it was some sort of oriental restaurant in yet another previous life - that or Lefty is into intricately carved wooden dioramic artwork pressed between two pieces of glass It was redone rather nicely - simple but seemed clean It is also a craft brewery But even I draw the line at beer for breakfasta thin line but a line nonetheless Is it 10:30 yet?Their breakfast specialties seem to be omelets and egg "scrambles" - basically an omelet\'s cooler brother - loose scattered - likes to party with all the ingredients - a free spirit as opposed to the uptight and tidy omelet Everyone got omelets - except one of us - yeah me I went with the special scramble of the day - a little bit of this a little bit of that and some more of that It came with there soon to be almost famous Lefty\'s potatoes! And the crowd goes mildThey were good - basically cubed potatoes with onions green peppers and this and that and something else Presentation is not their strong point If they wanted the potato serving to appear to be larger they would put them in a small bowl or put them in a stack using a smaller plate - sort of a culinary trompe l\'oeil (Google it) Instead they are scattered and strewn - wait are we Waffle House? - on half of a large dinner plate - well breakfast plate I guess plate names depend on the situation Were it midnight it could be an "I am drunk on my butt and am eating this to cure the munchies and hopefully sober up" plateThey offer different types of toast and in-house made bread Today was eggnog bread and apple cinnamon bread They were OK I would go back were I in the area - don\'t know it I would make a 20 minute detour again I went with my sister to Lefty\'s for the first time about two months ago The service wasn\'t all that great but the foodyum! I ordered the mango chicken sandwich and it was pretty f\'n great So great in fact that when I went for my back last night with my friends I ordered it again This time however my experience was the complete opposite of my first The service was awesome My mango chicken sandwichwas not I barely had any caramelized apples AND barely had any of the mango salsa Mostly just bread chicken and red peppers My mouth was so dry I had to ruin my buzz with a water Mixed feelings about this place but I\'ll give it another try We stopped around 10:30 AM on Sunday The restaurant had plenty of seats We were seated right away Our waitress was very friendly She walked us through the menu and provided some suggestionsWe started with beignets which was very cake-y It was more "solid" and more fried than a cake doughnut We did not like them at all We ordered Chorizo burrito Pimento Grilled Cheese French Toast and Jerk Chicken Omelet All the breakfast entrees were very good I tried a little of everything Pimento Grilled Cheese was simple with a little spiciness Chorizo burrito and Jerk Chicken Omelet were both very flavorful French Toast was crusted with cereal and cinnamon It was sweet even without the syrup Is this the only place for breakfast on Sunday in Blacksburg?? Apparently it is for large groups (a group being four or more people!) The entire time we were there I was fantasizing how I could open a breakfast location in Blacksburg and excel - just by serving hot food and remembering to refill coffee We had a group of six and we waited 40 minutes for a table Then about ten more for coffee and once we were served we waited again for our silverware Most of the food was cold by the time we were able to eat it The food was average And cold The servers were all friendly accommodating and to their credit working very very hard!! Probably just made some bad choices considering the other favorable reviews The beer was fine but not great Had a New England IPA and a Pale Ale The Pale was pretty yeasty For food I had a half order of the fried artichoke hearts peppers pineapple The half order was enough for 3-4 people More batter than peppers or artichokes Since it was pretty heavy I had an Asian chicken noodle salad It was ok but nothing more than lettuce canned mandarin oranges 6 chicken cubes and way too many fried noodles Only ate about 1/3 of the noodles which was plenty on the salad Overall there are better places to spend $30 bucks This place has the best short ribs I have ever had And the beer is good as well Just had the brunch and the omelet was perfect Lefty\'s has pretty good food but the service is less than par Truly a good place for a good Brew but not the place to go for good service We came here on a Sunday after the UVA game and there was a wait (which is normal) We were seated in about 25 mins which wasn\'t too bad The waitress was friendly but she was missing for most of the meal She didn\'t check up on us and because the food took so long we were constantly out of drinks We flagged her down 3 different times for refills and one time we just stopped another waitress who was walking by The food took forever!! There was 3 of us and we ordered one ham omelet one bacon egg sandwich and some version of a salsa verde scramble It took them 45 mins to bring us food! The plating of the food was also very sad Its Iike they didn\'t even try I\'m sure we could have cooked this for less at home We wanted to love this place but we were very disappointed in the quality of food I came here for the first time with my parents for lunch The staff was nice and it had a nice atmosphere but overall we were very disappointed in the food Spinach artichoke dip- THE DIP WAS TINY in comparison to the amount of chips we got and the size of the plate It would\'ve been better if they just gave us less chips The dip itself tasted good but it was such a small amount Cream of porcini mushroom soup- 5 stars; it was BOMB I personally love soups and this was one of the best cream of mushroom soups I have ever had Had a very full flavor and was not too heavy The porcini mushrooms really give it a deep mushroom flavor Jerk chicken sandwich- parents said it was okay not too good and not enough flavor "Not enough jerk" -dad Ahi tuna salad- 1 star; this salad was disgustingly sweet The cashew brittle is coated in sugar and the sesame ginger dressing was also unusually sweet It also only came with 5 small pieces of ahi tuna that were not seared enough at the edges It was pretty hard to eat Overall- maybe we didn\'t order the right things on the menu but that\'s not an excuse The overall quality and taste was very disappointing except for the BOMB CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP I love Lefty\'s! It is so good but can get pretty crowded especially at dinner time on a weekend It\'s less busy at lunch time or early dinner -- we went at 4 pm and there was still a good number of tables that were taken but we were seated and had good service throughout the night I\'m not a beer drinker so can\'t comment on the brewery and quality of it but my grandpa had a few and really enjoyed it The BLT is very good! Also had the avocado grilled cheese and it was great and it is one of the cheapest things on the menu Sandwiches are on the cheaper side on the menu and they also have more expensive options The brunch is very good as well but super busy on weekends expect a wait However the brunch menu is so good! Everything is good highly recommend Always a great go to spot at VT! Good happy hour deals We always get the pulled pork and truffle Mac and cheese flatbread Absolutely delicious! The service is always awesome! They even always fulfill my request for an extra pickle on my boyfriend\'s pickle beer so i can steal it :) These two stars are for the brewery I sit at the bar and order fresh beer Hell I\'ll give it a third star now for the bar And the staff who have to serve the consistently uninspiring menu; they are always doing good work (and the ones who don\'t don\'t last) I have seen this place go through cooks/chefs like "insert fast moving thing here" Not even close to it\'s sister restaurant 622 North but that\'s a different review The menu was sort of fresh back in 2008 when it was a tiny sandwich shop but it\'s dated now and apparently Frank can\'t find anyone to execute the darned thing You\'re a full-fledged restaurant now Time to step it up Lately I\'ve seen some dinner specials that look promising like sous vide short rib with pureed parsnips but y\'all are still over dressing fish Fish doesn\'t need a bunch of fancy clothes just cook it perfectly and give me a bit of thoughtful sauce Stop saying (and serving) veg du jour Compose the dish If you wanna cut costs then reduce the size of the menu and send it back to 2008 where it barely belongedBut the brewery is making magic Guess I better pop on over to their yelp and share the good newsAvoid the sheep at brunch by sitting at the bar Have some time to kill Make friends with the staff Game day brunch? didn\'t eat but one bite The server was friendly but not super attentive I might go again to pick up a chicken salad sandwich but other than that I\'m not sure Had dinner here last night and we had the most amazing waitress Erin She was fun knowledgeable and gave wonderful service Ask for her because it is the best service that we have had here Find was goid we had spinach dip appetizer and burgers Meals were good Erin was there throughout the meal but no in an obtrusive way She made the evening a delight As a VT alum I\'d heard great things about Lefty\'s and only got the chance to dine after graduating The menu looked amazing for brunch so my sister and I decided to try something new and venture over Something strange to us was that brunch was only served until 11:30 am (Sat and Sun) however if you got there before 11:30 am you could still order off the brunch menu The wait was about 15 minutes when we arrived but we were sat no more than five minutes later Our server was prompt in taking our drink orders despite the busy restaurantMy sister and I decided to split the Croque Sandwich as well as the Pimento Grilled Cheese while my dad opted for the Bacon and Apple Omelet (which came with an option of either white wheat or rye toast) Our food didn\'t take too long probably 10 minutes max I guess we didn\'t read the menu close enough as the Croque Sandwich was on sourdough FRENCH TOAST Neither of us cared for the sweetness The inside flavors were good but there wasn\'t enough sauce to cover all the meat Traditionally a croque is battered and baked/fried but this one was neither The Pimento Grilled Cheese was not as named or described The menu boasted "Homemade spicy pimento cheese scrambled eggs and tomato on grilled sourdough bread" but rather it was scrambled eggs MIXED with pimento cheese and buttered bread Not grilled cheese and severely lacking pimento Either the name or description of this item needed to change Luckily the omelet was unique and delicious so 1/3 here! Service was solid restaurant was clean and plenty of parkingConsidering the low prices ($27 for all three plates + a drink) it isn\'t a bad deal I\'d be willing to try it again for lunch Keep an eye out for the high food tax ~12%! Great place for a quick and casual lunch or brunch Really cute atmosphere and great service I really liked the burger and my egg scramble Good amount of food and quality for the money A year has passed since I posted my initial review Since then I\'ve become a frequent customer because the food is the best in the New River Valley I have not had a problem similar to what I experienced on that one occasion but I have had some incredible dishes I strongly recommend the salad sampler beef Wellington the lamp chops and the shrimp and grits In addition to the amazing food I have found the front of the house to give exemplary service A bad review now turns to an unqualified five stars This is a fantastic spot for lunch or dinner They have a diner side for families and a bar side for adults sandwich We tried the brown ale the double IPA and the West Coast IPA We loved the brown and the double IPA the best We highly recommend Lefty\'s and can\'t wait to come back When visiting Blacksburg I wanted to eat at a local place versus the abundance of chain restaurants that pop up I selected Lefty\'s based on several positive reviews and its proximity to where I was staying The food we ate was delicious and I believe locally sourced It came pretty quickly and was reasonably priced as well My problem with this place is the atmosphere It\'s a mixture of boring and awkward The place is tiny and I felt like I was eating in someone\'s house that I wasnt invited to The decor is outdated and the waiters seem to be having a conversation right on top of you (why are they holding lengthy conversations anyways?)I would be interested in trying their brunch outside if the weather was nicebut then again brunch on a busy street is not ideal This place doesn\'t have a huge menu nor does it wouldn\'t turn down meeting people there if that was where they had already decided on going We had a nice meal at Lefty\'s while visiting our son at Virginia Tech before the UNC-VT basketball game I I\'m from California but find myself in Blacksburg from time to time as my significant other goes to school there I don\'t usually find myself too impressed with restaurants in the Burg as California has spoiled me when it comes to quality food However I grabbed dinner at Lefty\'s with the BF recently and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised! We dined in on a Saturday night and Lefty\'s was buzzing with business When I asked the hostess how long the wait would be she told me that she could estimate that it would take about half an hour but it really depended on how fast people were clearing their tables I really appreciated her honesty as I feel that some hosts completely BS the wait time when asked We ended up being seated in about 15 minutes Awesome! I don\'t remember our server\'s name but he was a cool and polite dude He gave us just the right amount of attention - we felt taken care of but didn\'t feel smothered Lefty\'s has a great beer selection! It was one of the first things I noticed upon looking at their menu I ordered the classic cheeseburger with a side of onion rings and my boyfriend ordered the South of the Border burger with fries I enjoyed my burger a lot and the onion rings were perfect! (I\'m really picky about onion rings too) I especially love how Lefty\'s uses sourdough bread for the bun of their burgers I wish more restaurants did that! There were a few downsides though My boyfriend\'s burger was cooked unevenly Half of his burger was medium rare and half of it was medium well I\'m not really sure how they managed to do that but he enjoyed it nonetheless The fries were also lackluster and bland Overall I really enjoyed my dining experience at Lefty\'s After the dinner I had there I\'m dying to try their breakfast! local feel - lunch/dinner specials rotating beer taps a quirky but fun left-handed-centric decor and the owner comes in every weekend to cook breakfasts because that\'s simply what he enjoys doing The owner a good aquantaince of mine says he will dream up crazy concoctions of food and pitch them to the chefs to try to pull off - this results in some amazing meals you won\'t typically find on a menuThere are some true hidden gems on the menu if you like to get adventurous such as the cyclops (bacon pancake with an overeasy egg cooked into the center) and the potatoes pancakes are my two I\'ve never had a problem here Now on to the food obviously the best part Make sure you check out the specials before you order off the menu They always sound delicious and unique! I can\'t talk about one specific dish being my favorite because I try and order new dishes every time I come! My mom absolutely loves the Turkey Reuben (My parents ask to come to leftys every time they visit I\'m never opposed to a free leftys trip) I\'ve tried it and I understand why she loves it The burgers are awesome too they are served on a thin slice of bread rather than a bun which I love because it is the perfect amount of bread for the piece of meat I\'ve gotten 2 of the salads as well The Cobb salad has the best dressing ever I was a little hesitant to order it at first because Cobb salads can be pretty plain but this dressing that came in it deserves some sort of award We also tried the nachos last time! The chips were perfect nachos chips that didn\'t fall apart or get soggy However don\'t get the "super nachos" if you\'re not a huge fan of sweet chili Even if you\'re a righty you should give it a chance And remember to check the blackboard for some specials We were looking for some good hot food this past chilly Saturday after a wedding After reading the Yelp reviews we decided to try Lefty\'s since it wasn\'t too far from our hotel We arrived near the tail-end of their dinner rush but it only took a few minutes to get seated Our waitress was cheerful helpful and patient as I struggled to pick my entree (too hungry) For our appetizers we ordered the calamari which was pretty good It wasn\'t too deeply fried or heavily breaded but I think they could have been seasoned a little lighter We also got the homemade potato chips w/the lime & cilantro dipping sauce After a few dunks of the sauce I thought it was \'meh\' and just ate the chips While I could see they were trying to offer "out of the box" dipping sauces my sauce was oil-based and didn\'t add anything to the chip There\'s a place in the Seattle area called The Ram and THEY know how to offer up hot homemade potato chips w/creamy garlicky dips!! I think my memory of those chips clouded my expectation of these chips Next time I\'d just get the chips w/out a dip My hubby ordered the Founders Porter and loved it! Our entrees were pretty good He got the bacon cheeseburger and thought it was tasty and cooked according to his wishes I got the jumbo lump crab cake sandwich It was served on a lightly toasted brioche-type sliced bread w/avocado on the bottom bun Though I asked them to hold their chili-based sauce it came out with it so I scrapped it off Before deciding on the crab cake I asked my waitress if it had a lot of "filler" in it Of course she said \'no\' but I would say \'yes\' There wasn\'t a lot of lump crabmeat in it but since it\'s not like we\'re eating next to the Chesapeake Bay I should have expected as much I ordered a bev that almost didn\'t come but again our waitress was responsive apologetic and cheerful Our local friends tell us this is a great place for brunch and that unlike most restaurants their "specials" are truly that - special and made from fresh ingredients not leftovers Good to know Since my hubby enjoyed his porter so much we may go back next time we\'re in town I\'ll update my review then This is a cute southern / NOLA mock up of a restaurant in Blacksburg Had brunch here one Saturday morning when I was back in town for a wedding We started with the beignets which were more like breakfast hush puppies than the traditional NOLA beignet That\'s ok they were delicious and served with syrup If you\'re not in a rush I suggest trying these I continued with the bacon and apple omelet which did an excellent job of infusing crumbled blu cheese bacon sauteed apple slices into an omelet It came with home fries which were actually pretty bad but it could possibly be the outshine by the omelet that had me looking down on the side dish The sourdough toast tasted pretty good it sounded as if it was made fresh on site but maybe not Overall I would recommend this place if you\'re in town and wanting brunch or breakfast We\'ve been eating here for years; was disappointed with our service and and food quality tonight Brought home 2 burgers and on one the lettuce/tomato/onion was omitted The guacomole we ordered was brown and warm The slaw was warm And we only live half mile from the restaurant so the warm temperature of these foods did not occur on the way home Not worth $30 The restaurant was not busy at the time Really good food I had a BLT with pesto mayo and a red cabbage slaw The sandwich was naturally salty so I\'m glad I didn\'t go with fries My sister and her husband each had salads the Lefty and the Righty respectively My sister lives in Blacksburg and loves the place We sat outside which was a nice option but the patio is right on a fairly busy road near shopping areas I wouldn\'t mind spending more time there and experience the beverage side of the operation but at least the service was good Arrived for lunch with some great reviews from friends Their lunch menu is apparently a little smaller than the dinner so if you want the full experience I may suggest waiting until dinnertime!As someone who LOVES sourdough bread over the bland boring white bread Lefty\'s really hit the spot for me I ordered the Lefty\'s burger which came out on sourdough over the conventional burger buns At first I was a little thrown off but as I took that first bite my worries all went away It was cooked exactly how I had ordered and tasted great with the perfect combination of veggies cheese and a juicy pattyI think the fact that it is a little farther than the rest of Main St\'s food offerings is a little off-putting for people to want to consider going to Lefty\'s for a meal but I encourage anyone that doesn\'t mind taking a few extra minutes to drive away from the main downtown area to come take a seat here! Their food is definitely worth it and I am really glad that I got a chance to eat here before I graduated! Early dinner right when they opened for the evening hours is the perfect time to go since it is not busy and the servers are more attentive Fun decor and delicious specials! Highly recommend the Caribbean Pork Pasta and Smores cheesecake if they have it! Their Lefty\'s salad is the bomb! And service is always great I\'m vegetarian and there are several great options for me as well as others with dietary restrictions We came at 2:00 on a Friday for lunch so the crowdedness everyone talks about was not an issue Me and my husband visit my parents in Blacksburg and when we do we like to try new restaurants almost everyday as the food here is so incredibly cheap! My parents recommended this to us We had good service the hostess and our waitress However the food was nothing special Really basic basic diner food it was good- not bad in anyway at all just nothing amazing Blacksburg has some pretty good places so I probably won\'t be back here- maybe to try the breakfast shrimp and grits because that\'s supposed to be good- but I won\'t come back for lunch or dinner just because I would rather go somewhere where I\'m going to have something amazing This is not amazing just basic diner food On the up side- good service the place was clean and convenient location if you are staying near the downtown area of Blacksburg I was there to celebrate a special event with my husband but the place was too noisy for our taste We enjoyed the food and the service was friendly I have never had a bad meal here The food is reasonably priced and the service has been outstanding Best casual fare place in Blacksburg As good as it gets except I love love breakfast and was disappointed they stop serving at a certain point on a Sunday Otherwise I would have given 5 stars for personable service and food Fresh brewed iced tea is always important as well Sourdogh bread made a simple BLT amazing and the pesto a fabulous surprise Knowing I had my dog in the car (cool day outside and in shade) server gave me a piece of bacon to take to him Wonderful food and service!! Location is much improved over older one a block away Favorite brunch in Blacksburg Very busy on a Sunday morning - could use a better layout to take advantage of unused space in there as well as bring in more kitchen staff to provide quicker service Food was great Server was wonderful - very friendly and concerned about when we would get our food served Overall a great experience and we\'ll be back! Lefty\'s is out go-to weekend breakfast/brunch spotLunch time is great as well Salads with some meat usually do the trickFood is consistent and the different "special" bread selection is pretty coolStaff is courteous knows the menu and have always been accomodating and patient with our kidsThe coffee could be MUCH better but other than that we are very happy with Lefty\'s andwill continue to be repeat customers you cant find a better place !!!!!!!! great food great staff and great atmosphere!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  A Blacksburg Original!!!!!!!!!!! I came in to Leftys on Saturday with some family to go to the Va Tech game We sat outside on the patio since it was so pretty First the hostess that greeted us had great smile and was very friendly Our server came out and introduced herself Her name was Jessica she took our drink order and was very prompt with getting them We even got some beers that they brew right there in house Since none of us had eaten there before we asked unfortunately lots of questions but instead of the usual of a college town we received a smile and wonderful answers from Jessica I got the Emerald Kale Salad that was recommended and might I say it was fantastic My only issue was it didn\'t have enough dressing on it Which when I asked I received Everyone at the table loved their food and loved the recommendations given by our server At the end of our meal we asked how long she\'d worked there and explained that she was new to Leftys and appreciated all of us being patient with her while she was still learning If she hasn\'t told us she was new i would have thought she\'d been there awhile Either they know how to hire new employees or train them well Good job all around and we will be returning and hopefully can get our wonderful server again "this round and plump beef patty on toasted sandwich bread what the heck is oh wow that\'s actually pretty good" I wasn\'t sure what to expect going to Lefty\'s but I guess they have some unusual menu items that take interesting to delicious I REALLY REALLY wanted to try the Buffalo Chicken Omelette but they only served it for breakfast Too bad my time in Blacksburg has expired and I can\'t give this place another shot :(Leftys gets most of their praise from me due to their impeccable cooking of my chili cheese burger The patty was just cooked perfectly and the chili was pretty good as well My friend ordered a bowl of chili and a salad and those looked pretty well executed as well They also have a decent selection of beers on tap I would have wanted to try the milk stout but was aching a bit much in the stomach to give it a shotI wasn\'t too sure about putting my chili cheese burger on toast instead of bun but I at best It\'s kind of expensive for lunch especially since they have a lunch menu I got the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and my boyfriend got the Jerk Chicken Philly Most of the items on the menu were okay/pretty good but I could find something better elsewhere for the same price that they charged Been to the new location twice in the last couple weeks Both times we were able to find a seat in the bar area right away The service was prompt and very friendly Their beer list is very good The in house brewery Right Mind Hop Yards beer features hops grown at Virginia Tech and is delicious Food both visits has been served promptly and tasted great The pimento grilled cheese sandwich is a favorite I had heard from a local that Lefty\'s was super delicious and was sorely disappointed when I finally tried it out Pros and cons below:PROS:-Amazing server with a huge smile on her face who was very attentive-Great outdoor seating-Good menu selection-The homemade potato chips were goodCONS:-GREASY I was at a large table and tried a sampling of various appetizers and entrees and noticed that everything was drowning in oil I could not finish my sandwich because it was soaking wet from butter/oil yearsfinally a place that serves edible and creative food Plus a decent bar where you aren\'t going to lose your hearing by simply sitting there for a pre dinner cocktailNot sure what the issues some of your reviewers had with Leftys but my wife son and I along with another couple and their son (frat brothers) ate their 3 straight meals and each was simply delicious Creative interesting and well Definitely a Blacksburg treat! I\'ve heard good things about Lefty\'s but was always skeptical because of the mustard/red color scheme and the comic sans lookalike used as their banner fontA friend told me the menu was pretty eclectic for Blacksburg and after checking it out online I decided to give it a chance Unfortunately after a long night I was unable to make it for brunch but we were still made it for a lazy Sunday afternoonAfter perusing the menu I decided on the ham and asparagus sandwich which consisted of deli ham asparagus slivers and walnuts on a toasted hoagie roll with herbed goat cheese slathered on The combination of flavors created a nice balance - especially with the asparagus and ham I wish the goat cheese came out a little bit more Bold combination but I wish the goat cheese had more of an effectThe real winner that was ordered was the Lefty\'s burger that my friend got The burger had a homey feel to it The chuck meat was rolled into a dense and thick patty that was seared to medium perfection Instead of a regular bun they used a hearty and crunchy sour dough bread On top of the patty was roasted red peppers and caramelized onions with the herbed goat cheese making another appearance The roasted red pepper and goat cheese complemented each other perfectly While the burger was slightly small it was definitely delicious If you\'re looking for something different than your regular sandwiches and burgers for decent prices (all under $10) - come to Lefty\'s! I\'m definitely going to give this place another try I was pleasantly surprised after walking in it\'s a hole in the wall! Their beers were outstanding and the food was equally good The atmosphere is nothing special but it\'s not about the appearance it\'s about the food and beer The chimichurri steak with risotto and lightly cooked root vegetables was as good as it gets The seasoning for the chimichurri was not a soupy sauce but nice freshly chopped spices The risotto and the vegetables were just as good The customers were students and locals and everyone was friendly enough to a stranger The Right Mind Brewing beers are made on-site and the Mandarina pale ale and the DIPA were crisp and perfectly hopped I sat at the bar so I can\'t comment about table service but the bar service was great and the food was delivered promptly This is not an elegant place but the food I had was as good or better than what I\'ve had at much more pretentious restaurants I\'d give it another half star if the Yelp app had that option Lefty\'s has become my new favorite You can never go wrong with their beer and salads Most specials are just simply divine Lefty\'s salad is my fav but there are just many things on their menu to enjoy As far as local goes this is a must try for any passer by and should be a regular for any local This place is one of our girls night favorite spots! I highly recommend it!! I am so excited to have found this place! It is an unexpected gem in Blacksburg that makes use of quality ingredients and some creativity in its kitchen My friend and I visited for an early dinner on a Saturday night Unfortunately for us they were out of the duck confit salad so we\'ll have to go back! We split the blue cheese bruschetta which was a sizable portion and perfect for two perhaps three people The sourdough was crisp the tomatoes were juicy the cheese was stinky and flavorful; what more could you ask for in an appetizer? We then split the mahi-mahi dish with risotto cake and green beans We were pleasantly surprised when the waitress arrived at our table with two equal halved portions of fish risotto green beans etc Honestly considering how generous they were with our "half" portions I\'d be hesitant to order a full order for myself The fish was spiced well the green beans were perfectly cooked and the risotto cake was creamy spicy and delicious I can\'t wait to go back and try some other dishes from their menu Service was a bit over-eager however I think we were out waitress\'s only table and I\'d prefer prompt service over neglectful service so I suppose I should not complain YAY Lefty\'s My fianc and I came here for a late breakfast on a Saturday because we read some solid reviews on yelpWe weren\'t disappointed! The service was friendly large portions and the sun was out and we enjoyed the deck out frontParking was on a private lot and ample Very relaxed atmosphere and affordable pricesOne small note - the eggs seemed have chili of some sort and had a little bit of a kick Amazing food as always We absolutely love the new location! Staff is always very personable and wonderful to talk to Way to go guys on a successful first week! Text length is defined by how many words are present, the fundamental building block. This was found by coutning the split-ed strings in all collected text.

In [3]:
data['Text Length'] = data.Text.str.split().str.len()
#p = len([w for w in tuple(data.Text.str.split().str) if w in positives])
#n = len([w for w in bag if w in negatives])

data['Positive Count'] = data.Text.str.split().map(lambda b: len([w for w in b if w in positives]))
data['Negative Count'] = data.Text.str.split().map(lambda b: len([w for w in b if w in negatives]))
data['PN Difference'] = data['Positive Count'] - data['Negative Count']
data

1655 rows × 10 columns

A cursory glance at word counts allows a simple prediction: higher PN difference among Blacksburg restaurants. Histograms plotting the positive and negative word counts show this is indeed the case, as there are far more positive words being used than negative in this dataset.

In [4]:
data['Positive Count'].plot.hist()
Out[4]:
<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot at 0x23027b096d8>
In [5]:
data['Negative Count'].plot.hist()
Out[5]:
<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot at 0x230283ada20>
In [6]:
data['PN Difference'].plot.hist()
Out[6]:
<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot at 0x2302831e7f0>

To determine the accuracy of the word dictionaries, points were colored by Yelp's star rating system.

To determine whether passionate reviews were more often positive or negative from the restaurant customer's side (assumed to be reviews that take a larger amount of effort to write), text length PN Difference were graphed on the x and y axes respectively in a scatter plot. Passionate reviews on the restaurant customer's side are define text length.

To determine whether passionate reviews were more often positive or negative from the Yelp customer's side (assumed to be reviews that offer a critical perspective), points were sized by the handy Useful parameter, which is what Yelp customers define as passionate in this analysis.

In [7]:
sp = data.plot.scatter(x = 'Text Length', y = 'PN Difference', s = data.Useful + 1 * 5, c = 'Stars',
              colormap = pp.cm.cool , figsize = (15, 12), sharex = False)
sp;

Reviewers are most likely motivated to post a review by negative experiences. The outliers of text length seem to be positive by analyzing PN Differences alone. However, actual star data shows that besides a single long positive review, most long reviews are neutral at best.

The current iteration of the PN Difference serves as a horrible predictive variable. It can't even predict base star ratings correctly due to the massive amount of positive reviews with negative PN-Ds and negative reviews with immensely positive PN-Ds. Until improvements in sentiment analysis are made, the Star ratings will be the most reliable form of positive/negative data.

One fact we know for sure that this analysis revealed is that Blacksburg Yelp customers thought that negative reviews were the more helpful ones .My first assumption is that once restaurants cross a "good enough" threshold, consumers stop caring. If they find an impressively scathing review, they may think "wow, dodged a bullet this time," and rate it as useful as thanks for the heads-up.

If I wanted to continue my analysis, I would continue the analysis of the Useful metric and Star ratings with Yelp review data from other cities, such as my hometown of Richmond (a hidden foodie destination).
